text: I ordered room service ... the young girl who gave me my meal was just the sweetest .... smiling and all happy ... so nice to be treated that way when you are tired and grumpy. I ordered something simple .. A tomato salad ... oh my god ... i hope my message got to the person who made this salad : colorful , tasty, explosion of flavors in my mouths, surprising and wonderful plate : thank you you just litteraly change my mood with your salad ....i never thought something so simple can be made so good .... thank you . Thank you for everything .I am adding also : you brought heaven into my mouth with your chocolate dessert .

The hotel is at a great location, but it's really a motel, not hotel, & definitely not a resort by any means, other than the price and resort fee.Our room was small & outdated. The bed and pillows are so uncomfortable that my neck was sore the next morning. Bathroom was tiny with outdated fixtures with no place to put any toiletries. No breakfast, and only valet parking.  There's a swimming pool & hot tub but not very attractive. There's a room next to the pool with ping pong table & a foosball table. However, the roof was leaking badly from the rain & the ping pong table was all wet with water.The stairs to the rooms are quite old & the elevator as well. I don't think I'd stay here for even $100 a night. This place really needs a serious makeover badly. You'd come here for the location & the ocean, but not for a comfortable stay. The staff was very pleasant and professional.

This place is friggin awesome. The vibe and location is exceptional. The view from the suite was gorgeous. It was big and spacious with plenty of room but lacking adequate seating for our party of 5. Only a small desk in the corner of the master with 1 chair and 2 chairs on the balcony. While exploring the room the kids found a bunch of trash hidden behind the furniture, i.e. food packaging, empty cans of Red Bull, etc. No big deal, we dealt with it.I did have one major issue: access into and out of the suite.You see, I'm a high functioning quadriplegic that uses a wheelchair for mobility. (A pretty compact manual wheelchair because I'm not that big of a dude. (165 lbs.)) The entrance to the suite was a foyer, directly to a staircase. The only way for me to get into our suite was by an elevator that was located down around a corner of the building, through a lounge like hang out area,  in the back (or bottom) of the kitchen storage for the restuarant located on a lower level, which was blocked by crates of whatever. (If my wheelchair was a little wider, or if I was in a powerchair, I don't think I would have fit). Okay, not too bad, it was kinda fun rolling through a party seeing all the beautiful people imbibing on a gorgeous Southern California spring afternoon). Once in the elevator, it wouldn't go up! My wife had to go back up to the lobby and get help. After about 10 minutes, an engineer came because a key is needed to access the 3rd floor suite. (We were never made aware of that). The key didn't work, so as we waited inside the elevator, he went upstairs and called it up so we could get in the suite. We were told that going down would not be an issue. We spoke with the staff and they were very apologetic. I just decided to stay and enjoy the view from the suite while my family enjoyed the property and amenities because I didn't really feel like dealing with the elevator issue since we were only staying for one night. Inside the room was super spacious and the bathrooms were probably the most wheelchair friendly I have ever been in. The bed was extremely high and very difficult for me to get into. Definitely couldn't have gotten up by myself.When it came time to check out and leave, the elevator would not come up. WTF. (In my mind I'm thinking what would happen if there was an emergency and I had to get out quick?!) I was stuck. We called the front desk, they said they would send somebody. (Mind you, it was 11am, time to check out). After about 15 minutes, nobody came so my wife went up to the lobby. The front desk supervisor apologized and offered to comp us an extra hour in the suite. It was already 11:20 by that point. She emphasized that they never offer an extra hour for that suite. Hello! I am still stuck in the room!Shortly after that, the head engineer came up with the proper key for the elevator. He informed us that the elevator key should have been issued to us along with our room key at the time of check-in. UGH!Ultimately, they credited us the cost of our valet fee.I would definitely recommend this place to all of my able-bodied friends. My handicapped friends, not so much.

Not too shabby. I read a lot of the reviews before booking here, and I'm happy to say that this hotel was pretty solid. It's convenient to the beach and downtown Laguna.Check in/out was fairly easy and all the staff were really friendly. We stayed in room #71, and although we didn't have a patio, we could still see and hear the ocean from our window. Since we were staying here for our anniversary, the hotel gave us a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine. Nice! I always appreciate the special touches some hotels do.Room was quiet during our stay and the seets and bathroom were clean...although the sheets were kind of "papery" (if that's even a texture). Room came with A/C and heat, and cable TV.We took advantage of the jacuzzi which was warm and bubbly. The pool was heated too and stayed up late (10pm).Driftwood Kitchen is on the PE property and it's an absolutely beautiful restaurant with delicious breakfast options.Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. I would definitely check out their hotel packages and discounted rooming before booking full price though.Note: If you can't find street parking, you'll have to pay the $34 to valet.

I cannot believe this hotel gets the ratings it does. It isnt really even a hotel. It has 5 star hotel prices, but at best 2 star quality. The one positive...  location.   Laguna Beach property isnt cheap, and this one is right near waters edge.  Easy access to the beautiful beach.   Beyond prime location and beach access, this felt like a typical beach side motel.  Horribly tight parking lot when you check in.  Accident waiting to happen.  Price does not include $34 valet fee and additional facility fee.  The property is very old, with rust and deterioration noted on support structures, stairs, and all around.   Property is comprised of several buildings,  some facing city street, others down the hill closer to the water.  Our so called, newer,  renovated room was very small, and very old.  Sink was about 22x22#   no room to put anything on counter.  Toilet sometimes needed multiple flushes.  Carpet was old and sticky in the room.  Doors face exterior elements, non secure.   Outside carpets had years of sand on it.    Really a 1 star place in a great location.   Most roadside motel chains are far nicer.  Coffee maker in the room.   Charging port was convenient thought.   Cold water and bad coffee in the lobby lounge.    But lemon water was a nice touch.  Staff was very friendly and pleasant. I would probably opt never to stay here again, given price and quality.   Even at any price, the quality is barely marginal.

I was here for the bungalow with the company I worked with and it was so fun!Pet friendly and server (Summer, I think?) came to take orders occasionally as well. It did take her a while to come back each time but probably because she's busy with other guests as well. Something that confused me was that a random family was wondering if they could sit at the porch area and we explained that we paid for our space. So they sat at the porch next to ours but their kids decided to peek through the doors of our room. Not blaming the family or hotel here. But I'm assuming anyone can walk through the gates and walk through your doors so be careful of your belongings.They also have a inspector that comes in often to check if you brought in food or drinks. You're not allowed to and they will confiscate it. You will get it back by the end of the day. Food wise, everything was pretty good but it does take a while to come. Overall, great view and space. In front of ocean and next to Driftwood Kitchen as well. Parking is expensive at the hotel and priced by hour at Driftwood. So hopefully you get lucky with street parking! Great company get together here. Definitely recommend!

The review initially started off as a 1 star.  We had a rough first day/night.  The next morning Josh the manager contacted me in the morning and addressed all of our concerns.  By the time we got back from the beach everything we had an issue with had been resolved.  The way things were handled the next day when Josh got in was great.  The staff tried to fix things the first night but were unable, but they did try.  Once the entire staff and Josh were in, things got handled perfectly.  Thank you.

Listen, if you're expecting facilities like you'll find at Surf & Sand or the Ritz in Laguna Niguel,  you are going to be disappointed.  However, if you want a centrally located, ocean front, comfortable room, (although dated), Pacific Edge is perfect.I suggest you try and stay in the Reef Tower. At high tide, the ocean is practically under your balcony! The sound of the waves are right outside your slider and will lull you to sleep. Many of the rooms in the other buildings have limited or no ocean view. Keep in mind The Reef does not have an elevator so if your physically disabled,  be sure to book a room on the ground (parking lot) level so you avoid any stairs to your room.The front office staffer "Dillon" was very accomadating when we needed to change rooms to ground level. He also had a microwave oven sent to our room when we decided one would be convenient. Dillion is a definate asset to the Hotel and hopefully Hotel Management recognizes that fact. So, if you need a great place to stay right on the ocean and you're not wortied about some frills you get at more expensive places that you often don't even use, Pacific Edge is the place...ask for Dillon!
My Wife and I just spent the evening at the Pacific Edge Hotel in a room with an ocean view and a balcony.  Had an absolute blast.  The view was amazing, as was the staff.  Would definitely go back.

It's all about the VIEW. If you expect more than that, you will be disappointed. Rooms are old, but there's lots of room and a mini frig if you get one in the REEF area. Room service food is actually dam delicious- note the 18% they add to the menu prices, however! OH THE SOUND OF THE OCEAN. There is NO Laguna on the Beach deal like this- (Groupon deal) Yes, $34 for parking. Resort Fee. Friendly staff. Great location in the city.

When I booked the room over the phone, I was told it included breakfast for two.  Once at the hotel, I was told it was a $30 credit towards breakfast.  Also when we went to have breakfast, I was told that there would be a 45 minute wait because I had no reservation.  I was very unhappy about this since I was never told about a $30 credit or having to make reservations to have breakfast at the hotel.  Our breakfast for 2 ended up costing $65 with tip.  However the breakfast was delicious.Our room was on the third floor and there was no elevator.  We were a family of 3 with many bags and a stroller and it was quite difficult to take our luggage and baby stroller up and down the stairs.  When we were ready to check out, I was not able to reach the front desk to request a bellboy/valet to come help us with our bags. They had a busy signal.   I feel I should have been told when I booked my stay that there was no elevator.   Although the hotel is dated, I feel it was worth the price I paid.  It is cute, clean, great ocean views, friendly staff, and towel/lounge chair service on the beach which was a great convenience.

We just checked in and there was the most glorious, most sweetest woman at the desk. Chantal was her name. Long black hair, kindest employee, ever. We originally booked our room using Groupon and the view was essentially nothing. I mentioned that this was a last-minute getaway and that I had lost my dear, dear mother in April. This young woman helped us find a room with a glorious view and even treated me with a bottle of Chardonnay. Just had a delicious lunch and we are now relaxing in our impeccably clean room with the most gorgeous view of the ocean. We will be visiting this place again and again! And thank you Pacific edge hotel for hiring such kind, empathetic humans! The mattress and bedding was divine. Food is delicious! The manager of this hotel is also helpful and completely amazing.

This is a MOTEL, not a hotel. Overpriced. Both pools were dirty. The hot tub was luke warm. The parking was $35 but we parked across the street, on the street for free. The rooms need to be updated. No free breakfast. I don't think I'll ever stay here again. Better off at the Holiday Inn down the street. Unless you can afford a beachfront updated room don't waste your time!

Skip this place at least until they renovate. Both rooms has horrible leaks, very outdated. The building right next door is an eye sore to look at. The room was freezing. Small old fashion wall heater.I am sure it will be wonderful after the much needed renovation

I used to live in the area about ten years ago. I'm looking forward to visiting a bit later this week, and to hearing the waves crash from my room!So far the online process (for booking has been a breeze. I'll be updating this review soon! Updating my Review:The check-in process was super easy, and Dylan (at the front desk) was very polite and welcoming. The valet staff also greeted me with a smile and offered to help with baggage, although that wasn't necessary.Everyone working on the property that I encountered was very friendly.I was located in the Reef building, and I had the most amazing view of the ocean. Even when it was raining, the view was still magnificent. I will agree with some other folks that mentioned that the carpet (which had a view stains) and a few other items in the room are outdated, but that did not bother me. The bed was comfy, and the room felt (and was) cozy and clean. I've also never stayed at a hotel that offered so many cable channels -- kudos to Pacific Edge! The only other thing to note was that the patio fills up with quite a bit of water when it rains.I also noticed that my credit card was authorized with some weird charges. I called the front desk and Dylan answered the phone. He explained what happened and was totally on top of it. I really appreciate his quick, friendly, and efficient customer service. Checking out in the morning, but I expect this will stay a 5 star rating. Thanks again, Pacific Edge!

Location, location, location. That is what you're paying for. For those that leave reviews on it not being worth the price, that might be true anywhere else in the country but not here. Let me explain:California is expensive. Coastal cities, including Laguna Beach and others in Orange County, have some of the highest costs of living in the US. So while $300-$400 a night for a hotel is not small change, for a beachfront hotel in Southern CA, it's not the price of luxury. I repeat, this place is not luxurious. If you want glitz and resort-esque vibes, be prepared to find a place that'll easily set you back $600-$1000+ a night during high season. This hotel is as 3-star basic as they come and desperately needs some interior cosmetic updates. That being said, if you book the ocean view rooms, all of that can be overlooked as the beauty of the Pacific and its sunsets are the real charmer. We've stayed here in 2017 and this past June 2018. The reason was simply the location and views. The proximity to shops and restaurants is perfect. We walked and took Lyft/Uber or the free city trolley. I hear valet is expensive per day so we skip renting a car. We've had pleasant experiences with the front desk staff as well. It's likely those that are disappointed or letdown by the property itself might not have those same experiences/interactions. If you don't book an ocean view room, your view will be of Southern California's other prized possession - it's cars. Either South Coast Highway and its flow of traffic or the alleyway which is parking and valet galore. The bed is OK - definitely not pillow top. The carpet can use some cleaning. The bathroom could use some deep cleaning and the toiletries are simple. The air conditioner is loud but that's when it's best to have the direct breeze from the ocean - another reason to book an ocean front room! I seriously can't stress that enough. There is natural wear and tear that comes with being right on the water and one can only hope that they'll maintain it safely. I think this might be our last time staying here as we want to explore other CA beach towns in the future but I would recommend it if you're looking for the best location and can afford booking the nicer room option. If you have deeper pockets for a hotel, then go elsewhere. When staying here, just know what you're getting into and manage your expectations appropriately.

This hotel means a lot to our little family! We've been coming here for almost 10 years, and have always had a great experience, the staff is super kind and helpful and the rooms are always clean and beautiful! With the most amazing views!!

This is a grimy roadside motel trying to pass itself off as an upscale boutique resort.  Walls are paper thin - you can hear every last thing your neighbor does - floors are uneven,  the plumbing is sketchy and the fixtures are dated and crumbling.  The room we had didn't look like anything they had on the website.  There was barely any furniture, just two beds, a nightstand and a chair in the corner.  There was a tiny tv hanging in the wall and other than that no decor.  There are noisy delivery trucks in the alley that bisects the hotel's buildings starting very early every morning.  It's near some kind of runoff drain that smells like rotting fish if the wind blows the wrong way (which it did).  The rate seems like a bargain until you add up all the little fees they tack on and then you realize you're pretty much paying comparable to the nicer hotels anyway.  We had a dog with us and they doubled the pet fee but didn't update their website or printed materials.  When we questioned that, the girl on the front desk snapped at us and insisted first that we signed a waiver with the new fee, which they had forgotten to give us, and then that she heard her manager tell us about it, also not true; we had spoken to him about the other stuff but nothing to do with the dog.  No accommodation was made for all the inconveniences except he generously waived the cancellation fee so we could leave early. All in all it was so bad it was starting to get funny.  It seems like management and staff feel like effort isn't necessary because of their wonderful location, and maybe they're right, but we won't be coming back there.  P.S.

This was one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in a while let me tell you why well I came back from the beach and I was sandy soooooo I wanted to take a shower and my mom and sister went to get the lougage and there was a bug in the shower and stains in the tub and I couldn't even get the shower on. the air conditioners were so loud it was like mmmmmmmmmmmhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh all night long. And I woke up sooooooo sweaty by the way I am my moms son and that's why I rated this place a 1 star.

I posted the other day that I wasn't happy with the room rate quoted, but the woman I spoke to said to call back the next day as rates fluctuated. I did call back the next day, and I was pleasantly surprised to find that, indeed, the room rate was much lower. I consequently reserved the dates and am now satisfied. The location of The Pacific Edge hotel is the best on the beach at Laguna and we are looking forward to our stay.

My friend had reserved a bungalow the last weekend in march and it was such a great time. We had the XS bungalow which was very cute. I do think the idea of different decorated bungalows is very clever and the location is prime since it is literally on the beach. The only reason I deduct one star because it is a bit pricey. It is a $500 deposit to reserve and then you have to hit a $500 minimum in food or drinks. I think a $1000 for a couple hours is a bit much, but nonetheless still a great time. The service was great and our servers were on their A game and extremely polite. I would definitely come back to this place if it was a bit cheaper, but I am glad I had a memorable time!

*update to my update*As previously stated we were upgraded to a partial ocean view studio queen (Bahia #15). Room came with a kitchenette, dining table and living area. Ample space for two people. Balcony looked out to pacific ocean with oh so lovely sunsets and when we left the patio door open in the evening we could hear the waves crashing on the beach *so soothing* all night long. Guest services was always great. They fsne right to our room with anything we needed...and we did end up needing a wine bottle opener and extra towels. They were also helpful when I couldn't figure out the TV :) excellent service at all times. While the rooms could be updated, the decor lends to what is Laguna Beach. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was clean. In my opinion there should be other options for parking, but whatevs. Overall I had a very pleasant experience at Pacific Edge and would definitely visit again. Cheers!

Found a piece of broken glass on my balcony, there was crap lining the walkway outside my room. The building looks like it's about to fall apart. Cheap carpet on the floors, and the beds leave much to be desired. But hey at least the price is fair!

Worst hotel ever, they charge for everything, $50 a night for valet, 50 for a dog, the room was dirty, paint chipping etc.  The only great thing about his hotel is the view and they really cant take credit for that.Their costumer service was horrible, they said they would call me back and never did.  Room service was so bad. The pool is dirty old and out dated.Do not waste your money.  One night after all their little charges was 1,000 dollars.Don't even think about staying at this hotel.

Its the big wedding weekend and the bride and groom blocked a bunch of rooms at this hotel for people flying in from all over the place.Positive:  The view outside the room was gorgeous!                 There are two restaurants/bars on location and it could get pretty rowdy so be prepared if you get a room near it                The honeymoon suite was gorgeous. HUGE area, looked like an 2 bedroom townhouse. Bright and airy.                 Location is right in the heart of everything. Walking distance to a grocery store and lots of restaurants and bars.My BF's family booked the rooms so I don't know the cost of it but they seemed pretty disappointed from start to finish.   The only word that comes to mind is: Disorganized! I don't know if EVERYONE was new but no one knew what they were doing.  Did the manager go on vacation? because everyone seemed lost. We requested a beach front room which we received.  Good amount of space- small bathroom and comes with a mini frig and kerig and patio.  I can literally hop off the patio onto the sand.Everyone that I talked to either got a bottle of wine or didn't and from my understanding- if it's your first time, they give you a complimentary bottle of wine when you check in and I must say it was a first for ALL of us yet a small handful of people only received one.   Our group of 3 rooms never received anything of this sort.  Some guest found out and went back to the front desk to ask if it was true and received one.Mother and Father of the groom requested two beds because the groom was going to stay with them the night before the big day.  Yet again, they were disappointed and were told they were sold out and will try to get them move them ASAP but it took a few days for that to happen.  After all of this debacle, the Father of the groom said he was charged an obscene amount on his credit card.  Surprise! That also took awhile to get taken care of.... Overall, it seemed like they had unnecessary stress especially for their son's wedding.  Next time we're in the neighborhood, I'll check out the other hotels surrounding it next time.

Stayed here for one night. The view is good but all the good ends there.The receptionist was quite rude, service was slow and parking was bloody 35$ a night and if I needed something in my car i had to call valet to bring me my keys even tho the car was close by. Actually the valet is the worst here.

3 and a half stars. Nano, at the front desk was very nice. Valet was easy and the people who handled my car were also friendly.Room was alright but the shower had practically no water pressure which really sucked, the faucet sink had more pressure. Also wished the cleaning service would knock before trying to come in our room on our last day.Our TV was great to watch movies in bed and we had a pretty view of Catalina island!

We've stayed here several times and so far it's one of our favorite places in the area to choose. Hotel's location can't be beat - some of the greatest views from your room can be found here, the restaurants produce delicious food, valet is nice and quick + reasonably priced for the area. There's a little beach area that is semi-tended with chairs and towels with umbrellas to use. This hotel is also pet friendly which is so nice. The front desk staff tends to be a little snobby, despite the rotating personnel we've seen through the years - but check in is quick!

Been coming here for 8 years. LOVE the location. We get the Reef Ocean View room.  Price is around $400 - $550 depending when you book.  The room is updated and clean.  Not a GLAM hotel room , but all the good basics. The best part is the balcony overlooking the beach. We sleep with the balcony door open to the sound of the waves crashing on the shore.  We will definitely come back again , it's a yearly tradition.  However, we did notice a markedly different attitude at the front desk.   Very strict rules, not even a 15 min leeway to check out - I know rules are rules but honestly a manager was banging on our door at 11:10 a.m to get out!  We are an older couple and stay at 5 star hotels around the world.   We were shocked by the rudeness!!!!  We think they must have new management or owners. They used to be super nice.   Again rules are rules but this was a Monday and I saw on Instagram they were promoting a 25% off that night!  So they obviously were not even booked up.  Oh well, a little kindness goes a long way , was sad to see an old favorite wasn't so nice anymore

I wanted to plan a quick getaway for Valentine's getaway.  We stayed there a week before for one night (Sat - Sun).  Preference: Open Balcony, on the sand and dogs welcomed.  (Got all 3).They have 3 separate buildings and it looks sketch at first.  Check in is through the front and valet parking is in the back through the alley.  Its not the ghetto so don't worry you won't get mugged.  Its pretty active there because people go there to park and go to restaurants and bars also.We rented the "BEACH FRONT" king room.  Once I set foot there I went straight to the balcony.  We were on the 2nd floor so it was really close on the sand by the water. AMAZING.  Thats what I paid my $$ for.  Pricey but met my prefences and would go again but stay longer. When you are a hotel guest, you are able to access a lounge spot on the sand (beach chair and umbrella).  Go early AM btw as it will get filled fast.  People were friendly and it was such a great vibe.  I've stayed at a few beach hotels and this was my favorite so far.  It was amazing to see the sunset and it was also amazing to wake up to.  If you are a dog lover, go!Suggestion:  If you want the whole "beach front" on the water type experience, then rent the BEACH FRONT room.  Also if you're a light sleeper, the waves can get pretty damn loud but it comes with territory.With careful planning, this will be a pleasant experience.

Ok location, superb!! But being a beachfront hotel, we were nowhere near the beach! The $34 for overnight parking was insane, and the rooms are small and nothing to write home about!! Biggest disgust was so many stains on the sheets!! Tons!! The only thing that was delightful about this experience was the girl at the front desk! She was knowledgeable and sweet and super helpful!! We love Laguna but definitely won't be back here again!!

The Pacific Edge Hotel is perfectly located and that's about it.Everything about the rooms sucks.Our room (#120) was old, musty and the filthy carpet reeked of dog urine.The guests next door (#121) smoked and the awful smell filled our room through the open balcony door. The worst part was not being able to sleep because of the loud, constant banging from the pipes.I recorded it and let the front desk manager listen when we checked out.  He asked me to email it to him, which I did.I assumed we'd get at least a one night credit for the awful stay and loud, annoying noise.Nope!He gave us a valet parking credit.Awful, old, musty, loud, over-priced hotel - avoid at all costs! P.S. Management's generic, scripted "apologies" to the many guests writing about terrible experiences at Pacific Edge should serve as a warning: Chronic problems are real & management won't do anything concrete to make up for the inconvenience.

This subpar hotel "Resort" is supposedly a 3 star .. additional 34 a night for parking valet cause there's not parking adequate for the "resort" jacuzzi not heated. several tacky practices in cleaning ... Loud dish clanging below our room and then was told We would be compensated for one night  which never happened the compensated 15.00 resort fee because "having a  pool, coffee in foyer,elevator , Jaccuzi , clean surroundings  are just an extra treat we are ONLY paying for the room."  Spoke on phone to Victor Gonzales who refused to honor their compensation that was offered for this wasted trip!!!

I really tried to like this place! Staff were nice but the roomsssss were not.  Pictures online look nicer than what you really get--OVERPRICED. Our room had a pretty big carpet stain, stuffy and to top it off there were fleas and other creatures in my room. Yes! I woke up with a few flea bites on my arms. I even killed a flea on my way out! I told the supervisor on duty upon my departure, she promised to follow up with me in regards to a compensation and never heard back from her. They never even bothered to call with an apology, NOTHING WHATSOEVER! It was pretty aggravating to hear that an investigation had to be done before taking further action?? Seriously? I dont know if she thought i was lying, but never in a million years will I be retuning to this motel. I do not recommend this place!

Stayed here for my friend's birthday celebration in Laguna Beach this past weekend.  It's right on the water and the bar/restaurant The Deck is right below the hotel.  It's in a great location, just walking distance to what is "downtown" (I use quotes because Laguna Beach itself is pretty small but there is a place considered to be downtown). The people at the front desk were nice and got me checked in with no problems.  The directions to get the room were daunting (why is the 6th floor really the 2nd floor but labeled the 3rd floor?!). The room appeared clean although outdated and very small.  We got the least expensive room so I can only judge on that.. it was the smallest room I think I've ever stayed in.Overnight parking is $34 a night so I recommend finding street parking instead (meters end at 7pm and you can pay up for 4 hrs on most of them.  Tip: If you can find a broken meter like I did, it's free-fifty! ahaha)This was a good place to stay because of the location (literally steps away from the shore) but not really for any other reason.

Yeah,  The sub par reviews of this place holds true.  For the price the service and accommodations are really dissapointing.  They gave me a room without a heater in winter, and they didnt seem to think that might be a problem.  The staff doesn't follow through on anything they say that they will do. It feels like a place just trying to take your money and not concerned about delivering a great service in exchange.  Any complaints about sub par experiences falls on def ears.  They just don't care about giving decent service. The room furnishings are mediocre.  Nothing inspired about this place except the location. The best part of this hotel is the location.  Dont expect more than that.

My husband and I hosted our intimate wedding ceremony and reception at The Deck's private bungalows and booked the Pacific Suite for two nights. The venue was beautiful and the food was great, but our hotel experience really did not measure up.Everything started out fine with the front desk allowing us to check in early. However, the key cards didn't work for practically the entire time we stayed there, which meant we had to keep calling and visiting the front desk, only for them to issue us more key cards that didn't work. This was extremely inconvenient, as we had vendors and family members helping us with the event who needed to be in and out of the suite quite often.The WORST part happened right before our wedding ceremony. We had to leave the door to the suite slightly ajar so that our photographer could come in without having to call us to open the door for her. When she and our friend/officiant entered the suite, they were met by two random guys at the foot of the stairs INSIDE THE SUITE. My friend reasonably asked them what they were doing there and if they were security, to which one of them coldly responded with "don't I look like security, you Asian b*tch?" That's right... this "security guard," who never introduced himself to us and just let himself into our suite without permission made a RUDE and quite frankly RACIST remark toward a guest of the hotel just minutes before one of the most important moments of our lives. Then, when we were headed out to the ceremony, they just stared at us awkwardly by the doorway, refusing to move until my husband had to say "ummm, we need to lock up right now."When I brought this incident up to our event coordinators, they said that it was unacceptable and that they would be escalating it to the hotel's general manager so they could review camera footage. I was told multiple times that hotel management would follow up with me. Well, it has been two weeks and I haven't heard a single thing from them, even after filling out their post-stay survey. Ultimately, we had a dream wedding at the bungalows and would highly recommend the restaurants, but the complete unresponsiveness of hotel management with regard to a serious security and staffing issue has put us off from this hotel.

Checking into a Village Room Sunday! I'm excited yet anxious to see what the real deal is considering all the bad recent post reviews. Hopefully they are able to provide the quality they SAY they are about.More to come with photos and video!

Yes I stayed there and the air-conditioning went out three times and three times I had to have it turned back on good night use the electrical stuff I didn't even use all of it and I will blow out the circuits there were stains on the floor they need major repair the whole area the air-conditioning's are blowing hot air onto the other person's patio and they need to have a braided air-conditioning system also it's sorry to say this I love staying here but over the few years I have and it's not getting improved at all or being worked on to keep it improved I am currently finding out if I can get a better reimbursement Beach chairs and umbrellas run down and not enough for everybodySand was not swept off for bugs in the sea weed and the  guest were raking it off They need more help and maybe the boys would be as nasty talking to the guest

My goodness this is probably the most disgusting overpriced and by far false advertised hotel of all time. I wouldn't even consider this a hotel it is more of a dump motel. My room have bugs everywhere. So gross. The carpet was so disgusting and sticky. There's stain all over. There's also hairs everywhere. It looked nothing like the photo . Not even close!!!!  We have a 3 months old baby and a small travel bassinet and there was no room to put it anywhere. The room is a size of my closet and in the photo advertised there is a chaise to lounge in the room but the room I had don't even have one single chair or enough space for a chaise and walk room. Let say that I can't even take more than 4 steps around.  Overall the cleanliness is much worse than any dump.And the balcony!!!!!Gawsh they need to fix that! It's leaning by almost 45 degrees!! I will be calling the building inspector to see f that meet the standard. I was so scared to stand there. It's not safe.. it's falling out! Eventually someone will get hurt here.  Please save yourself and go else where!!  There's no way you can feel relax in a dirty tiny cramp room. No wonder it is advertise on Groupon. I paid almost 300$ for the king room. The king room is not 424 sq ft like advertised but it's less than 300. What a shame. Location is so good.        Much worse... The front desk girl really really annoying. I called to ask if there's a better room we can switch to she said with an attitude... Umm no! Anything else? What a hospitality huh. Everyone there just seem like they hate their Job.    I honestly would go else where. This place is too dirty and small. False advertising period!

It's really a motel-like hotel on the beach. The decor was cool. There are 2 main buildings, one on the beach and the other facing the main street. Unfortunately, we stayed in the latter. The amenities were ok but they ran out of beach towels both days. How does that happen? The single panes windows and paper thin doors don't cut it either. The traffic noise was fine but the fighting in the adjoining room and the makeup sex with the woman's moans...Lordy, I hope there were no kids in that room.This place really deserves 2 1/2 stars  but yelp doesn't allow that so hence the 3.

This is a review of their property but not a stay here.I dined in one of their restaurants over the Labor Day Weekend.  I was impressed with the location and the beauty of this property.  Though dated, they have direct access to the beach.  It reminded me of the Outrigger Waikiki.There are lounge chairs for guests and clean restrooms just steps from the sand and ocean.I would definitely stay here for a night or weekend for a quick getaway.  If you want to eat, shop or relax, this would be an ideal place to stay.The only problem is parking, which is common for the area.  The only option is valet.Be back soon, make sure to keep the light on for me!

So let me start by saying I came into this stay with an open mind, the hotel wasn't the nicest but I didn't plan on spending my time in the room. First off you pay $20 a night for a "convenience fee" and they want you to to pay $34 for valet A NIGHT. Note to anyone who rents a car you can find parking on the side streets for way less that $34 a night! Next, I was locked out of my room on numerous occasions because their card system kept shutting down, so I had to go get my cards reset each time I wished to enter my hotel room. Most of the staff was decent, until I met the bald tall man on the last night of my stay (my birthday). We came back from dinner and once again, we were locked out, even maintenance was passing by and couldn't get the door open. I walked to the lobby and this man was rude from the second I walked in. As soon as I gave the tall bald man my room number he proceeded to tell me I have three noise complaints, and was threatening to kick me out? Keep in mind this was at 10:30pm and I had not been in my room ALL day. So.... I was being threatened to get kicked out, and never once was I made aware of these noise complaints. Also, it's not hard to be "loud" at this hotel as you can hear the people in the connecting rooms talking in a normal tone or the porn the couple behind us listened to each morning... the rooms have a connecting door (with no doorknob, just a lock). No privacy whatsoever. The first night, we found blood stains on one of the sheets... TV doesn't work... AC unit is literally THE LOUDEST. Overall, it was not a good experience! Location is GREAT though, so if you're thinking of staying here I would definitely recommend staying near by just not here!

Great location, one of the only hotels with beachfront real estate, which means they have beach chairs and a beach attendant for all guests. GREAT customer service! This would be the only reason I would come back. Very nice people willing to make your stay special. *Thank you to Lauren at the front desk and Tyler the valet/bellman. Wonderfully helpful people!The buildings are old, but they have tried to update with new floors, carpet, furnishings. The room was large though, so we had lots of space. Only problems: they charge quite a bit for parking, its valet only, and they parked our car somewhere that when we got it back it was covered in bird poop! $35/night to park the car and then of to the get a $30 car wash, bummer.

Probably the dirtiest hotel I've ever stayed in . The carpet must have been 30 years old- musty smelly drapes, walls covered in dirty hand prints, dust in corners 2 inches thick. Paid a lot of money for a two bedroom suite- and felt like was was staying in a hostel. Don't let the pretty reception area fool you!

Literally a tiny room in the basement near the carport without a bath - Just a very small shower. Not what you would expect for the price. Resort fee?  This is not a resort. The place has a pool and a hot tub.  some of their rooms are ocean front and could be worth the price, but most of the hotel is facing the alley or pch. Reached out to the hotel to dispute the room is not as advertised but they did not care.

After staying here for 2 nights i have pros and cons about the hotel. Pro the hotel is so close to the water. Close to restaurants. It overall is a great hotel. However, it is very minimalistic. Valet is $34 a night, we found parking on a side street for free that was less than 100 steps to our room. (look on the corner of Cleo and Sleepy Hollow there's only 4 spots that aren't metered). The woman who checked us in was very nice and upgraded us to a Queen Deluxe Room for free! The room service is expensive (they auto gratuity for you) i didn't know that lol. The bed is comfortable, the room is spacious, and everything is clean. Bring your own towels to the pool because the valet guys love to be rude about getting you some. the pool with the hot tub is heated. will be staying here again hopefully!
The bungalows are very cool.  Ryan at the bungalows was awesome... on point with service.

You are def paying for the view which is spectacular!!! We stayed in the Reef side and needless to say it needs a lot of updating and cleaning. Our bathroom was tiny and the shower curtain was really gross. The curtain are very old and the unit has a wall unit air conditioner. Pictures on website are very deceiving. The staff was great and the valet was very nice and quick! The restaurants around the area were great. You can walk everywhere. The pool is not the best but if you have kids they won't care.

The room we had was connected to another room with a locked door... the walls were very thin and we could hear the people in the next room while they were talking at a normal voice level. It felt like we had zero privacy and it was very noisy. The hotel was completely booked that day, so when we asked the front desk to please cancel our reservation and get a refund, they denied our request even though we had only checked in a few hours ago. I had to call the online service I booked the hotel through to get a refund, which we got as a curtesy from hotels.com (but not from the hotel itself). I will not be staying here again, if you like a quiet room I recommend going elsewhere. PS: they charge you 35$ for valet.....

Josh at the front desk started off the week with a big smile, a "no problem" attitude, plenty of great recommendations for dinner and activities.  Everyone was pleasant and relaxed.  The valet parking is well worth it.  I will be back with my dog.  Comfortable beds.  The carpet in the rooms is a bit funky. The valet lost my new expensive hoody on the way to the with the luggage, but other than that, great.

Nice hotel, it was clean . Friendly staff til thete was a problem. Our room had a small kitchen and living area. It also had a room with two twin beds and a room with a Queen bed and a nice covered patio.  Medium flat screen TV in the master  bedroom. But no TV in the room with 2 twin beds.  Living room also had a large flat screen TV.  And it had a good fold out couch. Very nice set up for the price. Staff was very helpful with valet parking and luggage.  Til the valet supervisor came to tell us that our headlight was cracked and had a rock in it. They showed us some blurry pictures and tried to tell us it must have been cracked already. I call bullshit. Don't come here.
Checked in around 7 pm in January and the room was chilly. Prayed the room can get warmer.

My daughter and I just enjoyed a nice one day get away here.  I really love the convenience and location of the hotel.  As well as the private walk way to the beach which is just steps away from the hotel.  The restaurant at the hotel is just as great!  Right on the beach, amazingView of course.  It was nice to valet our car and walk everywhere, since the hotel is walking distance to downtown...,, but the best partOf our stay was the customer service".  When our standard room was not ready by check in time... even though we had arrived earlyAt noon... the receptionist CK  was kind enough to upgrade us at no additional cost to an ocean front room Making our experience that much more enjoyable.  I definitely recommend staying here"

To Victor I really did try to let your facility make  things up. Even repeatedly called spoke to I think Jake or whoever works nights. Spoke to Lauren had to call her a few times to reach her. Even expressed that I wanted to have a 30 yr business anniversary party. So on so forth . Never once did you try to call after I expressed what could help.

First time coming here me & my boyfriend stayed for 2 days for our anniversary it was well worth the price !! "JAY " at the front desk helped us out Tuesday night & he was the best thanks jay he even remembered me from the phone . The room was so cute !! & fresh I love how the walls were white the view outside was pretty we were literally 30 seconds walking from the beach  I loved it here ! Definitely coming back in the future , walking distance to Starbucks & Bjs brew house & a grocery store + more . Couldn't go wrong with this place . Only " bad " thing is no free guest parking but we scored free residential parking across the street from the grocery store best parking I found ! & it was less than a 5 min walk to the hotel . Thanks to jay for telling us about it ! Saved 60$ from hotel parking fees. Over all definitely check this place out !

Original review below. After receiving a response to my review, I'm a little irked. The managers response read snotty- ok, so I booked via Groupon and you gave me an upgrade- thanks, and yeah- I appreciate the "upgrade", but that wasn't the issue. Also- don't enter my room because I posted a less than great Yelp review! Invasion of privacy, and a complete disregard for the do not disturb I had on my door. If you want to offer customer service- call me on the room phone and ask if you can enter the room- don't enter someone's room because they posted a review; NOT OKAY. The rooms are dated, the lighting is poor (hospital stark white), and the cleanliness is a problem (I even took pics). This hotel is disappointing, it needs updating, cleaner facilities and rooms, and that's what the issue is. Plain and simple. Stop trying to market this as a luxury beach property and setting your guests up for disappointment- fix up a few things and own the charming old boutique hotel vibe! Checked in today and staying through Monday- I don't mind the price, the room looks nothing like the pictures online, but what bothers me most, it is dirty. There is a blood spot on the sheets, there is no lighting in the room, and the bathroom had unmentionable hair on the toilet seat. The shower is dated and chipped, and there is dust EVERYWHERE. Wishing we were staying elsewhere, our girls weekend is a little tainted. Frustrating.

We just spent a week in this hotel which was referred by a friend. Originally we were staying three nights here and two nights in Huntington Beach. We so enjoyed this hotel we cancelled the two nights in Huntington Beach and added the nights here.  It's a great location with two really good restaurants. The breakfast at Driftwood Kitchen is varied and amazing especially the French Toast!  The facility is somewhat dated, but updates are in process. It is clean and comfortable. The only negative I have is with the beach towels. For some reason there seems to be a lack of towels available. During our stay there were never any towels at either pool and the beach ran out a couple if times during the day. Additionally they only gave you one towel per person which would be okay if there were enough blue covers for the lounge chairs which there aren't.  Small issue really, but if its included in the resort fee, then make sure there are plenty available. We will definatley be back.

I wish I could give them a "0"!!!! Horrible, horrible experience. Be aware do not get the Groupon either!  This place is more of a Motel! Dirty, AC wasn't working, they only had valet parking for $34.00 dls a night, plus $20.00 dls service charge for staying WTF! There was no ocean view, pool was closed. The place is so run down, it was so disappointing to look forward to a mini-vacation and end up in worst than a Motel 6!!! And false advertisement!FYI...we did purchase the Ocean View Groupon..General Manager replied and they don't call back....again false advertisement!

I purchased an oceanfront bed, breakfast, and valet parking package for my wife, kids, and I for mothers day weekend. After check-in we found out that the hotel will not honor the breakfast because they are booked for mother's day. So FALSE ADVERTISING. If I knew that, I would have never booked this room 3 weeks ago. Thought I was booking a nice and special mothers day package for my wife but instead mothers day was ruined because we're starving and scrambling to find a place to eat on a day everywhere is booked. When I told the front desk about it, they were unsympathetic and unaccommodating. At least try to get me a table in one of your restaurants or something for the huge mistake you made. Lack of management and lack of customer service makes it no surprise they have a 3 star avg. on social media.

We discovered we were unable to take our family trip as planned and I tried to cancel the same day we made the reservations and the hotel refused to refund us our money.  I was expecting a cancellation fee but not for them to refuse to refund anything! This is unreasonable and unacceptable.  The demand is high for this area   and there are plenty of people who would easily take our place.  Our stay was not scheduled for another month but they still refuse to refund our money due to their "policy".   I called twice and was told the Hotel Manager declined our request for a refund.   Very disappointed in how we have been treated by this hotel.

Sabrina at the front desk was wonderful- we arrived for my daughters birthday and even though check in at 4pm we still didn't have a room an hour later... Sabrina got us into a beautiful room, turned around the entire situation in a few seconds. Old fashioned customer service from Sabrina. She is the reason for the 4 stars.

This was supposed to be a short weekend getaway to Laguna Beach for my husband and me with our 2 dogs.  The hotel is pet frendly, but when I booked this trip with the hotel ( directly), they had misinformed us that the dogs are allowed to be present with us on the beach.  They failed to tell us that the life guard will chase us away the minute we will step on the beach after 9 am and until 6 pm.  After 6 pm, the tide is so high, that there is no beach left to walk the dogs.  So, this became a very difficult task for us.  We have booked the ocean front room, and the view was beautiful  (  pacific ocean takes the credit) but the tide at night is overwhelmingly strong and lowd and impossible to fall a sleep, and if the window is closed and AC is turned on, the AC is even lowder than the tide, worse than a 747 landing.And we hear the AC from the neighbor's room too.  At check out ( 11 am ) I've asked to extend our stay for 1 hour, so we could have spend a little more time on the beach.  We are   very experienced travelers,  not only in the US, but in Europe, South America and Asia,  and had never ever the hotel clerk had refused to extend our check out time for 1 hour.  So dissapointed with this property!  Will never come back and will not recommend to our friends.
Our room/ view was beautiful and staff is very friendly. The hallways in our building were sketchy and the bathroom wasn't on par with the room itself however. But these are only minor complaints.

Two Stars only because of location and proximity to the beach. First, there is no free parking unless you drive down the street and find your own residential parking. If you would like to keep your car on the property then you are forced to pay 30 something dollars for valet. Second, the rooms must have type of noise enhancer built in because you can hear EVERYTHING. I woke up to cars revving up and down the street, children running through the hallways, people have their causal conversations and even the house keepers talking and organizing their cleaning supplies. Third, the rooms are out dated and the mattress was way too hard. I liked the location but I find it hard to come back just because of that.

Good location but for the price you pay per night, you'd expect better.  Dirty carpets, tiny rooms, no microwave.  Beds are so soft that they hurt my back.  And the beds are short (length wise); My daughter is 5'4 and her feet hang off the bed.  They have beach attendants where you get towels, umbrella and chair (included in your hotel price).  We got there a little late the first day and they were out of towels but we found some empty chairs and an umbrella to use.  2nd day we got there by 10am and they were out of towels (?)but thankfully we brought our own. 3rd day we got there at noon and they were out of chairs AND towels but we got an umbrella.   A couple of hours later, a few people (non guests of the hotel) came down to the beach and asked for chairs and umbrella, the attendants gave them chairs for $10 a piece.  I asked for chairs and was told they didn't have any‍  We usually stay further down the beach at Crescent, which is our favorite spot, so we will probably stay at that end next time

You are only paying for the view. The hotel is a dump.  They should not be charging a "resort fee" because this is not a resort by any stretch of the imagination.  They also nail you with $34 a night to park your car.  Its a real shame because the location is amazing.  I also could not get a late checkout which really bothered me.  Check out was at 11:30 and the next night guests are told rooms wont be ready until 4pm.  Someone came knocking on my door to get us out at 11:25.  I told him to get leave we still have 5 minutes (I was getting dressed and packing.)  That kind of thing really pisses me off.  It kind of left a bad taste in my mouth after trying to enjoy the view for two nights.

Stayed here the night of my wedding. Brandon at the front desk assisted us with our booking. Kind and helpful! Thank you so much Brandon! Clean room and amazing views.The only reason I am not giving this hotel 5 stars is because the valet employee employee who retrieved my car in the morning threw my ticket on the ground and stormed off in an angry tirade because I didn't have any cash available to tip him. Very unprofessional. I probably wouldn't stay here in the future because if this reason.

STAY AWAY FROM ROOM 11!!! WOW! They could have warned us ahead of time, which they didn't. They could have suggested a different room, which they didn't. They could have given us a HUGE discount, which they didn't. They did comp my Valet - thanks. The room being 'post-modern' was cute. The carpets being sticky, gross, dirty to the point we wouldn't take our shoes off OR let our 18 month old walk around the room was unacceptable. We immediately threw things away or washed them right away if they fell onto the floor.  We came to enjoy a relaxing Mother's Day weekend in a hotel room with views of the ocean. We couldn't wait to get out of the room as soon as we checked in. How do you even rent such a room out. You're a pricey hotel in Laguna that charges over $400/night, stop being cheap and fix the carpet in the room. There was also carpet on the balcony with cigarette burns everywhere. WHY??? We thought all your rooms were like this, which is why we didn't complain because we are not those kind of folks, that is until I looked into many of the other suites during check-out as they were being cleaned, NONE of the others had carpet. ADVICE: Don't offer this room to anyone until you fix it. Flip side: The restaurant and bar were nice. The views were fantastic. The people were friendly. We'll definitely come back to dine and enjoy the view but thats about it. Thanks for ruining our Mother's Day weekend.
This was our room! Will never come back! Not sure what the photos they are using but this place definitely did not look like the website.

I booked this hotel for a little birthday getaway for myself. (May 10th-May 12)I got an awesome deal on expedia for 2 nights, i would recommend going on there to book the room. Hotel is walking distance to Ralph's & other restaurants and bars.If you want to get your tan on, there are ppl out there to help you set up lounge chairs and umbrellas.Room service is fast & they do a great job.Dominos is down the street, we ordered and they came within 20mins. Hotel comes w/ heater, AC,  oh and refrigerator(if you need anything they're pretty helpful)PARKING;30$ is pretty expensive so we did parking meters both days. Spent only 12$! 8:30am-7:00pm NO CHARGE FOR METERS6$ for full 4hours.CORRECTION 7pm-830am for metersBalcony is too close to neighbors, gets kinda awkward.

Huge disappointment.  The staff at the front desk during check-in wasn't very friendly, and didn't make us feel welcome.  The parking is valet-only, and costs $34/night.  The rooms are tiny.  The carpet was sticky.  There's a paper-thin door that connects the room to the neighbors, and you can hear everything.  We spent the night listening to the neighbors talking, blaring the TV, and their dog barking.  Note: This hotel is not on the beach--It's one row back from the beachfront properties, separated by an alley.

Rented a bungalow for my daughter's birthday celebration. It was such a hit for a bunch of teenagers wanting a full day at the beach. Location was perfect - bungalows were right on the beach with the deck just a few feet away from the ocean. The bungalows were a bit run down and could definitely use an upgrade. A few more seating area would've been better since there was more than enough space for it. The first server we got was dry and not very friendly. He just did not look like he wanted to be there. Not the kind of vibe that we were hoping for - with a bunch of kids celebrating a birthday. Towards the end of the day, our second server was awesome. Wish I could remember his name. Food was great and nicely served. Good options of food for big groups and "picky eaters". It was convenient to have mostly everything provided for - towels, plates, utensils, napkins, drinks, food, etc. Also a plus to have beach umbrellas and beach chairs set up for you ahead of time. Price for the bungalow rental including the (minimum) food cost was a bit high but so worth the hassle and worry free day.

This review is strictly for the valet parking at Pacific Edge. We went on Sunday to Driftwood Kitchen and used the valet service here. When we pulled up, the guy gave me a ticket then told me to pull into a parking spot. I stayed in the parking spot waiting for him to come back but he never did and didn't want to leave the key sitting in the car with no attendants around... so we walked over to the valet desk and manually gave them our keys.On our way out, as we were waiting for our car... one of the reps said to another rep, "I'm off after this car. The lady in the next car said she's handicap but she looks like she's only 25 so I don't know what the issue is. Maybe she has a bad back but who knows?" Hmmm... is that even legal? Poor valet service here.

If anyone is thinking of a weekend get away by the beach, I recommend the Pacific Edge Hotel in Laguna Beach.  20 steps away from the beach, beautiful beachfront views from your balcony, so worth the price. We stayed here over New Years Weekend and had a great time with my family. The room was great, clean, comfy bed, awesome TV and chaise for my son to watch his cartoons on. The lobby as I checked in was nice, beachy feel with sofas to lounge on and relax.  All hotel staff was great, customer service at their finest.  My only complaint was the room had no microwave, they had refrigerators, coffee makers etc...but no microwave.  Ohhh...and the cloth shower curtain had the plastic protector missing.The hotel itself was nice but the Reef Bldg from the outside, may be due for some upgrades. (ie..... new paint on the walls and staircases down to the beach and going up to parking area.)  I understand you are a beachfront boutique hotel, you need to keep up with the competition and neighboring hotels. The $30 for the valet parking a night was a lil steep, but then again I cant forget we are in Laguna Beach. We enjoyed a great breakfast in the morning in our balcony the next morning.  We called for room service and food was delivered by Driftwood Kitchen on the premises of the hotel. The highlight was watching 3 dolphins frolic in the ocean that morning from the balcony.Food we enjoyed:Laguna Beach Omelette-Dungeness crab with goat cheese and avocado and side of potatoes.  Omelette was OK...crab was a lil strong a lil to fishy for my taste, Scrambled eggs with sausage, wheat toast and potatoes.  Not sure what type of sausage that was,,,but the best sausage I've ever had.I saved the French Toast for the last, because it was amazing.  It was crusted with granola and topped with caramelized hazelnut butter and raspberries, blueberries and strawberries. Wow....I would only return for the french toast if I had to.Overall nice hotel, just in need of outside cosmetic touches.  Nice weekend getaway.

This place is not what is displays it self to be online. Do yourself and family a favor and go else where. Basically a motel on the beach with a restaurant attached. The service is just as bad. Had I seen the resent reviews over the past week I would of never booked this place. Very disappointed to say the lease. To add we will not be staying here. It feels unsafe and dirty. Looking for a new place  to stay tonight. Money definitely wasted. Option to upgrade but a place that is this deceiving I wouldn't spend another cent at even for a ocean view. What a bummer.

Great location, right on the ocean side of PCH.  Oceanfront rooms are literally right above the beach, gorgeous views and sounds of the ocean.  Hotel is obviously older, but has been updated so the rooms are nice and modern feeling.  Excellent beach that the hotel controls and attendants help with lounge chairs, beach towels, etc.  Tons of great restaurants in walking distance!

I have to say we are really disappointed in our stay at the hotel. The room and shower were not clean, carpet was stained, they gave us a half a roll toilet paper to use all weekend for two people and the tv had issues. The front desk staff was unfriendly and not accommodating at all. I definitely wouldn't recommend this place if your looking for a nice, clean and friendly place to stay.

Javid was very genuine and welcoming. We felt very at ease through the whole process of checking in and were so grateful he worked with us in accommodating our requests. We've checked in to many many hotels before and it makes such a huge difference to be welcomed like this!! We've stayed here before and we will keep coming back! :)

Beware. I'm not sure where they took their photos but my rooms looked nothing like the photos they posted. My rooms were awful, and I say rooms because they downgraded me the first night to a tiny room I didn't reserve because they somehow overbooked my large room with a kitchenette. Didn't matter because the following two nights in our actual reserved room, the kitchen had no utensils, pans, cookware, glasses, nothing. It was useless. The pull out couch had a 2 inch mattress pad that was terribly uncomfortable, and they couldn't even provide sheets because they ran out. There was even a message on our phone from the previous night that eluded to the previous guests complaining. For what we paid, could of stayed at a Motel 6 and lived like kings.

This review is for the bungalows at Pacific Edge.  My company rented one out and it could not have been a better set-up.  The atmosphere, service, food, and location were amazing.  A special thank you to our server Andy for his exceptional service and attitude.  Thank you for making our weekend so fun!  We will definitely be back!

I stayed at an ocean front room during Summer and had a terrible experience. I sent a note to management team and filed a complaint, but no one responded. The service and amenities have gotten worse since my last stay a year ago. The valet service was terrible. In particular, Jordan accused me of blocking the parking lot when they have the keys to the car. It took 30-40 minutes for someone to pick up the phone at the restaurant for room service.Rooms are outdated and need renovation. Overall, I was disappointed with my stay.

Amazing service and breath taking views. James the front desk attendant was a sweetheart! And so were the valet guys who helped carry all of our stuff, house keeping peeps were very kind too. Im from LA and it was refreshing to not have that pretentious vibe that LA hotels have. Do whatever you can to get an ocean front room because it is worth every penny! Theres a fridge in every room which was awesome so i was able to bring groceries and make ceviche. The restaurants downstairs are not too expensive and have delicious food. We did not want to leave our room just sat on the balcony for hours watching the beautiful waves.

Was coming for one night only...I only booked one night because I wanted specifically to be lulled to sleep by the sound of the ocean, right smack in front of my room. Something didn't seem right, however because their price was $265 and the price for the same down the street was $965. I travel frequently to Maui for this same experience which is obviously much more expensive and I wanted to duplicate that experience. Let's just say I will be saving thousands of dollars a year staying here instead of Maui. The sound of the ocean while I left my screen door opened every night was deafeningly beautiful!  I fell in love when I walked into our room and it was exactly what I wanted at a price I thought I would have to pay 4x more to get. Our one night turned into 7 nights and 8 days!!!  A hidden gem!!!  I am typically a five star traveler but this beautiful little boutique hotel right on the water with five star staff stole our hearts. Thank you so much to Lauren (who actually looks like Lauren from the Laguna Beach show from about a decade ago). Lauren is the beautiful front desk manager that took such special care of us. Brandon was fantastic also!  I am reluctant to tell everyone I know about this place because I am selfish and want it ALL for myself!!  They have staff that has Lounge chairs and sitting chairs with towels and umbrellas right there in front of the hotel. Like I said 5 star service at super budget pricing...incredible find. Some things that are too good to be true really are true!! Thank you all at Pacific Edge Hotel from Lauren, Brandon, Sam/Pat in the beach. I can't tell you how badly I needed this escape. I haven't felt this renewed and healed in a very very long time. The pictures attached are from my room balcony and from the beach. I have also included pictures from The Deck and Driftwood Kitchen, two fantastic restaurants and bars that are connected to the hotel. We didn't get into a car for the entire week!  Also there was a Ralph's Grocery only two doors down to fill the fridge in the room for meals and snack preparation.

Thank you for such a wonderful stay in room 503 and 504, C.J. Went out of his way to find  us just the right rooms , my sister was visiting with her girls from Houston and wanted to stay on the beach-perfect choice.Will be back soon!

Quaint and charming boutique hotel. We stay at the Joie de Vivre establishments and it's always a great experience.This hotel is older and rooms smaller than average but many have scenic ocean views and the service is friendly. It's also walking-distance to all the restaurants and shopping.We love the beach chairs and towels available for guests and the valet is quick and efficient. Also, the pool and jacuzzi are heated and a great reprieve for little kids! When we want a staycation in gorgeous Laguna we will be back.

Don't judge a book by its cover!!! The halls and stairways are barely maintained... but the rooms were perfect and clean, views were amazing, and restaurants are awesome!  The "Deck" was an awesome dinner/ drinks spot right at the hotel.  I would definitely pay for an ocean view room.  The location is convenient-  you can walk downtown to shops, Whole Foods, Starbucks, dinner spots, and theres a wonderful boardwalk close with great walking paths and stellar views.

Beware of the rooms in this hotel. Not at all what you see on the website. I booked a deluxe room and my room would make Holiday Inn seem like a luxurious hotel. Stains on the carpet, outdated furniture with scratches and chips. Basically looked like a Motel 6 with a $500+/night price tag. I stayed over the 4th of July in Room 303 and was told all other rooms were booked! You are better off staying at the Holiday Inn across the street. At least you'll save some money and probably have a better experience. The comment I just saw from the general manager is pretty laughable since I called and emailed them twice and nobody responded to me or called me back. I guess it's only when you post a negative review on Yelp does someone finally take notice. But still no direct response.....only the one on Yelp.

Worked with Melinda on securing a bungalow for my birthday. She was extremely accommodating and made the process not only easy, but welcoming. I've been at Pacific Edge for the day Bungalows before and the experience is always incredible. It's located adjacent to The Deck so you can order drinks off the menu and they quickly take them right over to you. The food can be catered or individual and you can order buckets of beer and cocktail pitchers if you have a large group. Highly recommend if you want a private but enviable beachfront location for the day.

This hotel use to be so great! The price for the rooms directly on the beach has more than doubled and nothing has changed on the inside. We stayed in a room "with a view" of the rooftop of another building (room 18) and paid close to $300 a night. We ended up calling the front desk twice on Saturday night due to the fact that the room next to us was smoking weed and the smell was over taking our room. They sent someone up once, however the weren't persistent enough to get them to open up the door to talk with them. To top it all off, our room didn't have hot water. Every time we needed to shower, we had to call down to the front desk so that they could tell the engineer and he could come up to our room to "fix" it just got it to go back to cold within a couple minutes of him leaving. I would have thought that for the price we paid it would have been decent, however it was far from that! Save your nose, money and time and stay some here else.

The location of the hotel was fabulous and straight on the beach front. Was a little disappointing because we came a little later than 5pm and their towel and lounge chair service was closed. When there is a worker sitting in one and multiple other people are too. Felt very uncomfortable and disregarded. Stated they are closed and continued to sit in his chair and his phone for a good another hour. Otherwise the room was nice

This was the Worst place I have ever stayed. Run down out dated,dirty walls, motel 6 ,you see in movies. My kids slept with me,because their room had spiders on the wall.We would have left,but we could not finding ANY vacancies anywhere.We payed Surf and Sand pricing,$500.ish. The room had water leak stains all over the pop corn ceilings. There were holes in the curtains. The fire alarms were all open,with the batteries pulled out. The pull out couch opened ,but the couch fell forward,bizarre. The air conditioning was a added one in the window,that made loud weird noises all night. Horrible balcony,horrible view. The room had no toilet paper. I called the front desk twice for some. We Never got any toilet paper,had to use Kleenex. We will stay home next time,if again this is the only hotel with vacancies. Stay at the Surf and Sand,The Hotel EL Camino or The Capri Laguna ,Nick Politis is an amazing general manager. Ask for him,he always takes great care of everyone.

The customer service here was amazing!  My boyfriend just returned from a seven month deployment and CJ gave us a beautiful room on the beach with a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine. As another treat, he took care of the valet service for us.  Another woman at the front desk (don't remember her name but she is the one from Hawaii) was very nice as well. Both of the employees made great conversation and gave us great restaurant recommendations and tips for the evening! Without a doubt, I would come back here again! Beautiful and clean rooms, a pool and jacuzzi, ping-pong, and it's right on the beach plus walking distance to all the shopping and restaurants. We had a great time here.

3.5 stars, actually but I am grading up, because of the customer service I received upon departure.My stay honestly was not good. There were many issues that really were not acceptable. And a one star review was well on it's way to being given. HOWEVER, as we were departing, I was asked how our stay was. I asked them if they 'really want to know?" And I was given a sincere "Yes". So, I listed my grievances. A supervisor was called (Todd Metzger), and he politely asked me to repeat them. He was respectful, and attentive to my complaints. At no point did he try to make excuses. He apologized sincerely and told me how he was working on correcting these issues so other guests would not have these same problems or complaints. And he also made sure I left with a smile.Most companies do not realize the value of a happy customer. I had absolutely no intention of EVER coming back to this place again, and was already writing the 1 star review in my head. Todd was able to save the day. And in fact, I will come back again and give this place another chance.Pros:Location is excellentWonderful restaurant in the back with the best view everVery friendly staff that wants to make their clientele happyFree trolley right outside the propertyFree newspaper in the lobbyFairly decent sized roomsConsNeeds updatingCleanliness is not a priority (but I think that will be checked into)Rooms in the back of main building are against the alley-so noisy Rooms in the front of main building are on the street-so noiseySome rooms do not have proper internet ability$27 per night for parking!!TIPSThere are a couple of buildings close by that offer parking with in and out privileges for $10Street parking is free from 9pm-9amCheck the room before you take it, and make sure everything works properlyMake your reservations early for outside eating-which is amazingDon't use the run down pool off the street. There is a much nicer one in the back buildingPay extra for a room with an ocean frontSome rooms are not stocked with standard equipment. Make sure yours does at the very beginning of your stay

This hotel should at least have three and a half to four stars, so I decided to give five stars because my stay at the beach front room was better than I ever could have imagined. I wanted to treat my family to a night on the beach and they were amazed by the view. We even went night swimming in their pool/jacuzzi area. The hotel is walking distance from all the little shops and restaurants in the area. I wish we could've stayed longer. Although the inside of the room could definitely use some refurnishing, I would still recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates a nice view and loves the beach.

Great Mothers Day weekend getaway. This place was recommended by friends who have been visiting this property for over 20 years. 5 stars for location and the convenience to grocery, restaurants and shops. I highly recommend the Reef for full ocean view. You honestly never have to leave the property. It is an older resort but they have done excellent job with maintaining the place. Everything you need is right here. Peaceful sunrise and sunsets from your balcony and all the conveniences of a day at the beach. Decent sized refrigerator for drinks and snacks. Clean and comfortable bedding. Carpets could use a cleaning and the water from bathroom sink had a sewage or gas smell. Nothing fancy but you simply can't beat the amazing views. My only disappointment was being told I would automatically receive a $34 a day valet charge upon checkout. This is in addition to a $15 resort fee I paid during my reservation booking. What a way to welcome guests by adding an additional unavoidable charge. I felt trapped and this wasn't a pleasant way to start my stay. Hopefully they adjust their fees to be more appealing to the guests.

The hotel was a little old, I guess from the reviews were in the old part of the hotel.  The sad thing was that you have to Vallet the car at the hotel, but even though they parked our van in front of our room we had to walk to the back of the hotel to get our key from the vallet guys.There was a battchorlette party going on and it was way to loud for most of the night, but by 11pm they hotel staff finally care of the noise but we had been in bed since 930.

We were enticed by the beautiful pictures on their website so we booked this hotel for a relaxing stay.
