The pictures show a beautiful ocean view balcony and a peaceful looking beach.  When we arrived, omg, we were met with several loud parties right under our balcony.  People were rowdy and music were blasting to the level that we couldn't hear anything else.  This hotel rents out 5 bungalows under the Beach Front Surf rooms for parties.  I have no issues with people having parties but just do not want to have 100+ people drinking and dancing outside my balcony.  Pacific Edge Hotel in Laguna Beach advertises a completely different picture than what it is.  Their website deceptively omit the vital information about the reality of the stay.  They ought to clarify to potential customers about loud noises and parties (till 10 p.m.) right outside the balconies of the Beach Front Surf rooms.

You can't beat the location of this place! Main pros: beach is part of the hotel, friendly staff on the main strip of restaurants galleries etc, great restaurant/bar on site, very reasonable prices, functional and air conditioned rooms. Main cons: The hotel is a bit old and a bit hard to navigate (quiet big with many stairs up and down to get to where you want to be), valet parking only and  is 30 dollars a day which appears to be the norm but is good to know for future travelers. and If you are looking to hang out by the pool, this won't be my choice. We were so mesmerized by the proximity to the beach (literally on the beach) and the great restaurant/bar on the deck that we did not really care for the pool this time. A big thank you to Stacey. I forgot my laptop when I was checking in and she kindly kept it for me till the next day (when I realized I did not

On 2 different occasions I called and spoke with someone concerning reserving a bungalow. Each time I was told that a message with my name and number would be forwarded to Melinda. I also left a voicemail for her. No response. Over it!

Terrible service. Charge for everything. Check-in is 4. On a Monday, room wasn't ready until 3. Room was TINY. Asked for roll away. Charged $20. Check out is 11 am. Charge for a late check out on a Tuesday. Never experienced that before.

Room was nice inside, but what a crazy location. There's even a tiny patio, but who would want to sit outside when your room opens up to an alley with a bunch of parking spaces. We had a tiny sliver of sky toward the beech between buildings, but a really crazy location for rooms. Just a short walk to the shops which was nice though. Inside the room was cozy and plenty of room

DISCLAIMER: I'm not sure what the oceanfront rooms are like as we booked a regular room because the price was too expensive in comparison to our other available options. We were on a tight budget and arrived with high hopes because the reviews on hotels.com and Yelp were tremendous. The check-in was quick, but we had to drag our luggages upstairs - not a problem for me, but I know some would prefer an elevator or assistance. We opened the door to rugged carpeting and I just felt like the price for the night was too high for such a small room that did not feel clean. The bathroom was white...off-white rather and the curtains were stained. The property features a pool and hot tub, which were both a couple of minutes away from our room in addition to a run-down gaming area. You could hear the music bumping from the nearby restaurants, the chatter from people next door, and pretty much anything else that generated sound.The staff was very nice and accommodating with parking, check in, check out. I don't recall how much we paid for one night of parking, but I believe it was $35. If I were to stay here again, I would only book the oceanfront rooms as the reviews are promising, but I'll wait until the price is right (channeling my inner Bob Barker). Now, I am missing the CALI life...sigh.

The property location dictates the high price. I have been coming to Pacific Edge with my parents during summers since I was still in high school. I have experienced this hotel before all of the "renovations" and  "upgrades". My parents always opted for water front rooms and it really didn't even matter what the interior of the room looked like because I felt I was floating on top of the ocean when walking out on to the balcony.  They are also centrally located for access to shopping, dining, and a Ralph's grocery store right up the street. There are also two restaurants on site, The Deck and Driftwood. The views are nice, and The Deck is a good option for late night boozing. What annoyed me is the lack of hospitality by the staff. We decided to stroll in to Laguna on a Saturday night instead of Sunday. I called Pacific Edge to see if there was anything available for us to spend the night there and move to our reserved water front king the next day. After a long hold I was told everything was booked. I called Hotel Laguna who booked us a room at an extremely reasonable rate. It was nice knowing we had somewhere to crash once we arrived late in the evening. I should also mention that Hotel Laguna has a very reasonable noon check out time. Pacific Edge has a check out time of 11am and check in of 4pm.... 4pm! Hell, even Montage Laguna Beach has a noon check out time. Around 10am we called Pacific Edge to be put on the early check in list We were assured that we were in queue and would be contacted as soon as something becomes available.EVERY time I have requested early check in elsewhere, I have gotten it and this includes high end properties such as Montage and mid level properties such as La Casa del Camino. They may not have been immediate, but within an hour to two hours I would get a phone call that my room was ready.We decided to get a cocktail and a bite to eat at Watermarc while we wait and then walked around and did some shopping. By 3pm I was exhausted and told my husband we should just come back and see what the status is. When we arrived, it looked like there was a shift change and different people were there. We gave the friendly clerk our information and he informed us that indeed our room was ready. THANKS FOR COMMUNICATING THIS TO US! Great job by your staff. When I called to check if late check out was available, guess what the answer was? A big, fat, NOPE!We took our car down to the valet for the $27 per day parking charge. The room was fine. It had the basic necessities and a nice big bed. The view is unsurpassed and what made the annoyances worth it. Their village rooms are not worth the price, so unless you're willing to splurge $400 a night with parking for the water front room, go elsewhere.We did get the little $10 plush seal to save the seals, plus I thought it was something cute to bring back to my daughter. Now that I reflect on it, even that was a rip off. The complete lack of accountability and unwillingness to accommodate a patron of over 10 years calls for a break up. Plus, Laguna is really not at a shortrage of beautiful ocean front properties.TO CLARIFY:I understand it is difficult to accommodate every guest's request. MY gripe was with the fact that when we showed up at 3PM.. our room was already ready! NO ONE CALLED US AS PROMISED. Had we not stumbled in an hour early, we'd still be wandering around, paying $400 for nothing.

We had a good experience at the Pacific Edge. Our only complaint is the lack of towels allowed on the beach and pool. They only give you one towel per chair. For the most part, towels were scarce at the pool, and you had to ask everyday for towels to be supplied. Otherwise, we enjoyed our week stay.

Oh dear--where do I start?   No light by my bed-- only 4 bright overheads in the entire room. No electrical outlet by my bed so I could reach my phone as it was recharging. No clock. The bed faced one way but the TV was on a side wall over my left shoulder. No upholstered chairs to sit in to watch TV. Filter hadn't been cleaned from coffee maker so coffee was full of grounds. So-called breakfast had only pastries, and no protein--very expensive and not included with lodging price. Banana was $5. (I went to the nearby grocery store and got a banana for $0.14.).  Check out time was 11 a.m., but at 10:40, someone knocked on my door and tried to get in. When I went to the door, it was the cleaning lady. I reminded her that I had the room for another 20 minutes. Walls were so thin that I could understand the words of the speaker on the TV program they were watching.

By far the best hotel I've ever stayed at. My wife and I came here for our two year anniversary. Check in was at 4 pm but we came early to walk the area which is full of shops, restaurants and bars within 5 minutes. Ralph's is literally a minute walk so if you forgot anything, you're in good hands.  We decided to meet with the front desk to possibly check in early.  They were extremely helpful and offered to check us in, however, the room wouldn't be ready until 4pm. Which was no big deal. CJ assisted us at the front desk and he was very helpful and got us the best room in the reef building. Top floor with ocean front.  Due to limited parking (street meter parking) we found it more convenient just to do the $30 for valet.  The valet guys were extremely nice, helpful and quick at their service. Since we had limited time before the sunset. We just grabbed Taco Bell and sat on beach chairs that the hotel provides and had our dinner and enjoyed the sunset. We ordered room service for breakfast and wow was the food great.  We ordered the Laguna Beach omelet which is stuffed with Dungeness crab. We also ordered the French Toast which was amazing. All in all, I have no complaints about this place. Definitely recommended. If you play Pokémon then the reef building would be the best building for you since there's a Pokéstop right outside with great Pokémon spawns... just saying.

We chose this hotel due to the price and close proximity to the beach and down. The staff is friendly, too! The rooms, however, are a bit run down and not very clean. There were boogers on the shower curtain, and the bath tub looked like something out of a city apartment. We only slept for one night, in which case the bed was comfortable and we could hear the ocean with window open. For being right by the pool, it was a quiet room, to be honest. We would stay here again, but would rather budget for something nicer. It is such a nice area and all!

We stayed for two nights while my husband had work at UC Irvine. We upgraded to the penthouse for about $100 more per night (compared to a street view) - the view was decent but unfortunately we were still across the street from the ocean itself rather than right on the water. The room was fine: clean and spacious, and certainly more room than we needed for the two of us. Definitely could use some fresh love. The shower was in the middle of the wall - much too low for my 6'4" husband and definitely too low for my 5'6" self as well. The location is great - walking distance to restaurants, bars, art galleries, spin studio, etc. Being right on the water (essentially) was amazing, and the beach attendant got me set up with a lounger, umbrella and towel for the day. Five stars for location, three stars for the actual room.

I was looking so forward to going here for my best friends birthday. It came highly recommended by a friend that has gone multiple times. So my friend and I called to reserve a room and the rate at the time was around $230 per night.  She put her credit card down to reserve it. So we thought we had it booked. She called the other day just to confirm our reservations and our new total was now $1150 for two nights. We were shocked!  She asked to talk to the manager and he said the price was subject to change since it wasn't paid in full. When we gave the credit card we assumed we were getting the price when the room was reserved. No one mentioned anything about the price being subject to change. The manager would not budge on the new price.  Now we are stressed scrambling at the last minute to find a new birthday destination.  I'm the type of person when I find a place a like, I'm a repeat customer, and I recommend to friends.  They just lost my business.
We've been here since noon and assigned a room and it's 3:30 and still can not check in. Other hotels will have housekeeping have the room ready within an hour.

Stayed here just for a couple of nights. I did lots of research online before booking my hotel in Laguna. This one offered beach and ocean views and had a good value/price. I'm glad I only booked two nights because they charge $100 per night as a deposit! When traveling on a budget, that can break the bank for some! We didn't get an ocean view room as we requested. The room was very small, close to dorm room size. Bathroom was okay but the tub had drainage issues. Water kept gurgling back up during my showers. The door connecting to another room was paper thin and I could hear almost everything the neighbor was doing or was saying. The only perks of this hotel was the private beach and on site coin laundry. It was valet only at $30 per night. No self parking spots at all. We opted to park on the street in a neighborhood down the street since we already had a $100 per night hold on our card. $30 per night for parking is excessive. $100 deposit per night is excessive. There aren't a lot of options in this sleepy town, but I would take a gamble with a different hotel if I were you.

We have stayed twice and love this hotel.  If you are looking for fine finishes and upscale amenities you won't find them here but neither will you pay $500 night.   The staff is very sweet and accommodating.  Our last visit was for 5 nights and housekeeping was great as were the beach attendants and the office.  You can walk to any restaurant in town.  It's a little hidden gem for sure.

Great front desk staff and very accommodating for early check in and late check out. You won't beat this view orlocation... Literally feet from the ocean. Clean and friendly staff and everything you would need (including a Ralph's) is walking distance.

Unfortunately bed experience, rooms are small and not very clean. Charging more for ocean view which we are ok with yet still not very nice room especially for the money. We asked for a refund and they refused so we left anyway even before checking in. So here we are sitting in the car searching for anything clean to stay at for the night. Heck with the money we lost but we have a standard for where we sleep and this did not meet it. Thank god we got the car washed but I wish we brought our pillows with us. I would not recommend this place.

Worst room I've ever stayed in. The staff was rude and the room was very small and was on a slant so it was hard to walk around without feeling like you were going to fall down. The room also smelled like urine because they allow dogs at this hotel. I called the hotel before I arrived to make sure I could check in early because I needed the room to get ready for my sons wedding. They told me to come in 2 hours and my room would be ready, when I got there they said I would have to wait because my room still wasnt ready and that was at 10 am. My room wasnt ready until 3:15 that day. I had to go all the way back home and get ready for the wedding because the lady at the desk lied to me about getting my room early. Also they charge you a resort fee and a $34 valet fee that they don't tell you about until you check out. Beware of this place! The manager replied and is lying. The room is slanted! And it smells of urine! They never told me of any fees until I checked out! I stayed in room 36 and it felt like I was in the old haunted shack at knotts berry farm! He writes his response to make people think that everything is good and believe me it is not!

Beware false advertising! I bought a Groupon "deal" for this place and it was not at all what was advertised. All the room photos they use in their ads/website are for very specific sections of the hotel. They don't show any photos of the rooms you'll likely end up getting (we stayed in the "Bahia" section). The Bahia room was a total dump and not at all worth the price we paid. It was more like a run down motel room than the "resort" they advertise to be. The balconies in the photos all show a beautiful beachfront view...but if your in the "Bahia" or "Sea" section your veiw is of the valet parking. The pool was filthy and sad too. Also, they charge $34 per night for parking (which was not made clear upon making reservations). The only saving grace was the hotels close location to the beach. Even from our run down section the beach was just a short walk away. Beautiful beach.

We got the beach front views for our honeymoon but when we arrived we pulled the sheets down to relax and they were stained with semen!! The couch wasn't any better.. I've seen the tests on the news to see if hotels actually change sheets but never thought it would be a reality. They couldn't have just "forgot" either because it was perfectly made. By the time we went to the office and they found someone to change the sheets (they had to go back 3 times to get the right sheets because he originally tried doing it without a fitted sheet and just throwing blankets on the bed) our night was over. Not a fun first honeymoon night. The only reason they get 2 stars instead of 1 is because the manager took ownership and gave a small discount. Still didn't made up for it though.

This was actually our 3rd time staying here and Javid helped us with our reservation this time. Let me start off by telling you all that yes, *gasp* there is a 30 dollar valet fee if you choose. There is no free self parking however, there are other places to park if you don't mind walking a bit. This place is clean, has the BEST views, great food and stellar customer service! It is our favorite place to visit in Laguna so far.

I read a few of the other lower reviews and I'd put money down on the fact that most of those lower-starred reviews were from spoiled rich people. This place is BEAUTIFUL, the cost is insanely low for the location and amenities, and the service was fantastic! When I checked in, I was offered free champagne for my first stay with my partner, a sweet touch! Michael R. was fantastic with our check-in and made us feel really welcome! He answered all my questions with a genuine friendly smile and was very sweet!We enjoyed the beach access, the pool and hot tub, and the room was very clean and beautiful! We ordered room service (appetizers and steak) and it came in 30 minutes! The gentleman with glasses who brought the food was professional and enthusiastic, just adding toour awesome service experience! Yes, parking is $30, and yes, the walla are thin, but all you have to do is park on the street nearby (there's tons of parking) and  be respectful of your neighbors! If we had had any issues with our neighbors, you could easily call the front desk and request they ask them to keep it down! For the extremely affordable price, these tiny cons are not insurmountable. If your experience was that affected by these minuscule things you could stay at the Ritz and pay three times the room price. I loved my stay here and can't wait to come back! Just a tip- if you want afforable and yummy breakfast or lunch, walk south up the street a bit to the Orange Inn! They have delicious fresh food and fresh-pressed orange juice made daily! Thank you to everyone at the hotel, we will be back!

3 stars because the staff is adorable, caring, and accommodating . The hotel not so much. Our room was yuck, 2 double beds. Period. Not even a chair, dirty carpet. AC worked well, a plus in 90-degree + weather! Location is excellent.

I really enjoyed my stay here. All of the staff are so friendly and the view is amazing. The rooms are not fancy or anything but the view & the location is really nice. Restaurants and shopping are in walking distance and there are plenty of boutiques nearby. Bring your own pillows the pillows here are flat as a pancake. I will most certainly return. Very relaxing atmosphere.

Perfect location for a beach vacation. Easy walking to downtown and a great spot for beach access. Had an updated ocean view room in Reef building. Didn't try restaurants because menus were not kid friendly. Valet was easy and fast.  We love Laguna and although this was our first time staying at Pacific Edge it is definitely not the last.

We had an amazing weekend here. It has a great atmosphere and beautiful views. Right on the beach and easy walk to pretty much anything you want to do. For room serviceI had the 'Laguna Beach Omelette" and it was incredible.

Hi.  I stayed at this hotel back in December.  I had some issues with the room I was given.  It really lacked the quality that was described in the pictures.  I was offered an upgrade and was charged an incorrect amount on my credit card.  I tried to contact the manger numerous times but he never got back to me.  I travel often and would never recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms are old and outdated.   I would go to La Casa Del Camino, 14 West or Inn at Laguna Beach over this hotel.

This is what happens when private ownership of a hotel goes bad. This hotel had everything wrong with it. Where should I start?1. Mold on the walls of the bathroom and revolting soggy carpets on the hotel floors (soaked with what liquid? One can only imagine) 2. Feces smeared on the wall above the toilet--the bathroom clearly had NOT been cleaned. Our other friends (we had four groups staying there with us) had the same experience. There was no maid cleaning at all. EXTREMELY DIRTY!3. Loud air conditioning fan that sounded like a buzz-saw all night long4. No toilet paper or kleenex in the bathroom (MAID SERVICE, WHERE ARE YOU?!)5. Paper thin walls where you can hear every grunt, groan, bed squeak and loud screams of ecstasy next door...not to mention the drunk barfing in the alley6. Patio windows that aren't really windows but a door that leads to the main walkway (which also happened to not lock...my wife barely slept  all night thinking a maintenance man was going to break in and harm us). Anyone could walk right in since the door led to the main sidewalk. Bizarre! If you want fresh air, anyone walking by can head right on in to your room, or have a full eyeful of your naked body sprawled on the bed.7. No room service to speak of. If there was any, we could not find it.8. Dilapidated grounds with no upkeep.9. Lumpy beds that cave in the middle and smell like human body odor 10. The only fresh-air source is the small window that opened above the alley above the trash cans (and this wasn't the only horrible room in the place; all of our friends reported similar issues)11. Slimy tub floor without stick guard; my wife slipped and nearly killed herself while shaving her legs12. No drainage in either the sink or the tub. Nothing better than showering in knee-deep murky water filled with someone else's hairs!13. Unaffected office staff when we complained. One actually said, "Our owners don't care, so why should we?" Wow. Just...WOW14. Overpriced. Winter rooms $389. I get that for summer...possibly. But who wants to go on the beach when it's storming outside? Winter prices should have been adjusted accordingly, and also considered the mold, smell, safety, and trash issues. Disgust should not be the prevailing emotion when on vacation. You make the Motel 6 look good. At least Motel 6 is clean!15. A bias against Asians. No Asian decor or food items to reflect cultural diversity. But then again, that may be MY bias. The rest of the review is unbiased.In conclusion, if you don't mind spending top dollar for a dirty hole, then this is your place!UPDATE: This is my response to the manager who contacted me. My review stands.Hello Alex,I can assure you that I'm not "claiming" these events happened because trust me, they actually did. Nor am I trying to get a free room because I will never stay at your skanky, disgusting hotel again. You couldn't pay me to! Ten people in our party had the same awful experience. Dirty towels, feces smears on the walls, mold, trash smell outside windows, smelly beds, dirty carpets, ankle-deep in dirty tub water that didn't drain, foul stench in all the rooms, and poor customer service. I suggest you look into managing your maid service, updating your dilapidated hotel rooms, and thinking about what a customer might experience at your slovenly establishment when they are there on business or for a romantic getaway. Obviously, the owners don't care about their clients or their experience. This hotel is clearly designed to rip off the unsuspecting tourist. It's obviously just a cash cow for the owners and nothing else. What about pride of ownership and the client's experience? What about how a hotel guest might feel when they have to pay for such a terrible experience when they were expecting a getaway from the difficulties of life? What about females who stay there and need fresh-air ventilation in your stuffy rooms but can't get fresh air unless they open patio doors onto the main walkway where transients and maintenance people and strangers walk by? What about the embarrassment that business people have when their clients realize what kind of rathole they're staying in?  I'm sorry you work for this company and have to do damage control for them. It must be a hard job. Anyway, thanks for reaching out, but nothing can undo what took years in the making. A hotel that poorly run doesn't just happen overnight or with one person. Best of luck to you.ChenPS--My Asian decor comment was in jest. I know your hotel is going for the beachy look and vibe. (And, obviously, the moldy look and vibe, too).

Chose this place for a business meeting my fiancee and i had. When we arrived and got the first room we were a bit dissapointed it only had a stand up shower. I called front desk and Travis said he will see if he has anything. He called me shortly and put us in a room with a bath tub and a mini kitchen. I was wowed, he was fast and very nice about it. I would definitely use this place again based on customer service. The property is nice, very close to the beach. I enjoyed listening to the waves before sleep! Thank you Travis, you are awesome!!

My daughter got stung by a dead bee by the pool. If she was allergic to bees we would have taken her to the emergency room and ruined our whole day. Also the bed was too small so I asked for two double beds, so I switched but it was very small room with the pool right by our room. Also around 11:30pm the security walks into our room unannounced and doesn't say anything.  I called the front desk and he said it was their fault thinking it was vacant and asks me what my name is in a accusatory way, with a fake apology and a fake tone in his voice. It looks worse than motel six. With only two big towels. When I tested the screen doors any body could walk straight into the room. Very disappointed.

This place is a low class, unbelievably ghetto place. No Beach like advertised. Rude valet that fight with their neighbors - these people are crazy: yelling screaming, threatening. Would not recommend for a vacation...or wait anytime.

We booked online through Bookings.com for a three night stay.    Key for us was a kitchenette and room for us and our two kids.  We came to this hotel for that purpose.   When we arrived, the front desk had oversold the property, and they did not have the room that we paid for.   They put us in a regular room with double beds, gave us $100 off and credited valet parking for the duration.    The next day, they moved us into the kitchenette room.   It was beachy so I was not expecting much.    I expected beachy.  However, the pull out couch was not made up.  There was only one towel in the bathroom.   So we called.   They guy apologized but they did not have sheets for the oil out (sold out, you know).  He brought towels and blankets which our boys used that night.   Next day, housekeeping shows up.   We have to ask them to make up the bed with sheets.   They were going to leave it with blankets.   They clean the room but do not wipe down surfaces in the kitchen.  No knives, which we asked for.  They finally brought. No dish detergent, which we got from the front desk.   We are checking out today, and I am glad to be leaving.  I don't have high expectations, but I'm really disappointed in this experience, particularly for the price.  I also don't write reviews, so this tells you something.    I will never come back here, although I will be back in Laguna again.   I would avoid.   I'm sure there are better places for value and service.  On a positive note, food and service at their Deck restaurant was outstanding.

Loved this place! We upgraded to a ocean view room upon arrival and boy were we happy we did that (room#121 for reference). All staff was extremely nice and helpful. The view was breathtaking!!! The room was decorated nicely with a beachy feel. We met a really nice housecleaning lady in the hall and she was so nice as to offer us extra hair wash and lotion seeing that we had 2 little kids with us. She also mention where the extra blankets were and how to use the heater. Room service was prompt, we order 3 times and each time the server was really nice and friendly. We recommend the prosecco champagne, with the view and some music it's memorizing. If your worried about location this place is walking distance to everything! Your only steps away from the beach. The hotel ha it's own stairway to the sand, with free towels, beach chairs and umbrellas. There's restaurants located on either side of the hotel and a Ralph's store across the street at the light. I gave it 4 stars because it's a older hotel and could use some revocations to the outside. Also, the pillows were too firm for my liking.

Excellent stay!  We booked the oceanfront suite for V-day.  The hotel staff could not have been nicer.  In particular, Javid (front desk) was most welcoming and friendly.  He gave us a bottle of decent champagne upon arrival.  Tyler (valet) was also very courteous with car, suitcases, and providing us directions to local spots.The rooms, especially oceanfront suite, were worth every penny.  Ocean views for miles.  It was very relaxing going to sleep with the sound of crashing waves.  Great stay.  We'll definitely be back!

I booked a deal through Groupon based solely on the pictures. After booking the room I then read reviews and may have freaked myself out a little. My best advise for you is to just listen to the good reviews. Customer service is top notch. Splurge to make sure you get an ocean view room. You will not be disappointed. The only drawback is you have to valet any vehicles and most likely they will be parked right outside your room anyways. They should just have a self parking option. All and all great hotel with prime ocean access.

My husband would give this hotel 100 stars if he could. It's pricey--$35 valet, $100 deposit, plus resort fee, additional taxes and then the room rate. But you get what you pay for with a beachfront room at Pacific Edge: immaculate room, plenty of space, nice bathroom with luxe amenities, comfy bed, mini fridge, fantastic cable TV options, delicious Keurig coffee (finally, good coffee in a hotel room) ... oh, and I dunno, the most PERFECT VIEW OF GORGEOUS REAL ESTATE EVER. We hardly slept because we didn't want to miss a thing. Sunsets. Sunrises. Beach directly downstairs. We were getting our life here and cannot wait to return. Coming in the off-season was the best decision; total privacy, peace and quiet--and still in November, powder blue skies and golden sunshine. If you want to Hawaii in SoCal, come here. Customer service was A+ and there's a Ralph's right across the street. Our new favorite hotel.

When I arrived to the hotel it took about 20 minutes to check in because they couldn't find my reservation. Yes, I reserved through Hotwire but I have done this every time I travel and never had an issue before. Once everything was squared away we left to our hotel room and tried to get in, the key cards where not working so we had to wait in the cold before we got new ones. By this time I am disappointed already and just want to get in my room since  it's so cold. Once we got in the room I was unimpressed. The room was lackluster and blah. It was tiny. Yes I get that you get what you pay for, but I have stayed in Laguna Beach before and paid the same price for a larger, nicer room. On top of that, there was plenty of parking but I was told I had to pay $34 for valet parking so I had to walk up to street parking in the cold, and once again at 8 am to put money in the meter. Very inconvenient. Ugh, so disappointed this was supposed to be a romantic night for my boyfriend and I celebrating our anniversary. Instead I was filled with disappointment for trying something new. Would not recommend and would not stay here again.

Let's see... it would make not a good, but an ok, Motel 6.  Spent four nights here. For showers hot or even warm water took forever AND cut out altogether while my wife was taking a shower. And I got used to shaving in cold water. Hell, even the pool was cold. The furniture- Goodwill would be ashamed to try to sell these dinged up raggedy items. Our drapes never closed all the way (hello passerby!) and lacked the inner "let light thru" inner drapes. Oh, the tracks were there, just not the drapes. I could go on and on, but let me just leave you with this: mandatory arrogant valet parking at $30/night & the valet flipped me the bird while scratching between his eyes when I asked him where else could I park. So picture a dingy Motel 6 in a bad neighborhood in a small town, then ask yourself, is that really worth $250 a night & you've got to park your car 3 blocks away UPHILL or pay an extra $30/night valet???******************Alex- thanks for your reply. However, you never said exactly what you are doing to address the issues: what are you doing to replace your malfunctioning hot water heaters? Your missing drapes? Your tore-up  furniture? Your hillbilly electrical hookups in the rooms? The cold swimming pools? And I didn't mention it, but you might look into checking the wooden chairs in the restaurant by the outdoor bar- mine was on the verge of collapsing. If/when that happens to a future customer that is a lawsuit your business will not win. As for the snooty valet, it was the tall dark haired 20'ish man with the goatee.  As for the supposed mandatory valet parking, if that really is a city requirement, there is certainly NO requirement to charge an arm & a leg for it. It could & should be complimentary. The vast majority of men get pissed off at being forced into using valet parking- why would you want their very first physical contact with your facility to be one that makes them pissed / stressed / worried? That's a HELLUVA way to start a vacation.

Pros: near the beach, partial beach view, location, dog friendly, the beds were comfortable and clean, lots of cable channels, room service was nice, plenty of towels, food looked amazing. Great vibe. Cons: disgusting carpets made sure to keep shoes on. I think pet friendly hotel rooms should be tile or lament, not carpet. Shower water was either cold or scorching hot no medium.  Food was cold when delivered to room but it took so long to get didn't want to call and complain. Torn curtain, torn screen needs some updating. Parking fee is high, we are already servicing your hotel so why punish us by charging $30 a night to park? Thin walls.

Got a room with an ocean view and it did not disappoint if you just sat on the balcony. The room itself was meh. The toilet didn't flush and the bathroom was super small. A plus with a fridge in the room but it didn't really work. 2 queen beds, nothing special. The best was keeping the balcony door open to hear the ocean all night. Wish the neighbors didn't keep their air conditioner going all the time blowing hot air onto our balcony ( it was already 80'degrees). Ordered room service in the morning and they had some credit card issues so we had to pay cash but it was nice sitting on the balcony listening to the ocean eating Dungeness crab omelettes and sipping coffee watching the surfers and the occasional otter. We also enjoyed the beach chairs on the sand. I found out later the valet had scratched my new car. Sigh. Overall you are paying for the experience of being on the ocean not spending time in the room. I'd probably stay again but again only in an ocean front room.

My fave reasonable Laguna Hotel. Will always return. Right on the beach in a perfect location. Great restaurants. Great front desk service. No frills rooms but you're not in Laguna to spend time in the room. Big and roomy though. Cute lobby.

Was planning a romantic birthday weekend for my boyfriend so we picked this place, unfortunately when we got there the rooms were NOTHING like they were presented online, it was one room with literally a bed, tv, and mini fridge and a coffee maker all in one corner. We stayed here in December so it was very cold out, however there was no comforter blanket, there were no extra blankets or pillows provided in the room, the heater also was NOT working AT ALL, only was blowing cold air so we had to run hot water to keep warm all night. And if that wasn't bad enough they don't tell you about the valet charge per night which would be acceptable if it was under $15 a night, but $34 per night?? Is all that  necessary? At least disclose that before people drive all the way there and then have no choice but to pay it or risk parking on the street. We booked through a third party travel agency so we initially tried to get a refund or room transfer from them, they couldn't help us which was understandable, so we tried to get a room transfer through the hotel and they said it would be significantly extra to do so. So we endured the chilly night and immediately booked another hotel within the immediate area for the rest of our stay (check my review for Laguna Brisas Hotel) The only reason I'm giving 2 STARS and not 1 STAR is for the location, if you are looking to be within a stones throw of the ocean and do not care at all about the condition of your room I'd recommend going in the warmer parts of the season at least

Very disappointing stay at Pacific Edge. I have been coming to this resort for over 40 years and remained loyal even after the change of ownership from Vacation Village to the current Pacific Edge ownership. Hotel got a facelift about 10 years ago and with that a price hike of 2-3 times more. Still, we continued to come and enjoy the great location and home away from home feel. They have not maintained the property since the facelift: our room door was swollen shut so we had to use the force of our bodies to un-jam the door to get in and out, and have the bruises to prove it. Engineering was called out (and arrived after returning from their lunch break), but said they couldn't do anything other than remove the door to shave it down, which we agreed to, but then they disappeared to never return. A/C unit from next door unit was making loud gurgling noises, cable TV froze and needed to be addressed. We bought a croissant from a neighboring cafe and tried to locate a microwave on site to warm, neither restaurant on site said they had a microwave, nor did they have one in the lobby, and front desk said there was no staff lounge with a micro either, but they could have one sent to our room for an additional $10. Really? There's more, but will leave it at that. The staff we worked with including Joshua, Dylan, Lanaya (?) and the engineers were most pleasant and tried to accommodate the best they could, but this is clearly and management/ownership issue. They can't expect employees to run a top notch operation when the ship is sinking. I hope they realize that before this thing capsizes.

I stayed here last year and returned agin this year. Unfortunately my car broke down this trip!  I needed to stay an extra night. C.J.  was so understanding and compassionate. This place is the best! I loved the beautiful ocean view from my room. And the people here are the kindest I have ever encountered from a hotel. I can't speak highly enough about them. I have to return soon to get my car and even though the price is out of my range, I wouldn't stay anywhere else!  I plan on coming back here every year. The rooms are great and the staff truly make you feel welcome. Thank you C.J. For all of your help.

I was very disappointed with my stay. For $400 per night i was expecting a decent looking hotel. my friends and i were greeted with a nauseating smell and a very small room fit for 1 person. the walls were blue and the headboard came off and almost hit my friend in the head. the room was old and rundown. the bathroom was so small you cant bend over without hitting the wall. the carpet was dirty i was scared to step on it barefoot. the AC was loud and the bed was hard. i did not enjoy my stay. i wouldve expected that they would at least renovate the rooms since they're charging so much but no. for $400 you can easily stay at the Wynn. Ive been to 3rd world countries and they have better hotels. never going back and wiil be embarassed to recommend to friends.
Awesome experience at this place. Stayed in the reef building with amazing views and great hotel service and amenities. Must get a room w a balcony on the beach; you won't regret it.

Pacific Edge Hotel is a quaint boutique spot situated in one of the best locations in Laguna Beach. Location is rated A1. You cant beat this location!  Right on a great stretch of sand smack dab in the middle of all the great restaurants and shops. View: To Die For!!!! The front desk was efficient and friendly. They were young and had a great energy. The room was small but clean and updated.  Bathroom was small too but we came for the beach not the bed and bathroom.  Price: we got a pretty decent price online so do your homework if you are on a budget. Tip: valet parking is expensive but theres metered parking out front if youre staying just 1 night.

Where to start?!?!? We had to reservation at this location. One in the premier rooms and one in the standard room. The premier room was $160 more compared to the standard room. Which we understand you pay more you get more. But the first night the towels in the bathroom of the premier room had feces on them. We called down to the front desk and brought a new towel. Didn't say anything else. In our eyes that's pretty disgusting. In addition we valet parked our car for two nights. The first morning we went to the trunk and there was something poured or spilled on the trunk. Didn't know what it was. Then this afternoon we got the car again and same thing..... but this time it was YELLOW. It was urine on the back of our vehicle in a "secure" parking. Urine two evenings in a row. Nasty. Now on to the standard room. After hearing about our other reservation we checked our towels. Well the good thing is we didn't have feces... we had blood on our towels. We let the front desk manager know and they said thank you for the comment. What the heck. Moving forward. The bed had a divot in the middle so we rolled to the center. The shower ran out of hot water in about 5 mins. The coffee maker did not work, no power or anything. We brought these issues up and they had NO empathy. Didn't offer comp our parking or we are sorry. Just said thank you for your comment.  Will not be staying here again or recommending this property.

It's a pet peeve of mine when a business that fails to respond to your issue in person only responds on yelp. After asking to speak with a manager and being told they were not there I specifically asked front desk staff TWICE, 2 separate times, to have a manager CALL me. I never got a phone call. However instead of calling the manager just  responded to my review. I wish that customer complaints were handled in a proactive manner instead of waiting for a bad review. It seems unprofessional to avoid speaking directly with customers and instead choosing a more passive form of communication.

I give this establishment 3 stars only because of the incompetent lady working the front desk that day.. Requested for my credit card at check-in and told me that we were not able to get our room? But why? She stated that my card kept "declining" Mind you, we had already informed her that we have reservations for a prepaid room. A simple easy task to just locate our reservation that was already prepaid! Viola! This whole incident costed us two hours to fix... Going through traffic to find a bank, running all over the place trying to figure out what is going on!  I had my whole family in the car! 2 children (infant and a 7 year old) and my partner! We requested to see management, however, they stated that "he" was busy and we were informed that "he" will be notified with the incident.  We never heard from him.. Finally, after receiving our cards to our room.. We went through valet.. A very nice young man by the name of Ryan, I believe.. Very helpful and polite. Helped us settle in to our room.. I must admit it was beautiful.. I advise anybody who stays here, should definitely experience a beachfront room! It's cozy and sweet.. I left the sliding door open throughout the night and I absolutely enjoyed the sounds of the waves crashing.. The location is great! You can walk the busy streets to grab some refreshments and grab a bite to eat! The orange inn, across the street is delicious! I would definitely go back.. But first impressions really disappointed me..Attention to Thomas lee: Greetings, Thomas..Thankyou for taking the time to respond to my review.  To answer your question, Yes, it was our first time staying at the pacific edge hotel.  Hopefully we get to meet you the next time we visit!

What a waste of money!!!  We paid over $200 for our room that was right off the parking lot.  The bathroom and closet were tiny.  The air conditioning unit was loud and didn't cool down the room at all.  I've stayed in motels that are a lot cheaper and in better condition than this place.  We should have just drove home and saved our money.  NEVER AGAIN!!

Great location. Funky beach hotel. Pool was motel style. Hotel guests get no priority seating at the restaurants on site (which are always packed with locals), so the wait for any seating, breakfast, lunch or dinner is always over an hour. And the pillows are horrible! Requested down/or replacement pillows and the request was not well received by the desk. Overall we've stayed here a number of times, purely for the location. But a resort it is not. It's a fun spot for a couple of days, not a week vacation.

5 stars alone for the decent, FREE bottle of wine we received upon check in. I am definitely a big wine lover and that just won me over. We got to choose between a red or white wine, and also champagne. We chose the red and it was actually pretty good. The room itself wasn't anything fancy but it was great for my boyfriend and I. Had everything we needed and was very cozy. We had our own balcony and a partial view of the ocean. I don't know about anybody else, but I for one HATE staying somewhere where the water pressure in the shower isn't very good and that wasn't the case for here, it was perfect. The room had a Keurig and came with some delicious French roast which I enjoyed. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Did I mention we got a FREE bottle of wine?! ;-)

One of the most over priced hotels.. Stay away. The rooms all on the Bahia side are old, the decor is old and stained, the kitchens are not remodeled with dirty grout. And particularly- Bahia room 14 on the third floor, the toilet seat doesn't match the toilet, it's too small.We paid a lot of money for this room and none of the Bahia rooms have king size beds. The indoor/outdoor carpets on the balconies are stained. The kitchens are not clean with coffee stains on the counter tops and dirt on top of the refrigerators.. And unless you are on third floor you barely get an ocean view.. And if your on the bottom floors you get the stinky fish /seafood smell from the restaurants across your balconies with a view of the valet guys running back and forth and the smokers outside the Driftwood Restaurant. Nice... so not..The showers are awful, the shower heads are horrible. The water comes out like misty rain with a dirty flimsy cloth curtain with dirty grout tiles. And the rickety scary elevator that takes forever is better than walking up and down the dirty small stairs. The only good thing is the valet and bell desk guys were very nice and helpful. And don't waste your time eating at the Driftwood Kitchen across the way. They try to make the food fancy and it's too salty and the drinks were not good either.. My suggestion is to book across the street to 14 West Boutique hotel. They have small kitchenettes but with clean modern rooms. You don't have a view of the ocean but you have a nice clean new room!Thomas:Yes, we told the front desk that we were not happy and unfortunately they were booked that weekend. The best they could do was move us to the third floor, Bahia #14, on our last night there where we could see a glimpse of ocean view. But my fiancée is 6'3 and to have only queen beds on that side of the hotel is ridiculous. We specifically asked for a king size bed when we booked the room. The room they moved us to was slightly better than the first floor room. Except Bahia #14 has an older kitchen then the  Bahia #2 first floor room. And the front desk lady told us before we checked in to Bahia #2 the room had updated furniture. Which we beg to differ... Needless to say, we will not be coming back.
Amazing all around!!! Costumer service, the rooms, food and spectacular views. First time here, and I already can't wait to come back. Love Love Love this place.

Loved our experience here. We did bite the bullet and get an ocean front room. What a view!!! Our balcony was right above the ocean. We were there for 3 nights and never left the property. The staff is friendly and welcoming. The food and view at Driftwood Inn & The Deck is amazing. There is truly no reason to leave.

A truly budget priced hotel in pricey Laguna Beach!  It's right off the beach which is an added bonus!  The rooms are older in construction but updated as best they can. The walls are on the thinner side so you might be able to hear your neighbors. It's very close to the heart of the city so you will be able to enjoy a nice walk. We'll be sure to come here next year to enjoy the beaches!

I read the previous reviews after I booked the hotel for a staycation with my wife and was very nervous about what my stay would be like. Well......I was very impressed!!!! Could not have been happier!!!! Our room was in the Reef property and was right on the water, could not have been closer. The room was great, staff was awesome and my whole experience was amazing. I would stay here anytime and would not have an issue recommending this property to anyone!!!!

I'm so disappointed at this place , it's a motel I guess ,there's something with the smell in the room .I suggest they should  remove the carpet, major renovation is needed.I'm paying almost a $1000 for 2 nights!$30 for valet unbelievable!Not worth it !

After experimenting several awful motels this place was obviously a nice upgrade. Its location on the beach is nice and the possibility to get towels and long chairs is definitely appreciable. There are also two pools and a jacuzzi in between the rooms  that are ok. The room was clean. Service was also ok. Prices are a bit high for the value and the fact that parking costs 30$ a night was minder. This hotel is a good alternative between fancy places and motels.

The Pacific Edge is a great hotel with multiple restaurants, extensive room service menu, clean and cute rooms, and a great location with beach access. It's usually on the more affordable end of hotels in the area, and well worth the money, in my opinion. My only issue is the staff - only slightly unpleasant at the front desk, but very unpleasant room service delivery.

The old saying, you get what you pay for is almost certainly true with regards to this "hotel". Essentially, what you're getting is a spruced up Motel that was painted some bright colors and decorated a bit to today's styles. This hotel really misses the bar on some aspects, yet offers others to make up for it. The reviews are right, the details are just so blatantly ignored it was almost laughable. Missing molding, chipped paint, weird furniture and a weird smell coming from the plumbing in the bathroom. beware the janky elevator! LOLWith that said, the bed felt clean, the location is stellar and the service was also quite nice. Quick and friendly check in and check-out. They offer good coffee in the room and Starbucks in the lobby. They also offer chairs, towels, and umbrellas for the beach. Did I mention this hotel is right on the beach? All in all, I would probably come back to this hotel and maybe go for a more premium room.

False advertisement.  I'm not a complainer, but I don't want anyone else wasting their money and vacation time like we did today.  We arrived at PEH this morning and though everyone was very nice and the location couldn't be better, we were highly disappointed with this hotel.  The thing is, it looks NOTHING like what was represented on their website.  Our room was ridiculously small, very dingy, and definitely could use major sprucing up. The kind of place where you don't walk around barefoot for anything.  We ended up leaving and finding another hotel.  We lost the cost of the room for tonight so we definitely wasted money, but it's worth not staying there our entire vacation.  I realize the price might be justified because of the location, but a hotel needs to portray their amenities in their true fashion so people can decide if the location is worth giving up the decent rooms.  I mean really, the room was awful.  There was zero decor (unlike in the hotel pictures), it definitely needed a paint job (the walls and doors were dirty and greasy looking, and the carpet....gross.  If you literally plan on just sleeping here, it might work out, otherwise, spend the extra bucks and find another hotel.

This Hotel is made up of a few separate buildings, all of varying quality and decor. The building attached to the pool with sauna is newer and nicer(but still not AAA). They have resort towels available, etc.The other building facing PCH is dilapidated, and honestly should be labeled a "Motel". Thin walls, disgusting carpet, and generally just run down. There is no elevator so beware. The walkway to PCH from the 2nd floor actually had a hole forming under the carpet and I was afraid my children would fall through.I suspected the quality based on the price being roughly 1/2 of anything else in the area. You really get what you pay for and Laguna Beach in general is becoming run down and in need of a make over.The location is great though. Across the street from TacoLoco and right by Sleepy Hollow and some of the nicer breaks in Laguna. I would not stay here again.

The partial view suites we reserved was not as described in photos and print online. When we questioned the front desk we were told this was it. The room did not have a private bedroom as described and the sofa bed was painfully unusable. The room was dirty and the kitchen has no inventory so it is useless. Patio door did not lock. The management was not helpful and offered no resolution so we checked out after one night in this disaster. Do not stay here!

I would give the bungalows below the hotel 5 stars.  The service was awesome and the room itself was fantastic. I recommend to anyone celebrating something special!  Only 3 stars because our hotel room was a little misleading. Our balcony looked onto the ally and the pull-out couch was by far the most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept on.  For the price we paid, I was expecting more.  But the hotel itself is beautiful and quaint.

WOW! What can I say pictures can be very deceiving! For 1 nite stay in the reef king room with ocean view I paid $547.00! Sure I got a fantastic ocean view but this hotel is 60 years old and in need of the help of " hotel impossible"! We walked into the room it smelled musty and old! The one window in the room was fiberglass and you couldn't see out of it! Beautiful view but the patio chairs were falling apart and you were afraid to sit out on the balcony not knowing if you were going to be safe out there. When you looked around at the other balconies you could see the were falling apart you could see old and rusty metal coming off! They also have plywood as dividers between balconies. The curtains were old and frail and you couldn't pull them shut! You could see they tried to remodel somewhat but I guess they were trying to nickel and dime it instead of doing it right! The carpet was horribly stained all over I didn't take off my shoes! The chairs belonged in the trash I won't even donate them! There was a huge mirror in the room look like one they would use in a interrogation room like you would see in the movies! Not very welcoming at all! Building is falling apart needs a lot of TLC! Great view Great location its a shame not properly managed or tended too! Bathroom was decent and clean and a cool wave picture over the bed. Does have room service not bad but needs more of an assortment on the menu as for the pools don't bother not as pictured! Maybe if the place looked as it looks in the pictures it would a different story but for now call in "HOTEL IMPOSSIBLE" for help! BTW one of the people in room service stated to us theres quite a few people who had the same reaction as I did that the Hotel was very deceiving and they were very disappointed. Also I even got a 20% discount before I even got here to see the place because it took me 2 hours to get a reservation both online and on the phone! Can you imagine paying full price for this kind of HOSPITALITY! One more thing have you ever heard you need to drive your car to the valet for them to park it? YES you do and that's not in front of the hotel it's in the alleyway between the hotel buildings! You first have to go to your room and unload your luggage or walk with it to your room since you have to give your keys to the valet! Then what's even more bizarre they park it in front of your room which you could have do it yourself then they charge you $34 to park it for each nite! They you need to go to them to get your keys for your car that is front of your room in order to pack up to go! Gave it 1 star for the view and room service otherwise I wouldn't have given any! This is not a safe place to stay all round! Don't know what could happen or what you might come down with!

I live in Laguna and sometimes I want to get away, but why travel when I live in paradise. I don't live beachfront but at Pacific Edge I do and I can bring my little dog. They treat locals well and although the rooms are not the Ritz, they are clean and at the Beach.

Definitely a disappointment. Pictures on Web look way better than reality. Dont be fooled by the front of the hotel/lobby. Rooms are very plain with old, loud AC units. Stains in bathtub, cracked bathroom sink and a fridge next to bathroom.  No decor AT ALL. No frames, nothing. Feels like a tiny cheap motel room in downtown LA. You have a sliding door that leads out to the hallway, not a balcony.  Even if you have an ocean view room this place wouldn't be any better. You still see the deterioration of the dingy carpet, walls, elevator.  The beach is small with free lounge chairs, towels and umbrellas. There was also no lifeguard on duty - we saw a kids dad run in to the ocean to save him from a rip tide. The pool is adjacent to the street and valet. Really small and old. Valet is super expensive. Overall not worth the money. Go elsewhere.

Pretty bummed when got to our room. Very musky and not very clean room. Needs major renovations. Even the sheets weren't comfortable at all. They really need to invest in a major Remodel of there standard rooms.  When you pay $250 a night and the pictures look way better then what you walk into very disappointing. I definitely wouldn't have booked there if we knew that going in. The staff and valet were very nice. The location was great. They also allow pets at no additional charge which was great! Just the rooms them self were majorly disappointing.

Stayed here one night in the older building facing PCH.  Luckily our room is on the other side facing the ocean w/ a view of the ocean over some roofs.  But it was a nice location.Room size is standard w/ a queen size bed.  It has a functional kitchenette with an antique cooktop w/ oven and a fridge. Bathroom is on the small side but it has a small separate dressing area.  It's like a studio apartment.Room was clean.  Furniture is functional and clean but not modern.  Bath tub could be upgraded but functional.  Bed was comfy.My room was connected to another room, separated by a door.  I can see the light coming through from the other room as well as hearing their conversation.  Luckily they were just talking, no partying.  I felt bad in the morning because I had to do a conference and was talking at 8am.  I probably woke them up :-(As other reviewers mentioned, the location of this property is excellent and I enjoyed this the most.  Walkable to many shops, grocery stores, restaurants and the beach.  Staff was great.  We didn't do valet parking because it's $30/car and we have 2 cars!  Street parking is possible.  Metered parking between 8am and 7pm so we parked on the street overnight for free.  I consider the price I paid moderate because of the room condition.  I am sure it's much more expensive for one of the newer rooms w/ better locations.  But my room met all my needs and I was happy w/ the price I paid.Overall, I had a great stay and will stay here again.

We're staying here now & the beachfront room in the Reef tower is amazing. I think the price is on point. We've stayed at the Surf & Sand, which is a couple blocks from here & about $150 more per night. This hotel is just as good & closer to the downtown village area.So far, we've eaten at Driftwood & The Deck bar & both were fantastic. Both are right on the sand.Our room is so cute & they allow dogs (no extra fee) which is a huge plus for us!!

This hotel is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at in Laguna Beach. The staff from front desk, to security, to valet, were all very rude. The front desk person literally hung up on me when I told them I would be writing this review. It was only bout 10:30 when we got a very obnoxious and intrusive knock on our door while watching a movie. The overweight female security guard continued to knock and we refused to open the door. They tried to say that one of the hotel guests had complained about noise. We were sitting in our bed, WATCHING A MOVIE, with the volume on low. Maybe if this cheap excuse for classy hotel had walls thicker than their ego, we wouldn't be having this issue. On top of that, there's a Locked door in our room that obviously connects to another room, only guessing due to the fact I could here a loud woman talking up a Storm and children causing a ruckus. The security guard left, after I threatened to call the police if she knocked again. Of course in the morning, getting ready and having the tv on led to the same situation as the night before. My night, and morning, both ruined on my vacation by poor staff. This is more like a kids camp with camp counselors than it is a beach front hotel. If I could give negative stars I would. Sincerely, Ben Smith

A nice place to stay if you want a balcony room. However no elevators at all in this building. Spendy for the lack of amenities. It took 2 days to get washcloths. Expensive parking for guests. Will look into another hotel next time.

There is no question that the view from the oceanfront rooms is beautiful. Other than that however, we found little else to entice us to return. The hotel is old and looked tired.Our bags weren't carried in, we were given the wrong room number. We paid a $30.00 fee per night for "valet parking."  Someone parked our car in the parking area near our room which we could have easily done. Our room was next to the restaurant, and the constant bass of the music playing made it impossible to rest. When we called the front desk to ask if we could have another room, they informed us that no other room was available even though we stayed two nights.  The only suggestion from the front desk was whether we wanted to check out.We've been to many very excellent hotels around the country and I can never remember being treated with that level of rudeness and dismissiveness. The folks at the front desk clearly did not care.  When we left a message for the manager "Michael" to call us back, he never did.

My family and I come to Laguna Beach every year, and we always stay at this hotel. It is very family friendly, with kind staff who are there to help out upon request. We stayed in the ocean front room, which was absolutely BEAUTIFUL. The room was clean and nice, with plenty of furniture. For a beach front hotel, the room and lobby were very clean. one if the best parts is that there is a staircase leading from the rooms down into the sand itself. The beach itself was clean, and the hotel offered towels and shaded seating on its private beach. Even toys and boards were available for use one the beach!! Will definitely be back here again next summer.

Location was the only good thing. Room is not worth the price. Just because it is close to the beach does not mean there should be such a poor and run down appearance. This is equal to a motel I stayed in on my way to the parks in Utah! Disappointed but at least I was able to walk back from the pageant of the masters. Parking is 30.00 which is also excessive! Not worth coming back.

Our stay was great! Greeted with a bottle of wine & they upgraded our room without us asking which was awesome because it was my birthday! It was a 1 minute walk down the walkway to get to the beach. Views were beautiful and room was nice and clean. Staff is friendly I have nothing bad to say about this hotel! Valet parking is $30 but you can park in the meters right in front which turn off from 7pm -8am. Very close to food and shops.

Checked in with a very helpful staff. Received a bottle of champagne because we waited a few minutes - was not expecting that but very nice gesture. I knew the hotel was renovated on the beachfront and not the section located on PCH. I don't understand why anyone that writes reviews doesn't research properly. Part of the hotel is on the beach and part on PCH. The part I rented was on PCH and had a kitchen, dining room and two bedrooms. I got exactly what I asked for and paid for. My daughter was turning 16 and wanted to celebrate at her favorite beach with a few friends. The staff was very helpful. The valet parking is also very hard working. I was helped several times up the flight of stairs with bottled water, groceries etc. The cleaning crew, valet, and front desk work very hard at pleasing. If your heading to the beach to play and need a comfy place to crash your tired sun-kissed cheeks, then this is perfect. But if you are expecting a spa like facility - do yourself a favor and check in to the $900/night Montage beach resort and spa down the street! ;)

Hosted a company meeting in bungalow meeting rooms and spent two nights.  Service excellent, Ocean rooms in Reef building older, but can't beat the ocean views and rooms clean.  Super good value and your right on the beach.

The double room was nice. Super close to the beach. The beach crew was great and provided us with chairs and an umbrella. The hotel staff was great too. We did have an issue with the people smoking in their room next to us. But after we contacted the front desk, we had no further issues. The only other bummer was the AC in our room didn't feel like it was working. It only got cooler at night. We eventually opened the window to let fresh air in.

The 3 stars are only because the location is great and the access to beach chairs and umbrellas is a huge plus in my book. Also, the staff (front desk/valet/room attendants/beach attendants) were so nice and helpful! A definite 5 star review for all of them!! Unfortunately, the room we stayed in had very dirty carpets and ANTS!! They were mainly in the bathroom. We didn't even bother to let the front desk know about the little critters during our stay in fear of a bunch of bug spray being sprayed in our room to solve the problem. We had kids with us didn't want spraying done while we were occupying the room. If the rooms were very cheap I wouldn't have been so bothered but when you're paying a premium price you have certain expectations. I did get to peek in one of the oceanfront suites and that seemed to be a lot nicer than our room which was a more basic room. So I would say if you are going to stay here opt for one of the more high-end rooms if you can. Also, $34 a night to park your car is a bit steep don't you think? Especially when you're paying a resort fee for a "resort" that provided very little amenities...
The rooms are just okay. Staff was friendly enough but could not accommodate an early check in. Easy spot to stay, within walking distance of a few shops.

My husband and I were looking forward to our ocean front room for our anniversary.  The pictures looked enticing.  However, the place and room do not match any photo. I give this hotel 2 stars as the view of the ocean is incredible, but everything else was downhill. The room was small and the carpet was so filthy it was greasy slick.  The condition of the facilities are terribly run down and one tower was involved in a fire some time ago and left in that condition, affecting our balcony view. The pool and spa near our room had no lounge chairs or towels and people kept coming in from the beach to use it with no security policing the area.  After using the pool/ spa I developed a rash on my leg that got progressively worse.  I had to go to the emergency room that night and found out I had a staph/ E. coli infection and cellulitis!!!!! The last straw was when I came out of the small bathroom shower, an enormous cockroach jumped off of my towel.  My husband managed to kill it and I notified management of my issues.  They said I could try another room , but we decided to check out as this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and I have traveled all over the world.  They only refunded 1 day of my stay and let me leave without charging for the remaining 2 nights.  You've been warned!!!

Hotel is clean and conveniently located near the beach off the PCH. My only concern is that the rooms assigned are not the ones posted on the website. Apparently there are three different buildings. The property is somewhat dated and the shower changes temperature from hot to cold on it's own. The hotel staff is very nice and accommodating. I didn't valet park because it's $30/car.  Street parking is possible.  Metered parking between 8am and 7pm, so I parked on the street overnight for free.  I will stay here again, but will reserve the room with building on actual beach!

This hotel is terrible. They lost reservation though my entire team is here.  They gave me the worst room in the place. No view, blocked terrace. I have a battered dining room table as my table and a random support column in the middle of the room. The small closet has new cedar. And the tiny bathroom has new fixtures, that's what they must have meant when they told me I have an upgraded room. If you want a broken down experience with rooms of broken promises, then this is the place for you.

After reading all the horrifying reviews on here, I was incredibly skeptical about booking a room. It seemed that those who stayed in a remodeled/new room enjoyed their stay and those who had an older room hated it. I called the hotel and the polite employee on the other end informed me to select a "deluxe" room and write a request in the comments section of the form. Her suggestion was a success! We arrived and were informed upon check-in that we had a room in the new tower (Reef Tower) and it even had an ocean view (side of the building over the top of the other one, but a view's a view!).The bed was comfortable, the restroom was very clean, and the room was incredibly spacious. It is only about a 5 minute walk from a bunch of great restaurants, art galleries, and bars downtown. Right across the street is a Ralph's grocery store that is open until 1 am every day, very useful. Photos on the hotel website show a small, outdated, bulky television; these photos are incorrect. Our room had a (brand new looking) 42+" flat screen, hd tv with satellite cable. The ONLY complaint I can even muster is the blinds in the kitchen window were very easy to see through, making it easy for people to see in and lacking privacy. They also let a lot of light in (as if there wasn't even a screen) in the morning. That being said, it was barely even an issue. To save you from wasting any more of your time, I'll just say, if you're on the fence about this place, just go for it! Put in a request for a new/remodeled room in the comments and you'll more than likely get a great room with a fantastic view. We can't wait to go back and enjoy more of what Laguna has to offer.

We celebrated my dad's 80th birthday in the bungalows at Pacific Edge Hotel. The space was perfect for all the family members -- age 5-8 -- to enjoy the sand and sun. Pacific Edge catered the day and it was reasonably priced for the amount and quality of food we got.The grilled cheese plate with clam chowder at sunset was the best part! They also set us up on the beach so we moved from bungalow to beach all day long. The staff was friendly and very helpful. They checked back with us often.

Unlike some, I think, I actually read the reviews before I booked my room. I had a bit of trepidation as I have had mixed experiences with JDV hotels myself, but I decided to stick to my guns and give it another go. So my expectations weren't super high, but it wasn't just because of the reviews on here. I've stayed in many a beach hotel and they are quite a task to upkeep, so while the Ritz Carlton on Amelia Island definitely set the bar high for beach hotels, I have tempered expectations when making plans to temporarily live at the beach. Check in was a breeze. Bryan was super helpful and was able to upgrade our room (we're Joy of Life club members) which made the kickoff to our anniversary vacation that much better. They're a valet only establishment. They do give you the option to park somewhere along PCH, but considering I was in a rental and I'm not the most experienced parallel parker, valet it was! The valets were quick every time we needed access to our car.  The room was quite warm, but considering the blazing sun and the abnormally warm winter SoCal had been having I wasn't too shocked. Open the doors, turn on the AC unit and wait for the sun to go down. Things cooled off quite nicely.Trying to temper the temperature of the water in the shower was like two teenage girls duking it out trying to get ready for a date. It would switch between hot & cold, but if you tried to correct it, it went too far. Towards the end of our stay, I got used to it and it was just an added 'quirk' of our stay.Typically I judge a hotel by whether or not I would come back. I would come back to Pacific Edge, but it wouldn't be my first choice. A lot of that, however, has to do with it's location. The location is great if you're planning to spend a majority of your time in the Newport/Laguna/Dana Point area. But we tend to go all over Southern California, even up to Malibu so location-wise this wasn't our best option.

View is amazing location of great but a very outdated and I was disappointed learning today when management gave me a tour of the front deck facing the water on the first floor the rooms were not hotel rooms they were rented out boxes for special occasions I didn't understand that because there were nothing in these rooms the hotel room start on the second floor and very outdated they're also related to the deck next door which I will not be returning back from poor attitudes at the deck and driftwood restaurant connected to it also I'm not a fan of their food for their prices I can go to the Ritz for drinks dinner and view get a lot more for my money practically they charge the same  the last renovation was 2012 so that's what I heard

Worst hotel experience ever. Accused of smoking in my room and was charged $200 smoking fee when I don't even smoke! The management claimed there were multiple complaints of smoke coming from my room but never once was I visited by an employee for them to confirm so I was basically scammed here.... only stayed one night. DO NOT STAY HERE

Great value, great service, great room, great view, great staff, great time.My wife and I went to this lovely little place on a much needed getaway for our 7 year anniversary. I got such a good deal for the ocean view room I though thsy had perhaps accidentally upgraded us.The room was recently redone in a retro vintage island theme. The bathroom with jacuzzi tub was huge. The service was amazing. We mentioned it was our anniversary and the concierge sent up 2 bottles of wine with a note sayong he didnt know if we wanted white or red so he sent both. The restaurants were both under construction while we were there but on the bright side the staff suggested carmelitas on broadway and pch which was an wise choice and is now our favorite mexican food restaurant. We took some time to lounge on the beach in the private area. Which before that day I never realized was so close to everything.All in all it was an amazing find and I recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Smooth check in. Room had musty smell and looks nothing like it did on the website.  Great location! 2 minute walk from room , down a small path between 2 buildings to the beach. Valet parking is $35 a day.

Really nice hotel. Very close to the water. Walking distance to a bunch of great eating spots. Only have valet parking for 30$ a night but you can park your car on the street a couple streets up from the hotel.

I prefer a place like Pacific Edge. The staff was very courteous and friendly without seeming 'rehearsed' or 'canned'...kind of like they actually LIKE you coming to stay here! It was my first-time visit so I was provided with a free bottle of sparkling wine and without asking or bartering, CJ worked a free room upgrade that was wonderful. We didn't have an unobstructed ocean view but we did have a view and it was enough to entice us to the beach, a VERY convenient and close 2-minute walk to the sand and sea! The room was impeccably clean and while everything was not top-notch shiny and new, it was CLEAN and in perfect shape for a comfortable stay. Even the room service staff would offer friendly greetngs and were unfailingly polite and helpful. The room rate was very fair, especially given the area and the typical cost for staying in a fairly affluent beach community. The BEST part is that there wasn't an ounce of pretentiousness in the air! If you're looking for Ritz-Carlton, go down the road to the Ritz-Carlton! If you want luxury, frills, pampering and "Silver Spoon" amenities, you might want to look elsewhere.
