If you'd like a quiet place, supremely located with exceptionaly friendly staff WANTING your presence and making you feel comfortable AND welcome...AND provided a clean, comfortable, well-located, friendly, enjoyable, peaceful and calming place to get away for a couple of days (or so), this may very well be the 'nirvana' you're looking for! We will be back again.

Wonderful hotel for the location and price.We splurged for the ocean room and are no disappointed. Sure, it's not the ritz but, really people, what is to complain about. Close to everything via a short walk.  Coffee next door and croissants are to die for.  Go to Ralph's across the road for some wine and cheese to take back to the beach and watch the sunset.  Relax

We've been fans of the JDV chain for several years now. The Dream Inn in Santa Cruz is our favorite hotel in California. So we were surprised when arriving here that our $400+ ocean view room was right over The Deck Bar and Grill. Where there was a big loud luau going on. Also my wife wasn't happy that there was no bathtub in the tiny bathroom. We thought she should have been notified of these issues. So our first night wasn't at all what we expected. Here's where good hotel management shows its stars. GM Michael called me to address our concerns, moved us to the Reef Wing which is super quiet, still overlooking the beach, and gave us a hotel credit to use for dinner or room service.  Good service is the the hallmark of Joie De Vivre hotels, and Michael really stepped up to make us happier. We'll be back.Final note: it's an old hotel that definitely needs renovation, but the spectacular location right on the sand of Laguna Beach can't be beat.The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that they do need to update and upgrade the property.

tried to make a room reservation today 11/26/16 @ 1:15PM.  Called and spoke to the room reservation person.  This Pacific Edge reservation person sounded to busy to speak and frankly a little putout that I would call.  I was about to book a room and asked a question about parking my convertible 600 series BMW.  She didn't say a word but immediately transferred me to the front desk.  As if to say, I am just to busy to make your room reservation.

Lets start w NO HEAT.. and no mention of it at any time before one checks in .. while they are accommodating, they can only work with what they have and that's the bare minimum. Walls are paper thin, floors are concrete w a thin layer of very low-grade worn carpet .. its a hovel .. pure and simple ..

Ashraf, the front desk agent was awesome.  I got an excellent walk in rate for one their smaller queen rooms in the Surf bldg.  Ocean sounds through the window with a peekaboo ocean view was all I needed.  Comfy bed.  Clean bathroom.  Great value for the $.  Not fancy, but clean and updated.  Found out about the place here on Yelp.

My wife and I stayed at The Pacific Edge for Memorial Day weekend in the Surf wing of hotel, what a shit hole. Customer service was nice but the buildings are old run-down crap.This converted condo complex is old and run down, rooms are small with very few amenities - did not even have a chair to sit in the room - just a small twin bed and a dresser, bathroom like a closet with very old tub/shower. The wing we were in is right on the water but the others are actually up the hill and across an ally named Sleepy Hollow and you will have nightmares if staying at this hotel.Extremely loud bar area "The Deck" which is between your room and the ocean, clearly this is party central and the only thing the owners of this hotel care about is booze sales.Avoid this one!

Beware! Don't let the website and photos of their bungalows fool you. Over-priced and downright filthy. The actual rooms look nothing like they do on the website. We checked in last weekend to a room we paid 400 per night for. The carpet, walls and bathroom were so gross. The carpet made our feet dirty. The fridge was in a corner with a bunch stuff stacked on it. Our "patio" was two doors that opened to the end of a carpeted hallway and looked out to the the foggy glass that surrounded the pool. The pool and spa were dirty and full of sand. We came home from dinner on our first night and decided not to stay. Had to pack up and check out at midnight on our firs t night of vacation. We went down the street to the Laguna Inn for the same price and it was awesome. We chose the Pacific Edge because The Deck and The Driftwood Restaurants were so nice and it's a Joie De Vivre Hotel. We have NEVER stayed at a place this bad. Locals told us that this hotel was known for being expensive and dirty. Stay away!

Bait and switch.  Don't believe the pictures they show on their web site.  I am not sure what hotel pictures they used but the Pacific Edge I experienced was not the clean, renovated, fancy place they advertised.  This place is a run down dump.    They should just say so!  I bet people would still stay there and pay the high prices just because of the location.The hotel is rotting away, and the staff are sick and tired of people complaining about how crappy the place is.  Also, your room will not be ready until about 5:30 pm, so that early check in you thought about wont be happening.  Joie de Vivre has made their brand by taking over old hotels/motels slapping some paint on the walls, installing some cheap trendy Ikea like furniture and calling it a "boutique."  Fine by me, but be honest about it.  This place should be advertised as an old four building motel, that is rotting into the ocean, with moldy rooms, tv's that dont work and staff who are over it.  They allow dogs, although your dog may want to wear shoes to walk on the dirty carpet.   The location is great, but the hotel is yucky.Also, if you are silly enough to stay here, there are some serious security problems with the windows and doors.  Many of the window locks do not work, some rooms have old pieces of wood shoved into the frames to keep the windows locked.  These windows are located on the public walkway.  Also, the doors are old and rotting, one good push or kick will open them.Buyer beware.

I just stayed at Pacific Edge this past weekend , Friday to Monday and I want to thank all the staff I came in contact with . Our room for the first two nights was a deluxe village room , it had a partial ocean view but mostly looked out over the alley . The room was clean and spacious enough , the hotel was gracious enough to upgrade us to an Ocean front room for free on Sunday night to make the last night of our anniversary celebration extra special. The ocean front rooms are really spectacular , sleeping with the slider door open , falling asleep to the awesome sound of waves crashing right below you . The front desk, valet, beach staff and all the staff at The Deck and Driftwood were fantastic. Food and drinks were great at both places with an amazing view .I had read quite a few negative reviews about some of the more outdated rooms here and was very nervous before my arrival . I mentioned this to the staff and they made sure I did not experience any of that .Thanks again for helping make this past weekend wonderful . We will definitely be back.

We booked online and we didn't realize that the room/price we were quoted was for the "old" section of the hotel. The interior of the room was disgusting! We had electrical outlets that didn't function, light bulbs that were burned out, and the sofa sleeper was so threadbare and thin that we had to have them bring extra padding which was itself very nasty. We traveled with our grandchildren and I was disgusted by the state of the carpet, flooring. YUK! The sheets were clean and the beach towels, beach chairs were nice.

Just got done with our stay at the Pacific Edge and I think my poor room choice is the cause of our average review. We booked a few weeks in advance, chose the standard room. We arrived and checked in at about 2PM. There is parking for check in (for permanent parking read further) just off PCH... Check in was easy. We were advised of the hotel amenities and how to park. For parking, you get back in the car and go around the block where the Valet is located. Its the only option and its $27 per day. There is no other parking in the area so plan for this. You can then leave your car and walk the town or take an Uber, we did both and both were easy. The hotel comprises a large piece of land between PCH and the beach.... Therefore, many of the rooms are literally on the sand. You can walk right down and there is a little foot shower for your dirty toes. The room was a standard room. I would have chosen the view room next time, they appeared much larger and had the view. We were in a closet sized room with a Queen bed. A dresser, two night stands, closet, wall mounted TV (to the right of the bed, hard to turn your neck to watch it) and a bathroom the size of a shoebox. You won't be taking your toiletries out on this sink! The bathroom was terrible. The rooms had been "remodeled" in the Surf and Reef wings. We were in Surf room 75. The bathroom had a modern toilet and sink/vanity but the shower was so old. Old tub with large chips, scuffs, dirt and mildew. The white tile above it on the walls had been re-caulked about a hundred too many times. There were cracks, scuffs, stains and hair on the tile. There was hair in the soap dish too. Yuck. The carpet was newer in the room but was stained from what appeared to be burn marks even though its non smoking. The room smelled a little like a cigarette... BUT! The AC worked WELL. Much needed given the heat wave Laguna was experiencing. Some of the old hotels don't have AC. Yuck. The bed was very comfortable. Pillows were foam, I like those unlike the newer down pillows that don't support anything. There is no breakfast but two restaurants on the property make up for that. They have free towels, chairs, lounges and umbrellas at the beach. So nice. Just walk down and two nice guys set up everything for you. The water immediately in front of the hotel had a  ton of kelp in it. Just several hundred feet away the water was clear. Maybe its not always like this? Mostly kids in it. We would stay again, but would have gotten a different room. Yikes that bathroom was terrible! Staff was great and the location couldn't be beat.

I regret not reading the reviews before I booked a room 2 weeks ago. The view is spectacular IF YOU BOOK OCEAN VIEW ROOM. We did, which was a little less than $500 with taxes. Not worth the price. The reviews I read below were very accurate....the rooms are not renovated, dirty, and rotting. Bathrooms are the same way. However, the staff was very polite and professional. The photos on the website must be of the renovated rooms.

Three stars simply for location and access to the beach. Hotel is aware they have an outstanding location but why they won't focus on fixing this run down place, don't know? We stayed for two nights at the Bahia building third floor ( partial ocean view) .

Pros:           Beach chairs and towels           Room service food was awesome           Location Cons:          Shower ...this was a big CON          Parking feeHere is my review. I am pretty easy going and love to give good reviews. The real reason I would never stay here again is the shower. My 10 year old took a shower and started screaming. It was going back n forth from super hot to freezing cold. I couldn't adjust it at all. It did the same thing when I took a shower later that day. I loved the location. The $30 a night parking fee was too much. Other hotels charge 0-$15.  Staff was friendly. Bed pretty comfortable. If it wasn't for the shower I would be back. We stayed in room 109 and liked the partial ocean view.

My appreciation to Bryan Dougherty who made my daughter and her fiance's wedding night stay so special. He was beyond kind and helpful, and made sure everything went smoothly. Customer service is not dead at the Pacific Edge Hotel! All the other staff members were cheerful and polite as well.Beautiful beachfront setting, with two great restaurants, Driftwood and The Deck to enjoy without having to leave the hotel. Great beach, and lovely ocean front rooms. I would highly recommend a stay here! Thanks again for everything Bryan!

We actually left!  Can NOT recommend this hotel.  Basically it's a parking space for the beach. We waited 30 minutes to check in (they said one person had gone to lunch and another called out sick) Our room was not ready, which was completely fine, so we went to the beach where they are suppose to have chairs and towel service. There were 4 of us.  They only had 1 towel left. The towel attendant said, "Sorry first come, first serve." So we hung out with 1 towel.  This hotel has no drink service. You can't even get a bottle of water.  I was told to go across the street to Ralphs grocery store. The beach itself isn't a great beach. It's kind of rocky and behind us there was a trash can overflowing by at least 2 feet of trash spilling all over. When I got a text that our room was ready we went back to the lobby and had to wait another 20 minutes to get issued our room. We walked to the room and found out they gave us the wrong room, 1 king instead of 2 queens. After walking past their pool area that looked pretty much like an old motel 6, we just decided that this was NOT the place for us and decided to go home. We live close. Have a pool, with towels, drinks, etc... Just thought it be nice to be by the beach for a couple nights.  Oh well...

This is the worst hotel ever for the price I pay there was no view and hotel is so old old OMG! Carpet is dirty, furniture like 30 years old, I can't believe I would pay for that price! Even it's close to the beach it's not really worth it, I should of stay at the Holiday Inn. Laguna Beach sound like high class so I thought it's shouldn't be that bad, I felt like I staying at some old appartment in L.A , the room smell, the bathrooms is old and nasty. I can't find anything good a bout this place except some of the guys that works there they did try to help me! I have to say I will never stay here again even my kids say's mom I dont like this hotel!! Lol this is their first Vacation in three years.
The Staff is very Friendly and Helpful. Rooms are very clean.we would go back.Was able to see the sunset over the ocean. The ocean is just a short walk away. The beach was very clean too.

We had 15 rooms booked at this hotel for friends and family for our wedding nearby on 10/8/16. There were no complaints by anyone. The rooms were clean and beautiful. The valets were professional and helpful. The staff was open to all our requests and many updates and changes leading up to the wedding day. My now husband and I stayed in the Pacific Suite which was simply stunning! This is an oceanfront hotel that is clean and well-kept but reasonably priced without that affluent and snobby feel of similar hotels in the area. I highly recommend it to anyone!

We've been staying at this hotel almost every Labor Day weekend. It's not the nicest or cleanest place but we liked that it had its own private beach access with chair/umbrella/towel service. After our experience this weekend - I don't plan on ever coming back. Rather than have all the chairs and umbrellas set up for guests to come and sit and relax in the mornings, there is one guy who's still half asleep waiting for a line to form and then spends nearly half an hour slowly setting up the chairs for individual guests who aren't planning on coming down for another few hours. There aren't enough chairs or towels for all the guests which is surprising for a hotel with high room rates. The rooms are not clean, my shower curtain had someone's hair on it when we checked in and bugs in the bathtub. Also - It is not a hotel for toddlers or young children since most everything is in their reach and you can't childproof during your stay. I don't recommend this hotel. The one positive point it had is no longer, if I wanted to wait over an hour every morning for seats by the beach I may as well head over to the public side of the beach and set up shop without delay. They need a better organized system. Until then - go elsewhere if you'd like to enjoy your vacation.

Just got home today from our staycation at the pacific edge hotel and it was absolutely amazing! Celebrated our 3 year wedding anniversary. We had an ocean front room in the surf tower and you can't put a price on that view or sunsets every night. So great to sleep with the sliding door open and listen to the waves as you sleep. Room was super cute and beachy. Breakfast from the driftwood kitchen was delicious to. The deck is a great place to grab a drink before you walk the streets of Laguna or just hang there all night! Again can't beat the views there. We will definitely be back!

We stayed 3 days for our 25th wedding anniversary. We had a cozy, clean room with a full  ocean view in the Surf Tower. Shortly after checking into the room, we saw a pod of dolphins swimming by the shoreline.  I managed to get a pic of their fins sticking out of the water.  The sunsets were stunning from our balcony.  Later while we were eating dinner on the beachfront deck at the restaurant located on the property we saw a fireball shoot across the sky very close to the earth, disintegrating before hitting the ocean. The hotel staff was wonderful. For our anniversary they sent us a complementary bottle of sparkling wine in a bucket that included a Mexican blanket and taffy. I used the blanket as a shawl when we took an early morning walk along the beach. We had a good experience and will definitely return to the hotel again.

Terrible hotel. Old and not kept up. Do not rely on the photos they post for marketing as they are not what the hotel rooms actually look like.  We reserved a partial ocean view queen suite.  This wasn't a suite at all.  The queen bed is exposed to the rest of the room so there is zero privacy which is why we ask for a suite in the first place.  The worst part was my sons had to sleep on a sofa bed wasn't even usable as a bed. The mattress was maybe 2 inches thick and you could feel the metal springs from the mattress and the sofa itself which was super cheap.  They ended up on the floor.  So much for paying extra for the suite.  Pealing vinyl floors, thin walls, old kitchens and bathrooms--nothing is updated or modern. This is a very run down hotel and is a very sad and uncomfortable place to stay.  The staff promised me the GM would call me.  No phone call yet after one week.  Please don't stay here your vacation will be ruined.

My daughter got burned! I am only giving this place 2 stars because it's only 20 feet from the sand....I booked this property on Expedia and the price that I checked out with was a bit higher that I was quoted...if you're looking for a nice hotel or resort this isn't it....very old motel like...they get away with this price because of location only....valet was $34 a night unless u wanted to park on the street with a meter. Who wants to do that with kids and luggage?? So we had room 64 in the surf building and two double beds...the bed I was in with my little one was butted up against the air conditioner..so I had to use a pillow to block the arctic air draft while I slept...there were leftover water bottles from a previous guest under the dresser/tv stand and trash under the bed...the bathroom had zero counter space. So..on to the shower and water issue...after a day at the beach I gave my girls showers. The water that came from the faucet felt fine, but as soon as I switched it to shower it went ice cold. Any slight adjustment turned it to scalding!! My 5 year old screamed because it burned her on the tummy....we immediately called the front desk and their "engineer" came to our room and turned the water on (not the shower) and said it must be supply in demand because EVERY SINGLE ROOM IS ATTACHED TO THE SAME BOILER ! WHAT??!!! So I said ok fine we'll give it another try...the next day same thing...either ice or scalding....complained again and the guy changed some valve..still didn't work, whatever...hopefully they'll fix it for the next person...they credited us a night of valet parking for my daughter getting burned....they are very limited on loungers and umbrellas so request them early if u want them. We just bring our own. The beach right in front of the hotel is not terribly kid friendly especially if you have a boogy boarder. Tons of rocks under the water which become exposed during low tide...overall the location was nice and I enjoyed taking my coffee down to the beach super early at low tide while the girls looked at crabs that were in the rocks..probably wouldnt stay here again....

With the wedding party staying at Pacific Edge for a couple nights I was really impressed with our accommodations.  Check in and out was smooth.  We did get one of the remodeled rooms.. Keurig machine, electric stove and oven, refrigerator, dinning table, living room and a view.  Small bathroom with a really slippery tub and no microwave were a little strange, but those were the only drawbacks in our room.  Food is good at both restaurants and room service was fast.  If you get the right room it is well worth it.

We reserved a room with a King bed overlooking the ocean. When we checked in, we were told that there were no more rooms available with a King bed. We were given a room with two queen beds, musty smelling room, old carpet, orange walls. The room was not welcoming at all. If you make a reservation and even present the confirmed e-mail to the staff and you do not get what you paid for, that is bad service. We were disappointed to say the least.

We are displaced from our home due to a plumbing disaster and the staff at this hotel is absolutely awesome! They did everything to make us comfortable! We are now making the most of a difficult situation and these guys are turning it into a vacation for us! Thank You!!

I can't say enough good things about this place. From beginning to end I had a great experience. The people the checked us in where so nice and check out was so easy. The room exceeded my expectations!!! I got the room on travelzoo and they did a room upgrade for no additional charge. The room was perfect and the ocean view amazing!!! Thank you so much we will be back.

Great place to stay. We got the beach front view room and it was wonderful. If you can get these rooms, it is definitely worth the upgrade. Hearing the ocean waves crashing onto the sand while relaxing in bed is such a pleasure.  Did I mention the fact that the wonderful ocean front view is spectacular?  It is wonderful.  The front desk receptionist, Stacy, was also exceptional. The service is top notch.  This place is definitely worth giving a shot. Especially, if you are a couple and looking for a relaxing and romantic time with your partner.

The low reviews were a bit scary, but I still decided to check the hotel and I'm so happy I did! My boyfriend and I stayed in an ocean view room and it was AMAZING. The service and staff were so nice and helpful. We were greeted by Lainey (apologize in advanced for misspelling her name) who helped us check-in quickly and was very professional. There was also Victor who was helpful our first day. I would totally do another getaway in this place!

I definitely agree with other reviewers that the location of this hotel is excellent! The private beach and complimentary chairs/towels also make everything much easier! This is a huge perk. Other pros include:-Trolley stop right outside with stops all along Laguna-walking distance to great shops, restaurants and art galleries-very friendly staff, helpful and professional The flip side is that you don't really get what you pay for. At these prices, I expect more. And by more I mean the basics, like cleanliness and having everything be in working order. We stayed in the Bahia. The unit looks like (aside from paint) no one has updated it in 30 years. A burner on the ancient stove doesn't heat. The A/c is barely cold. One cabinet in the kitchen won't open- seems to be painted shut. A knob is missing from the dresser. And the bathroom is in dire need of a repair! Faucet at sink is sloppily re-caulked and might fall off. Tub/shower are old but ok. Sofa is torn and stained. The parking per night is $27!!!I really feel that some updates are desperately needed. Charge $10 more a night and spend some of that on refurbishments in the off season.

This was our first time staying at this hotel. I'm rating it a 1 due to being double charged and for their lack of customer service in following up when trying to get the charges off and credited back.We were actually very excited to have a weekend getaway. It was our first getaway in over a year and we were celebrating a late anniversary of 22 yrs. I booked a 1 night stay (Friday, May 1st) through Groupon. When we first checked in, the hotel lobby and entrance was very nice. I was hoping for that feel in the room.. our room was ok, but we didn't mind it since we were exciting to be staying at a hotel right by the ocean, with beach access (our room overlooked the pool and street). When we checked in I was very clear that my purchase was with Groupon and thought I made sure "they weren't going to charge me again." The lady that checked us in said she saw our reservation. (Days later, once I saw charges, I realized she never asked me for my Groupon confirmation number.) On Sunday I saw 2 charges pending. I immediately called and spoke to the front desk who gave me an email address to forward my Groupon confirmation so they could look into it. He said my email would go to the front desk and it would be looked at. He wasn't very assuring when he told me they "hadn't had a Groupon promotion in 2 years" and wasn't sure how I could have booked through Groupon :/ 2hrs later I had not received a reply confirming they had received my email. So I called to followed up to make sure someone got my email. I was told everyone was gone for the evening and that my email was forwarded to a manager, who would look at it the next day. The next day, all day went by and I had not received a reply or call back. I called after work and asked to speak to a manager. The front desk told me the manager was gone for the day, but pulled up my account and said it had notes that it had been reviewed and I was going to be credited back. Now, why couldn't they have been pro-active with great customer service and at lest emailed me back on Sunday or Monday following up on my concern. Anyway, we'll see in a few days if the full amount, minus parking, gets credited back. I hope to see this credit before Friday, which I was told I may not see it until then.

Stayed here for the Pageant of the Masters, we were able to walk to the venue on nice quiet back roads, totally worth it.    Get one of the ocean facing units, the view is awesome, waves literally lapping up to the building below your balcony.   Went body surfing at 1am, watched surfers and the sunset from the balcony.  There is a Ralphs grocery store within walking distance, if you want to stock up on victuals and vino.  Also get yourself some wasteful single-cup refills for the Keurig coffee machine in your room.   The room itself was nice but not 5 stars.  It was quite pricey due to the location and season, but worth it for an overnight splurge.  Front desk staff was efficient and helpful at check-in and out, other than that didn't need to see or speak to them.

We are from Las Vegas, in California to celebrate a 50 year HS reunion. Decided to spend a few days in gorgeous Laguna ( Oct 15 -17)Made reservations on line .. reviews were mixed, but usually they all are. Booked a room with partial ocean room.  Price was $288 a night .. not willing to pay $350 plus for a full ocean view. The room was over the small lobby in a very rundown building. Room was small and old with awful decor. The ocean view was looking between two buildings, overlooking a parking lot. Could not hear the ocean due to the wall air conditioning all around.  Thank goodness the weather was nice ( 90's) cause we spent all our time on the beach and in town. Also their restaurant doesn't open till 9 for breakfast so we found ourselves at The Laguna Hotel for meals. Excellent food. We should of stayed there !  However , there were a few pros about Pacific Edge .... staff were pleasant... esp the men in valet parking. We also had our electricity go out while dressing for dinner and the handyman came promptly to fix it.  The bed was comfortable, but too short if over 6 feet. Plenty of hot water for showering. So ... for two nights, our bill was $622 ! Next time we'll go to Maui !!  Below is our view from our room

Out room has a hole in the wall......it was awful. The company (hoteltonight.com) said to go with them for complaints. That was a mistake Brian at the front desk called our room and made sure we were moved to a room that was complete plus some. So thanks Brian. Ps my 4 stars is for the employees that work for this company and not the actual hotel

My daughter and I have stayed here every summer for the past four years. Each summer it gets more run down. Maybe now that it's been sold a renovation will be completed. The rooms are run down, dirty, stained carpets.  The pool area is now also dirty and run down.  The only remaining great thing about the hotel is the ocean view.
CEO and Management attention ! How does it possible in 21 century, luxury hotel becomes to motel. You need immediately renovation, we don't want to pay high price, for horrible condition like this.

So my fiancée booked a room via hotels.com so we got a pretty good deal but I am not impressed with this place at all. CHECK IN- Not very personable. You will be told that you must valet your car for a whopping 27 dollars a night( we parked in the neighborhood) check in wasn't till 4. Also they take a 50 dollar deposit for any damages or room expenses.  WHICH HAS STILL NOT been returned 2 days after checkout.ROOM- or closet, the smallest hotel I've ever stayed in. For 75 bucks a night I will take it. It was a bed and a bathroom. That's it, do not book small room if you have a large party. I wasn't too impressed with the decor because there isn't much in the room. When you walk in there is a seal stuffed toy which you can purchase for 10 dollars (BUT you can get THE SAME one for 8 at the seal rescue down the street) however it was literally 30 steps from the beach. THE KICKER- at around 3 am our smoke detector ran out of battery. It made the typical annoying LOUD beeping noise every 30 seconds. We called at 630am to have it fixed and they said they would bring a battery in ten minutes. (Even if you take the battery out, it has a power source connected so it still beeps) 40 minutes later we called again and they finally showed up at 7:45. Got it fixed so we went back to sleep for our check out at 11am after NO SLEEP. The first employee was apologetic and nice, the second didn't seem to care. We got hardly an apology at check out and left exhausted as opposed to a relaxing vacation. I'm not sure if I would use this place again, lots of random charges. The plus is its so close to the beach and does offer wifi.

Before coming here, I was ready to face all the negative things I read about Pacific Edge via Yelp and Trip Advisor. But pictures on Yelp and Trip Advisor did not do justice. While we didn't get an oceanfront room, the regular rooms were just fine. We ended up getting two rooms facing the pool, which is probably better than facing the highway. Either way, the rooms were comfortable except for a few minor glitches like the table lamp was busted but the maintenance guy came in quickly to fix  it. The WIFI was on and off but it was enough to get by to quickly check e-mails and social media. Other than that, my gfs and I had a fantastic stay.  When I told the front desk receptionist, Akiko, that we're staying for my bachelorette weekend, she was super sweet about giving us a room not facing the highway and also gave us two bottles of champagne and bags of candy. It was a very nice gesture, which was completely unexpected. The best part of this hotel are their heated pools and location.  The heated pools really got me through the "chilly" nights in Laguna. Coming from NY, you think I would be used to the 50-60 degree weather but 50-60 degree in Laguna is a different feeling. The hotel itself is also sitting on the beach and walking distance to shops and restaurants at the heart of Laguna Beach. It's a perfect location! If I ever come back to Laguna, I would definitely choose Pacific Edge again...hopefully next time with an Oceanfront view!

Let me preface this by saying that I have stayed in a lot of nice hotels and also some forgettable ones in my life and this one resides in the latter category.  It's basically just a glorified Motel 6.  In fact, I think Motel 6 would be insulted if I used them as a comparison.  There really is nothing good about this place except for the location.  It's a complete mess to even get around the property to your room to start with and they just sort of valet your car anywhere in the alley.  The rooms are cheap and the shower is literally the size of a closet.  You can barely move around in it.  They do have a cheap mini fridge over in the corner with a huge cord sticking out so you can trip on it and break your neck.  The beds were cheap, the pillows looked like something from Big Lots.  The room we stayed in looked like it had not been updated since the 70's and the 70's would like their color schemes back.  The only thing they were missing was a small black and white TV instead of the 2 inch flat screen mounted on the wall.    You do get a couple of free magazines though.  They are sitting right on top of the IKEA coffee table.  I think the curtains were made out of the same material as the bed sheets.  Maybe they just used a bed sheet for the curtains since they are obviously in a cost saving mode.  All-in-all, I would not stay here again even if it were for free.  The Joi De Vivre chain should reconsider if they want this hotel as their representation in such a high profile destination in Laguna Beach.  If they do, they should upgrade it to at least acceptable standards for Orange County.

We loved our stay here so did our happy dog!! Great location it was walking distance to all the laguna hot spots. I got a Groupon, and when I got here they upgraded me to an Ocean View room with no extra charge. Rooms were nice and upgraded, all and all I was very happy with the place and the staff was very friendly.

So disappointed with my weekend at Pacific Edge Hotel. My friend booked this place for us and it was one negative after another. We checked in, went to the room, when we got there the room was not ready.  The beds were not made, dirty towels still hanging on doors, ect. Back to the office for another room. We get there and the room is on the road side and with the gap in the door the noise from the road was so loud!  Second night we ended up with extremely rude neighbors with a dog which barked quite a bit. But that night the noisy neighbors came in at 1:15a.m., we finally called the front desk to complain. The walls are so thin the guy at the front desk could hear my neighbor in my room.  We had to call twice in order to get someone to talk with them.  The bathroom was so small you have to sit sideways to reach the t.p.  We would not recommend  or stay here again.

My husband & I stayed here this past weekend for our 22nd wedding anniversary. We were both so impressed with our beachfront room and it's magnificent view! All the staff that we encountered were friendly, helpful and genuinely interested in making our stay a memorable one. Upon entering our room, we were greeted with a lovely anniversary card, a gift beach bag filled with all sorts of treats for us to enjoy, along with a cozy blanket and a bottle of champagne. Wow!! What a wonderful surprise!.... Both of us agree that we will be revisiting soon and booking the same perfect bungalow.

I absolutely love this hotel. The oceanfront room has the most breath taking view of the ocean ever! The front desk staff  was so amazing and friendly. The valet staff were extremely helpful. We received a complementary bottle of wine since we stayed on New Years Eve! We ordered room service and got the beach burger with fries. Every bite was so delicious. I definitely recommend this hotel from a couples getaway, family retreat as well as a solo trip. I will be returning very soon. Thanks Pacific Edge Hotel for making my New Year start off with such an amazing, peaceful, and  relaxing experience. Can't wait to return!Sincerely A very happy customer!

If you are thinking of staying at this hotel, don't. There are too many things wrong for me to even begin to list them all. But here are a couple. Room wasn't ready until almost 5pm. Shower is tiny. Service is poor. Room looks nothing like the pictures. If this were a $50 night room, I wouldn't care but at $400 night, I should at least be able to walk across the floor without my feet getting dirty. Do yourself a favor, stay some where else.

This Joie de Vivre property sits steps away from the beach with downtown Laguna Village right within walking distance.  The rooms are rather dated but I think the beach-weathered look is very relaxing and quite perfect for beach-goers and beach-loungers. Waking up to the smell and sound of the surf in the morning is the perfect way to start the day. Guests rooms give a nod to the SoCal surf and beach community. Rooms are outfitted with beach-inspired "Endless Summer" posters, adirondack lounge chairs (ocean view rooms), iPod docks, a Keurig coffeemaker, an ironing board, a mini refrigerator and a clothes line. The property features two heated pools, a large hot tub, game room and two seafood-focused restaurants -- the Beach House and the Deck. We received a $20 food and beverage credit to the Deck which was quite useful. Along with the credit, guests get a 10% discount on a handful of local restaurants and businesses. The hotel also provides lounge chairs, umbrellas and beach towels and you can arrange activities through guests services, including bike excursions, spa treatments, kayak rentals, surf lessons and stand-up paddleboard rentals. You can even rent your own private Surf Cabana Room or book a stay in the resplendent two-story Villa presidential suite. Complimentary wi-fi and complimentary gym passes to the Laguna Health Club are available. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The front desk check-in was smooth and seamless. We were able to upgrade to a partial ocean view room for only $40. We were alerted to all the guest amenities and guest services upon arrival. The large hot tub was just perfect for an energy-restoring soak. There is a $20 valet parking fee for all guests staying overnight. We really enjoyed our stay in this seaside retreat and I would stay here again on a future trip to Laguna. Winter room rates are very reasonable right now and the Pacific Edge Hotel is a great option for a winter--or summer--beach retreat.

I am so disappointed that I chose this hotel for my vacation.  I purposely looked for a dog friendly place that was on the beach & felt luxuries.  I got none of the above.  Well, what I got is a run down old disgusting hotel room, got switched to another room & found the same.  Don't be fooled by the pretty photos on internet like I was!  That is only ONE building here & it sells out fast.  I have a feeling I paid the same high price for my "deluxe" room & unfortunately was fooled by their marketing.  The beach here is so small that it only fits the hotel chairs which fill up right when they open because people line up for them.  The restaurants here on the property are not dog friendly.  There is no dog relief area & we have to walk 4 flights of stairs to find a planter for her to go in.  This just did not meet my expectations in any way & I truly wish I would have chosen one of the other resorts in similar price range.  This would only be worth it if you could guarantee the one new building & even then the beach is far too small.  The other problem I encountered is when I called to book this place & said I was bringing my dog, they didn't inform me the beach policy changes in Summer - no dogs allowed.  I purposely booked this spot to bring my dog to a place for us both to enjoy.
Our ocean view was amazing. Room was clean and big, staff was polite. Bed was comfy. Right on the sand. Nice overnight getaway

I Can understand the high reviews for the hotel being good in the oceanfront tower. The garden rooms are another issue  & a different hotel completely. Comparable to motel 6(some motel 6 are nicer than these so called garden rooms here). Super outdated room similar to the crescent bay inn. I agree with Kristen O reviews. I've lived around here my whole life. Was just looking for a peaceful time with my wife & daughter. Be ready for a miniature room with no balcony for  $199 plus $20 for valet and this was in the winter on a Sunday night. Pretty much feel like I got scammed. We ended up leaving 2 hrs after arrival VERY DISAPPOINTED!! :(

While I didn't personally stay at this hotel, I visited some friends staying there this past weekend.  While getting directions in the lobby, I noticed two pink canaries in a cage as part of the decoration in the middle of the room -- not a big deal in and of itself, but I was horrified to see that one of the birds was clearly ill and neglected.  His nails were so long they were curling around (bird nails need to be trimmed as part of regular routine!) and he was completely fluffed out for the entire time we were there (a telltale sign of illness in birds, particularly since it was the middle of the day).  The cage was also dirty.I understand that some hotels use animals as decoration, but the least they could do is provide adequate/routine care.  It's clear that these poor birds are not receiving even the bare minimum of attention.  I would never expect a hotel to be able to attend to the needs of their guests if they have no regard for creatures under their care.I would certainly ask the manager to please see that the birds are seen by a veterinarian and treated.

I give it three starts just because the location is very convenient! In the heart of downtown Laguna, walking distance to good brunch places, restaurants and the famous gelato place. Great for tourists who will spend 1-2 nights there. The hotel is much older than the pictures and the rooms are much less nicer and smaller. The bathroom was ok size but still showed how old it was. Altogether, it's perfect for a short stay and is perfect just to have somewhere convenient to crash.Now for the major complaint...there was construction going on at 7:15-7:30am ish non-stop until past 9am! I first thought it was from the hotel but when I called the front desk, a gentleman said he didn't know what it was and wasn't from inside the hotel. When asked to postpone the checkout from 11am until at least noon so we could actually get some sleep, we were denied the request. He said he will look into the issue and call us back (still waiting for that call by the way...). Upon checking out, there was someone else at the front desk who said she knew there has been construction going on across the street for some time now! Okkkk. When I told her it is the hotel's responsibility to inform guests about possibly waking up at the crack of dawn on their vacation, and perhaps, give them a back room instead of a room right in front of the construction!!!! Her response was, "next time if you choose to stay with us again, request a back room instead of a street room." If they had informed us of the inconvenience, we would have definitely requested a room away from the noise but no one bothered telling us while checking in...needless to say being woken up after only a few hours of sleep was not pleasant. I would advise other guests to thoroughly investigate all possible issues before being assigned a room.

Was expecting a better updated room for the money. Terrible bathroom tub. The decor is also plain. The experience is disappointing.The Front Desk/Lobby is pretty and the service was great. Jose took care of us and accommodated us very well.

I was expecting a hotel with amenities to match the photos on their website. At $200+ per night, I expected at least 4 stars. I don't usually stay in rooms that cost this much, so perhaps my expectations were too high for a near-the-beach location. The room I received was below expectations - dust on ledges, cigarette burns (or some sort of burn) on top of the furniture, carpet that felt like it needed a good vacuuming, and an awkward layout for the bathroom. We had a view of the parking lot and other buildings.Was so disappointed that I checked out early and found someplace else to stay for my second night in town. Staff at the desk seemed nice, although they argued with me about the time that the meters on the street were for (I had just parked and looked at the meter, and the meter said it started at 8am, and the hotel staff insisted they started at 7am), and couldn't give me directions to my room. (I wandered around for a while before going back into the lobby and asking them to walk me to my room. They didn't seem to know where my room was either!) I don't know why they only offer valet parking - there were plenty of empty parking spots, including one directly outside of our room, which was on the first floor.I will not be staying here again.

We were so thrilled with our oceanfront room. The balcony is directly over the ocean and is incredible. When we checked in I told the girl at the front desk that I was here with my boyfriend visiting me from Switzerland so she gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne! Would have given it five stars but the air conditioner for the room next to us is literally on our balcony. And it makes a lot of noise! Totally takes away from the ambience of the crashing waves.

This has been my go to spot for birthdays and relaxation. I've been 4 times. The room is always clean and the front desk staff and valet employees are always very kind and welcoming. I was referred to this hotel by my roommate who spent her anniversary here. We always get a beachfront room. I've heard most of the bad reviews are from ppl who stayed in regular rooms or stayed in the tower next to the restaurant. If you stay here I'd only recommend a beachfront room in the reef tower. Driftwood has amazing food btw!

First time in my life that I've actually checked out of a hotel and moved to a different location.  We knew we booked a cheaper room and didn't expect luxury, but we also didn't expect the complete dump that this place was.  I have stayed  at JDV hotels before and was very surprised by how terrible this place was.  We had the following issues:Incessant beeping noise near our room at 5 am that no one did anything about (sounded like a smoke detector battery indicator)Room smelled like pot at all times. It was 85 degrees and the air conditioner was broken, and no one made any attempts to fix it when we told them.  Internet was slow, practically unusable Beach had no chairs available.  We specifically chose this hotel bc we wanted the beach chair service.Pools looked gross and filthy, but they were closed anyway which the front desk was somehow unaware of. Towel bar was on our bathroom floor.  No attempts to fix itWeird gross stains on the bathroom floorWhen I told the front desk girl that we wanted to check out after 2 nights instead of 4 so we could switch hotels, her response was "I can understand why you wouldn't want to stay here for a extended stay."  2 positives:  the restaurant was good and is very pretty, and Javid at the front desk was very nice and apologetic when we checked out and refunded us for 1 of the 2 terrible nights we stayed there.

Did a staycation here and loved it!!! We had a ocean view,king bed, top floor and it was incredible! The room was updated and it was a treat to hear the waves crashing throughout the night! Plus great restaurant attached with umbrella service at beach. Can't say one bad thing about this place!

We decided to splurge and spend a night staying right on the water.  The location can't be beat - the hotel is well situated on PCH and you can easily walk to shopping, restaurants, etc.  Our room had a great view and we felt like we were almost "in" the water but the decor was an odd mix of  modern, beachy and 70's style decor.  The customer service was great and we received a welcome basket  and card from the management and staff with a bottle of wine and some tasty snacks right after getting settled in.  Not quite 5 star accommodations but it's all about the location!

Stayed at pac edge in late August and enjoyed our stay.  view was nice from "partial view" room, staff was very good, cleanliness was middle of road.  Location and beach amenities were the best and most obvious reason to stay here.

Reality check time.It's Laguna Beach. Tourist central. Prime location. Summertime. That combo means prices are going to be ridiculous.Unfortunately for me, I'm traveling for business ( me + 4 other people) and my normal hotel in Aliso Viejo is booked. In fact everything inland is booked. Stupid convention. So, what's open? Pacific Edge.No problem. Book it. Pay with the corporate card when setting up the reservation. Show up day of, drop a card for incidentals. In fact, everyone drops a card for incidentals, no big deal, the room's already paid for. Wouldn't be worth mentioning if not for the surprise on the statement when they charged my card for the full stay instead of corporate card. That's no fun. Easy to replace, but could have been bad for people who don't like $2k surprisesThe rooms -First impression: Spread out. Hodge-podge of hotels or condos or something. All over the place. Different buildings, different styles, across an alleyway and a parking lot. Whatever. Weird, but not really a problem.Second impression: In an ocean front room, the hallways are damp and smell bad. Ok. It's wet from the humidity and moisture from the waves. Got it. Spray some bleach or something to kill the algae, because it smells bad.Third impression: The rooms themselves are pretty not awesome. Oceanfront is oceanfront, but the paint is peeling, the sink looks like it's falling off the wall, and the AC is loud. Really loud. Obnoxiously loud. Think I stayed for 4 nights. Sleeping only. Didn't touch any hotel amenities. Wasn't my first choice for a hotel room, and won't be my first choice next time I need a hotel. If I were a tourist, I might enjoy being close to that area of Laguna Beach, and oceanfront is always nice, but really location and availability were the only real plusses.

The Hotels description is very deceptive. Wait until you see the hotel to book a night. We would have not stayed here if we saw the condition of the hotel first. Also parking is free by meters in front of the hotel from 8pm-8am. Do not pay the $30 for parking.

This place is not worth the money. The service was ok. They seemed completely overwhelmed in the valet area because they only have one guy. So the front desk people would run back and forth from the desk to the parking area. Very hap hazard. You pay for their location but you end up in one of their older rooms on the street with the awful traffic noise. And the shower is like an RV shower with the nozzle directed so high and you can't adjust it. I was ok because I'm tall but if you're short good luck. Not impressed.

Checked in early and had a wonderfully welcoming experience! Staff was friendly and accommodating! Taking my sister to see Pacific Ocean for first time after traveling from NY state to visit me! We were surprised with gift of champagne by hotel staff! It's the little things that make a stay great! Valet guys super nice too! Only been here a few hours and will update to 5 stars if trip continues to impress as it has thus far! Loving it so far!

The hotel room was small...looked cleaned  but there was a stain on the sheets. It was a plus that they had a kitchenette with pots and utensils available. Check in was fast and the staff was very friendly. Our room was a village room so u don't have much of beach view...I would  recommend staying in the reef room,it's ocean front..either way the beach was just a few steps away...Only complains is that they have a $27 valet parking fee and a $100 deposit at check in...Plus our sheets had a stain...
Great stay at a good rate. The hospitality was great and Rafaella kept our room in impeccable condition for our stay.

Check in was easy and the staff was very nice. Our room had an amazing view as it was ocean front. This hotel is literally on the sand! It was great and we will make this a part of our regular visits to SoCal!

I loved my room, but I had an Oceanfront Room overlooking the ocean from a balcony. Others might not have had as good an experience. The property is actually a composite of a bunch of different motels bought up and merged under one name. There is a definite difference based on rooms. I would definitely stay here again, but only if I get an Oceanfront room. Ice machines were everywhere, but I wanted a soda one night and the only drink machine was at one of the pools in a section (former separate motel) quite a distance from where I was staying. Also, there aren't any in room safes to store your valuables, however, I felt very safe here. My room had a refrigerator, which was wonderful. The shower was also wonderful and had various settings. The Staff was excellent. Every Hotel Employee that I interacted with was very friendly and helpful. another thing of note, the location is fantastic. You are in walking distance to some great food and shops, and can walk along the beach to Main Beach if you wish to do so. Another perk, there is a grocery store nearby called Ralph's. Stock up on a few items and take them back to your room. I will definitely stay here again at an Oceanfront room next time I come to Laguna Beach.

I had a 5 star experience with this hotel. If I ever visit Laguna Beach again I will without a doubt return here for my stay.The customer service was amazing. You don't find customer service like this very often. One employee really stood out to me. Her name was Caroline and she was the person that checked me in. She seemed genuinely sweet. I was in my room for about 10 minutes when my room phone rang. It was Caroline checking to make sure my room was okay with me. I informed her that I LOVED my room! It was super cute. Some of the walls are painted fun, vibrant colors and beachy art was hung up throughout the room. On my bed was a "pillow menu". If you don't like the pillows on your bed you can choose the type that best suites you (firm, down, etc.) and they will be delivered to your roomSomething that lit up the smile on my face was their coffee machine in the room. It was not the typical cheap looking non-brand pot most hotels put in your room. It was a Keurig. A KEURIG!!!!!!! Do you know what that is? They are awesome machines that make one cup at a time of a variety of great coffees. I'm not going to waste your time raving about Keurig, but if you know what they are, you know how awesome it would be to find one in your hotel room. This hotel is on the beach, so you are just seconds from laying on the sand and chilling out. It was not warm enough to whip out the 2 piece when I visited (visit was in February) but it didn't stop me from walking along the water. My room was only $109 a night and I had a cool private balcony with chairs and a little table. Great to drink a cup of coffee and soak up a little sun after you wake up. I would recomment Pacific Edge to anyone looking for a decently priced beach front hotel.

Stayed here this past weekend because my friend was getting married in Laguna and it was a fantastic hotel. Would've been nice to stay in one of the ocean front rooms but that was my fault for not booking until the day we arrived. Needless to say people may complain about the size of the rooms but remember you're by the beach so you're only there to sleep in it not hang out in it. The hotel was within walking distance of multiple restaurants and shops and of course the beach. When we walked in the staff was very friendly and they even let us take a look at two of the rooms before we even booked. Even when we checked out the staff was great they over charged us for the valet parking and took the charge off as soon as I let them know we parked on the street the second night. We worked with one of the newer girls I'm sorry i forget her name (she had glasses) and she was very sweet and accommodating.  We also worked with Amanda and Luis as well and they were helpful and polite. Thank you Pacific Edge for making our stay with you one to remember! We will definitely be back.

This place is a complete dump!!! Don't wast your money here and please stay elsewhere.  The pictures are very misleading.  The rooms are very old and dated. The carpet has a horrible musky odor.  The housekeeping is also lacking in every way.  They did not have the staff readily available to assist with the beach chairs/umbrellas as are to be included in the resort fees.  Overall our stay was horrible. I will not be returning to this property ever again.  I would also never recommend this specific property to anyone.

This hotel fronts a great stretch of one of the best beaches in California. There is a great deck overlooking the beach where you can drink (of course) and eat very well (surprise). Come early or expect to wait to to be seated on the deck. Every guest drove there, of course, and so everyone pays the $30.00 per day valet charge. There is no self parking. When you visit the website you will see a picture of the least expensive room, called a "village room." The photo suggests that these are nice rooms, but . . . no. There are a couple of pieces of ugly furniture that Goodwill would not accept. There is a tiny table (much smaller than a card table but similar construction) next to the "kitchen area." This "kitchen" includes a stove top without any pans, and no microwave. In other words, the room is a gutted crash pad for beachgoers. When we booked the bargain room we expected no view. They are clear about that.. We did not expect a shabby dump that would not stand comparison with the average Motel 6. So, we're thinking of going back. Its that well located and the beach is that great. But if we do we're biting that bullet and take an expensive room.

The hotel itself is a typical old school beach hotel. Pool is small and hotel condition itself is pretty worn down. The staff is outstanding, and the views/beach access is awesome. The beach bungalows are fantastic and so are the staff that run them. All in all, stay here if your hotel is simply a place to sleep and your trip is all about what you're doing when you're not hanging around the hotel all day.
Thomas, thank you for your response and i will be back in laguna on Wednesday and would love to take you up on the offer to show me that this is not how your hotel is kept.

Victor the manager and Samantha at the front desk were very helpful in assisting us with an issue we had. Access to the beach is superb and the staff is very friendly, always suggesting places to go and where to eat. Thanks again for all the help!

You can not beat the location of Pacific Edge Hotel,  located a few steps from Laguna Beach boutiques, bar, restaurants, and practically on the sand. We got the room by the ocean, not with ocean view, we were steps away from the beach , and from my balcony , we enjoyed the beautiful Laguna ocean views , at night I can heard the ocean roaring, like in my backyard. The hotel is clean, the maids,personal and staff in the front desk are friendly, is pet friendly and I bring my hairy soon, Jake babe, he was happy with his food tray ( I forgot his at home) , his chew toy rope and his treats in the welcome package. If they give my dog a 5 star treatment at the front desk, they already bought my heart.  If you are expecting a resort, with people serving you at the pool, you are in the wrong place. This place has more laid back  CA vibe and allows you to use a sitting area they have  right at the beach, for the guests of the hotel.   So for me  the day was ocean, ocean  and beach 24/7 and for me that is heaven in earth.The restaurant has wonderful breakfast (is not included) and at night was difficult to get in the bar,  at 8 PM was already crowded with local people enjoying a music show while lounging at the terrace again with views of the ocean. What a unique place, with great assets . I am not a high maintenance girl, but I am a free spirit who loves ocean,comfort, clean rooms and the access to all the amenities in town and this place has it all. It is not cheap, but nothing is cheap in Orange County and you are paying for unbeatable location in the middle of everything and at the same time private feeling and close to the nature. I  amd glad we booked the ocean room steps from the beach , this was my best honey moon ever.

Great location, great staff, awesome hotel on the beach. We have stayed here three times and every time does not disappoint. It is worth it to wait for deals and try to get a beachfront room. We saw dolphins and sea lions from our balcony. Definitely kid friendly.

The night before I stayed here I actually had a nightmare that I had booked us a night at a slightly upscale (but still horrible) Motel 6... Damn you, negative yelpers!Turns out though I was more than pleasantly surprised with Pacific Edge Hotel. When I booked an ocean front room for $159 I thought there had to be a catch but low and behold, there was none! Woohoo.The staff was super friendly and even sent a bottle of wine up to the room. I'm not sure if that's the norm but it was well appreciated. The room itself was a decent size and well laid out. There was a full size fridge and a table and Adirondack chairs on the deck. Did I mention how awesome the view was??? Check out my attached picture.The bathroom however was... how do I put this nicely? Small, outdated and very brightly painted (I don't think a more offensive yellow exists). But for one night, it did the trick. The only other negative was that $20 for valet is a little steep. You can walk down to the beach in less than two minutes and if you take the beach-walk route, you can be in downtown Laguna in less than ten minutes.If you bear in mind that this is NOT a four star establishment (it has 3 *'s) and it doesn't have a ton amenities or even pretend to, you won't be disappointed.Joie de Vivre (the hotel's brand) did a great job of transforming this place. I hope they don't make it too fancy in the future because they'd be able to charge at least double for a night. Awesome place for a "stay-cation" (we live 30 mins. away). We were just staying the night as a surprise for hubby's birthday... A little drinking, a nice dinner... Let's face it: $159 is a helluva lot cheaper than a  possible DUI.

The only good thing about this hotel is the location and easy access to the beach. Upon my arrival I noticed someone elses clothes in one of the rooms and that the bathroom had not been cleaned. I called front desk thinking maybe we were in someone elses room. They assured me that I was in the right place and sent a housekeeper. He "cleaned" the bathroom and left the clothes. At that point I was already frustrated so I just threw the clothes in a closet. The kitchen didnt seem very clean either. I had to do it myself, which is not what I was looking forward to on my vacation. I got over all that so I could enjoy myself then at the time of check out I noticed my card had been charged twice for our entire stay. The front desk person said it was a holding fee but I find that completely ridiculous. They told me at check in I would only be charged another $100 for our stay as a incidental deposit. Instead they charged me double for my entire stay. I was told it would take 5 days to see my credit! WTF!I will never stay here again. Not worth the money in my opinion. Also, they knew how frustrated I was, the least they could have done was comp parking but NOPE.

We had our Company Beach Party at the Bungalows in July.  Everyone had a great time, the food was outstanding but I want to give our BEST REVIEW TO OUR SERVER:  JESSIE, he was AMAZING!!!!  Thank you Jessie for taking such good care of all of us. Wish the best always. VCC in Irvine

What a disappointment!!  The pictures do not reflect what the room really looks like!!  Yes they did "renovate" some rooms. We were going to stay there for bday celebration. We had two room reserved.  One ocean and one pool view.   They neglected to say pool view is facing the street and is very noisy on the PCH1.    The smaller room was not renovated.  The girl at the desk mentioned my room was renovated but the room that the girls were staying in wasn't.  Then also commented but that's ok, they won't care, they are kids.  WHAT??!!   At the price they are charging!!! Almost $500 to look at a noisy street in a microscopic room.  An AC unit built in the wall like a cheap hotel and a refrig. next to the bathroom door!  I was also told the girls would have a balcony. NOPE, they did not!  It was the walk way.   My balcony had rotted wood and paint chipped off.  The girls room had about 1 foot between the end of the bed and the wall.  Does not look like that in their pic!I immediately walked back out of the room and went to the front desk and cancelled my reservations.   Luckily Surf n Sand had 2 cancellations and we grabbed those to recover and save my daughters bday celebration in style!When I went to cancel, there was another family at the front desk doing the same thing! They said they some comments as we did.  Except they were screaming it.The one thing I can say though is the staff was very nice and polite!We live locally and eat at The Deck and that is nice too!

As most reviewers have noted, the rooms could use some updating. But when you're right on the beach, who wants to hang out in their room? Especially with the paper thin walls that don't mask a sound.The location is great for hitting the beach, shopping and dining - it's all walkable.The staff is extremely friendly. The welcome note and bottle of wine are a nice touch. So is the free wi-fi.When in the area, I would stay here again.

We stayed at the Pacific Edge during our recent visit to Laguna Beach, ending up on the 3rd floor of the Seas Building.The location is great, and the staff were very friendly - however the room needed some attention. The carpet needs replacing as there was a large stain in the center of the room, also there were rust stains inside the refrigerator. Several times during our stay the TV turned off by itself,and on at least two occasions a notification message appeared on the TV displaying a incoming call. Hopefully these items will be addressed, as we would consider a return visit in the future.

This place was absolutely amazing. Worth every penny! We stayed in the reef tower, ocean view with 2 queens for 2 nights. LITERALLY every single staff member we came in contact with was as friendly as money could buy! The views were amazing! Pool and spa was amazing. And the fact that the beach is 2 min walk was stunning. It was like a private beach area!! We will stay here EVERY SINGLE TIME we visit laguna from now on

Me and my now husband flew in from Wa for our wedding the following day and had hardly gotten any sleep the night before. We arrived at the hotel around 9pm and I was completely stressed out about all the wedding stuff that had to be done the next day. Anyways we go to check in and they noticed we had an event the next day so we told them yes that we were getting married. Stacey, I believe her name was, upgraded us from queen bed street facing room to a king bed, balcony, ocean view room. We were absolutely ecstatic and so appreciative of this upgrade. She has know idea how much that room upgrade ment to us and how happy and stress relieving that entire experience was. I have never had an experience like this before and this truly started the excitement of the wedding and relieved so much stress. Beautiful room  and beautiful hotel!

Stayed here in a double queen beach front room in the reef building. You could not stay closer to the water's edge if you tried. The room was clean, had a mini fridge. Could definitely use a microwave.  The views are absolutely incredible and sleeping with the private patio door open at night listening to the waves is a great escape. Is this a 5 star full service top of the line hotel? Not really. But I appreciate being able to afford to be ocean front. My family had stayed here 11 years ago when the hotel was under another name. When we checked in this week, they offered us a complimentary bottle of wine for coming back. If I came back to Laguna I would definitely book another beachfront room here.

Located right on the beach and walking distance from surf breaks in Laguna.  Pacific Edge, like the Shorebreak (in HB), is part of a family of hotels that provides an upscale, 4-star experience that is pet and geared toward more active lifestyles (surfing, etc)  We found a discounted rate via Hotels Tonight, and if you find a deal (mid-week is better), you'll be rewarded with a great view of the water.  This hotel is ideally located for exploring the beach community in Laguna or heading out on the town and finding a little night life.  Parking is Valet but I have really enjoyed both this hotel and the other hotel property in HB.  If you get the chance, I think you'll be pleasantly surprised with the experience.

The ocean front rooms are indescribable! The sound of the waves as your sleeping, waking up to a sunrise, & the sand at your door step give this property a 5 star!! Not to mention the service is impeccable, & location to par. Overall a polished 5 star from those particular angles. However, the interior of the room is pretty disappointing, although comfortable. The paint colors are two shades away from experiencing psychedelics. The lighting is damn near a hospital or cafeteria, and the use of furniture is transported from the 1970's & repainted with a sophisticated twist. Although they offer updated technology, the flat screen they chose for the size of the wall reminds me of the Chris Farley skit, "fat guy in a lil coat", except other way around. It's an itsy-bitsy television for a huge wall space! Price points are comparable, & with warning of the aesthetic, would definitely stay again for the beauty of the view!!

READERS: This is a very low key beachy relaxed hotel not the four seasons. If you are looking for something super fancy and pretentious look somewhere else!I stayed here again last week in the ocean front reef room. The view is amazing! no this isn't the fanciest place in laguna but look around the prices are pretty reasonable compared to some hotels. location is perfect, within walking distance to everything. Past years there was always a charge for parking, now the only thing that has changed is someone else parks your car for you.My only issue was; I had arrived early and was told they would put a rush on our room and give us a call when it is ready. I understand they can't guarantee an early check in. After an hour and a half we got tired of waiting and decided go to the lobby. it turned out that our room had been ready and no one remembered to call us! ahh its OK though, We were still checked in at about 2:30.  One of the employees who was walking near the reef building noticed me struggling with my luggage and went out of his way to carry it up the stairs and put it in my room for me. So that made up for it!The room was not the largest nor the fanciest but the balcony is where we pretty much lived when we weren't walking about or laying out. The beach chairs/umbrellas and towels they offer are so convenient.  Ralph's is across the street where we were able to pick up some alcohol snacks and reading material. In the early evening a complimentary bottle of wine was delivered to our room with a very nice welcome note.  nice touch! Yes there were scratches and dings on the furniture, but I don't care about that. $200 a night to fall asleep and wake up to the ocean is completely worth it to me. So close to the water you can spot dolphins swimming about all day long.Once again I was not disappointed and will continue to come back.

I have stayed here for 2 nights. I have paid those nights through expedia.com and they charged me once again for the second time for the same nights!This guy Brian Sullivan is a psycho!! when I was leaving the hotel he followed me from my back to my room and did wire taping.. OMG! So scary!I have called the place and reported this as a scary thing happening here. I guess it was not their first time of police complaints...

Location Location Location and great beach front. This is what you are paying for here. The hotel is a bit old and can use some work. Nothing major just a face lift. Might be time to change the pipes and update the TV's.Not a fan of the valet for $20 a night but this is Laguna Beach.Customer service was great. Would not mind staying again.

Very disappointed, we booked through Travelzoo, and with the ratings, location, etc. I expected something special.  Our room was very small with an ocean view if I leaned over the railing.  The rooms on the website are colorful and nicely decorated.  Ours had nothing on the walls, a sheet over the comforter and 3 pillows.  So if you book please ask a lot of questions, we paid top dollar and I will not visit again.

TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!! And i have not even been there yet. And I wont be. For the last week I have been trying to make reservations and I keep being placed on hold for 10-15 min at a time. Finally I get through and I ask for rates and room availability and she tells me the prices. I tell her I will call back tomorrow once I get an approval from the rest of the group. (Anyone who has ever been put in charge of planning a big group event understand the frustration.) So long story short I finally get the numbers together presenting to everyone and call back today only to find out that there is a minimum 2 nights stay. Thats fine. But why did NOBODY TELL ME THIS YESTERDAY when I said I will call back tomorrow. All she said ok the prices may increase. Which is fine; but tell me if htere will be a NEW REQUIREMENT. Now here is the kicker. It was not a new requirement. This was true even when I called.  The woman on the phone had the audacity to lie to me and tell me this was just changes TODAY. When our other friends booked their room for two nights the day before and were told its a minimum requirement. SERIOUSLY!!! you are not only not going to honor the days i requested you are right out lying to me!So, honestly I would never stay here if this was the type of service i received without even having booked it.I read all the horrible reviews and I was like no its fine let me give them a try. WELL I SURE SHOUDL HAVE BELIEVED MY FELLOW YELPERS. I am sorry i even doubted it. WOW. Terrible service. My friend is canceling her rooms and we are going somewhere else. My advice to the management would be to get their *ish together. Have everyone be on the same page. And if you do mess up; please don't lie to your customers. So unprofessional. I dont care for the excuses you will offer me or the logic behind your lack of service. At the end of the day; you are in the business of providing a service and you FAILED.

The only reason this hotel even gets a star, is the location. I was there this past weekend, and the stay was terrible! The hotel is dirty.  The room is smaller than my closet.  Seriously.  Bed, dresser, bench, with approximately 1' around each edge of the bed and a teeny bathroom. Oh, the bathroom. I thought I was going to die in the shower. The paint was peeling from every surface of the tub, and beyond the threat of possible lead poisoning, the floor of the tub creaked so loud every time I shifted my weight (I'm a whopping 110lbs), I was fairly certain the floor was going to collapse into the room below. I guess I could look at this as a good thing, since the terror got my heart rate up, and they have no gym. Or, if they did, no one on the staff offered to show us where any amenities were located.  Speaking of which, for a hotel that has several buildings on the property they have ONE ice machine, and it was not located in our building. Also, on the top, (4th), floor, the only window in the place had no screen. The patio door did not lead to a balcony, but to the open hallway outside the room. The only positive to even having a patio door, was it sort of made the room look large enough to move around. This was an illusion, however, as it was impossible for two very small women to even walk past the bed at the same time. Save for the valet attendants, the employees are incredibly rude.  The "beachfront" is about 4' wide, and half the length of the hotel.  We showed up for dinner at 920pm, and the snippy hostesses refused to seat us, despite the fact that the hours are posted to be open until 10. "We stop seating at 930," was their response. Did I mention it was 920?   They say they are dog friendly, but you can't take them around the beach property at all, and if you leave them in the room and they bark at all, the ridiculously snide and condescending staff member will threaten to charge you for the rooms around you, or to kick you out.  For what I paid, and seeing the photos posted to their site, I was expecting a nicer, more resort-like property.  I will definitely not be visiting this place ever again. Gross. Just, no.

My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary, paying $250 a night for a beachfront room in the Reef building. There's no parking choice except for valet ($20 a night) and it was chaotic. No one offered to help us with our bags which involved us getting a baggage cart and taking it half a block down an alley to our building. My wife has mobility issues, and once there, we found out that there was no elevator and we had to carry our luggage down two flights of stairs to our floor. Not a happy moment.The balcony and view were great, but the room and building needed some work. The flimsy cracked ceiling panels covering the lights banged up and down every we opened a door or had the balcony door open. The shower curtain bar was very rusted and the modest bathroom itself had almost no place to put toiletries, hang towels, etc. The entire building needs maintenance for rust, peeling paint, etc.When I mentioned these issues to the manager on checkout he said that next time we should request a different, newer building which is closer to the restaurant and somewhat noisier, but has elevators. I asked why we weren't put in that building to start with when I asked for a "special" room for our anniversary or at least told about the elevator situation. I'd think twice before staying here again for that price and level of accommodation, but I will say that the staff were very nice and the view was priceless.

What you're paying for here is the view and the sound of the ocean. Absolutely love it. Getting an ocean front room is a must!! The rooms are just so-so, but the views make up for it. Initially, we had a room above the bungalows and next to the Deck restaurant which wasn't very private or quiet.
