We asked to be moved to the surf tower (we had stayed there before) and the front desk was very helpful and accommodating.

This review is specifically for the beach front cabanas.Loved loved loved them!  Tons of space, great access to the beach, multiple attendants grabbing us our necessities and overall reasonably priced.  I would definitely go back.  Great experience.Oh yes, and order the MOJITO pitcher...simply YUM!
Perfect location, great service, really small room but when you're on the ocean who cares? They also gave us a bucket of goodies when we checked in. So nice!

The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, I showed up before check in time and they were able to find me a room to check in early and took my luggage up for me. The valet is expensive but was well worth it! We had a oceanfront room in the surf building and it had an Amazing view. The only negative was our room 605 had a large gap under the door and you could see out in the hallway from the large gap in the side of the door. It felt a little unsafe at times and disturbing at night when you could hear all the guest outside. Great location and great hotel..they just need to fix a few things.

I had never been in Leguna Beach, so when my wife suggested that we stop there for the night, I was excited.  I think she booked it as a bit of a treat for the dog and me since she knows we both love the beach.  We stayed in a king room with a kitchenette on the ocean side, but there was a building in between us and the ocean.  Even though I couldn't see the ocean, I could still hear the waves crashing on the beach when I went to bed.The room looked like an old school beach motel that had been upgraded with a new bed.  Really it was very comfortable.  It looked like they had put in a new shower, and the herbal toiletries were very nice, my favorite being the bamboo lemongrass body wash.It was perfect for us that the hotel allowed dogs.  Also, you can't beat basking in high 70 degree weather when you know that the temperature in NOLA is in the 30s.What I loved about Pacific Edge:The location, it was so easy to get down to the beach, and dogs were allowed as long as they were on leash.  The beach was beautiful with the mountains in the background.  Although, the waves were not big, and I think it has to do with the land configuration, they were still nice.  The town is also very nice and walking for coffee and breakfast was very easy.What I didn't like as much:I could hear a lot from the other guests.  The sound of someone showering in the adjacent room seemed loud, and there were guys that I could hear talking to each other, I mean I could clearly hear every single word they were saying.  There was a door that adjoined our kitchenette with another room, probably a better door would have fixed that problem.

Besides being very close to the ocean, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. It does have amazing ocean front rooms but if you're not lucky enough to get one of those, the other rooms aren't really worth the price. Also, if you find that your room only has air conditioning and no heating, you need to call the front desk to ask for a personal heater... That's what I had to do for my second night. Besides that, I would give the location 5 stars. Walking distance to anything you could possibly want - shopping, bars, beach, etc.

Stayed here for my bday and it was a great experience. Nice renovated rooms in "reef" and I had a balcony that was basically on the beach. Friendly staff who would say good morning to you when you were walking around. Great location and great hotel

My Mom & Grandson are staying there right now!  She goes there every single summer!  She booked her usual room which she loves because of the kitchenette.  They didn't have it for her!  They put her in another place which doesn't have a kitchenette because some of the rooms are being redone. They tried to accommodate her request for the kitchenette by giving her a microwave, but no silverware or dishes.  No way to cook except for the microwave and not a large fridge.  Now she's stuck there for a week in a crappy place with only a microwave to cook with!The rest of our family decided 2 years ago to never stay here again - there was a strong sewer smell in the rooms and everything was very run down, dirty and uncomfortable.  My 88 yr old Mom is the only one who wants to go back to this hotel and this is how she's treated.It is unacceptable!7/2/14 They moved her to the desired room which had been freshly painted and was in top-notch condition.  Also found out that - at check-in- they offered to give her a suite over the office, which she turned down because it wasn't close enough to the beach.  (She didn't tell me that originally - that was a nice way to improvise!)Sean replied in a timely and satisfactory manner.  My Mom is very happy.  Thanks so much!

We stayed here on our wedding night. I always loved the pacific edge because it was right on the water. We received champagne after checking in, which was super nice. The room wast anything to write home about. It was super tiny and smelled like cigarettes. We had to air out the room for a few hours. The bathroom was small and nothing special. We weren't too happy with paying an additional $30 to park overnight, especially when we live so close. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again. Expected a nicer room for the price.

My husband and our 2 kids stayed here for vacation and overall is was a good experience. The regular rooms are nothing fancy but when you are right on the ocean who really stays in their room all day. We decided to upgrade to a partial ocean front room the last night and I wish we would have done it sooner. The room was much nicer. The staff were helpful and the valet guys were amazing! The guests at the hotel, not so much, maybe it's just the area. Also, maybe not the best option for small children.

This hotel deserves five stars in every category. The staff is helpful, kind and hospitable in every way, making checkin, checkout, beach reservations and getting on the internet easy. The facility is incredible! Our rooms were on the oceanfront, and the thrill of watching the sun set behind Catalina is indescribable. Being lulled to sleep by the sound of the Pacific is also amazing. Some of our party did not have oceanfront rooms- they were great too. The hotel is within walking distance of downtown Laguna but you never have to go anywhere as there are two restaurants on site. The coffee at the Orange Inn less than a block away will  keep you going all day. This hotel is as close to paradise as I can imagine. We will return for certain!!

Front desk upgraded our room for no reason, just to be nice. Pacific Suite was great. Comfortable bed, very roomy bathroom, clean, updated and view was fabulous. Recommend this property and staff was very helpful and pleasant.

Excellent value for beach access!!  Accommodated early check in and the beach area is beautiful.  The front desk staff is so welcoming and friendly.  They provide maps of the local area and are just overall nice.  We have two toddlers and have had no problem getting around the hotel- everything is easily accessible.  Our room is in the surf wing and it's very comfortable with a small fridge and microwave as we requested one.  The beach area is gorgeous!! The lounge chairs and towels are an amazing plus!! Very thick towels and great padded loungers.  The beach amenities alone make this hotel a steal!!! You won't be disappointed staying here.  My only negative is that we only booked one night.  I would love to stay longer but we will definitely be back.

This place was a good hotel until after we left our vacation. The system was up when they first charged our card then it failed and they re-charged our credit card twice. Then after they return the second charge. They charged our debit card. we called them to let them know today and they reversed it to recharge it again!!! So we're letting the bank take over. I hope this place figures out there shit and we're the only pissed off customers. Overall though,  the stay was beautiful the rooms were very plain but we're paying for the property not the room designs so I can understand that. The deck which was where we dined was beautiful as well . Valet was nice to. But it's a whole other situation when the hotel keeps charging and charging then leaving you stranded because they take your money repeatedly . We filed a claim with Wells Fargo against this hotel.

Was supposed to stay here with my mom and grandma for 3 nights but since my grandma wasn't feeling good, we only stayed for 1. They refunded us for the 2 nights we didn't use and weren't rude about us leaving early. Everyone was helpful, polite, and friendly. Our 2 double beds room was a little small, but other than that, nothing wrong with the room! If you're looking to stay here, I highly recommend getting a beach view room since you are literally RIGHT on the beach and the sunsets are gorgeous. I am VERY picky about hotel rooms because I've had bad experiences other places but this hotel was great! Definitely coming back here in the future!!

We arrived 45 mins early and it was no problem at all. Our room, an oceanfront junior suite, is just simply amazing. We had some issues with the facilities in their Pacific Suite" but staff reached out to me within 24 hours and more than made things right. I'm so glad that I worked the extra hours that I did in order to pay for our dream vacation. Amazing beach access, we saw dolphins from our balcony 10 mins after first walking into our room. I'd just give two words of advice, BOOK IT! And to the staff of PE please keep up the great service!! If your coming to PE go for the OceanFront Junior Suite, book your vacation days around that rooms availability if needed.  Its the rock star room of the entire property!!

Loved how nice everyone was.I booked this for after my wedding and they were very sweet, they even left a nice note and a bottle of wine to congratulate us. The only down size is that it's valet only parking that's 30$ a night.

I know this has taken a little while to write, but I need everyone to know what a great stay-cation we had here.  We were remodeling our home and had the luxury of staying a month at this hotel.  We would have stayed longer, however, the last weekendwas sold out & ocean fronts were not available.  The staff was great!  Britain went over & beyond the call of duty as well as many others.  The housekeeping staff (Raffiela) even checked in on my sick daughter, cleaned around my cats & made our room look nice every evening.   I hope I get to return every summer!!!!

Enjoyed our stay. Location was ideal. View was spectacular. Stay in an ocean view room. Well worth the upgrade. Had ants in our first room and the moved us to a better room. Valet guys work hard and do a above par job. Left my bag in the room after check out and within 20 minutes they called and held onto so we could drive back and get it. Staff were very accommodating.

I wouldn't necessarily agree that this is a "3 star" hotel.. maybe 2- 2/12. Even if you don't pay extra money to upgrade for a ocean front room, you are still very close to the beach.. so that's definitely a plus! Room service was quick and the bed was pretty comfy.The room could use some upgrades. I wasn't a fan of the room not having any mirrors aside from the one in the bathroom. Also, the bathroom had no ventilation at all so getting ready while someone was showering was impossible. Lastly, I felt like everything was for sale in that room. (Beach bag, stuff animal, waters, etc) I guess thats how they make their money but .. kind of annoying. Front desk staff, was excellent. Very enthusiastic and helpful. I believe Javid checked us in but I didn't catch the name of the guy checking us out. However, it was quick and effortless. Suggestion to owner, do some upgrades and lower the ocean front rooms! I totally would have stayed in one if the price was more out of town friendly! :)Oh yah.. and $24 a night for valet is way too high! We used the meters outside and probably spent a total of $10 for the entire weekend.

This is my second time here.  The oceanfront view is fabulous.  The room isn't stylish - but clean and functional.  Very old beat up fridge.  But it works.  The bed was not comfortable for me.  The surf and sand down the road with the same view has really comfortable beds.  You pay 500 to 700 dollars.  Staff is great.  Very helpful.  At 300 a night it's a deal.  For a family even better

Yelpers, you scared me!  I booked this place at the suggestion of a coworker who stayed and enjoyed it.  I didn't check yelp before I booked (and I always check) so when I looked at yelp two weeks before our trip, I was horrified.  Mold!  Terrible service!  Rotten wood and door jams!  Scratches on the car from the valet! And you all included pictures!  It wasn't just some delusion of a prima donna who is used to their Ritz Carlton stay.  I was terrified.  What had I invested my money in!?So, we left for home with trepidation.  I had booked the Oceanfront King room and I was praying it was in the new tower.  Lucky for us it was (Reef Tower).  We were able to check in around 4:30, and the front desk staff were very helpful.  The front entry way also was clean and decorated well in a typical "beachy" fashion.  I was so happy when we got to our room.  Beautiful view of the beach and ocean.  We were the first level, so it almost felt like we were right on the beach.  The room was clean and obviously newly redone.  It had a wet bar, and a decent sized flatscreen TV, as well as a speaker doc for iPhone.  The bed was comfortable and we honestly didn't want to leave our hotel room even for dinner.  We had an extremely relaxing evening sitting out on the balcony and watching the sunset with a bottle of wine.  Lovely.  The front desk also sent us a complementary bottle of wine, which was welcomed!  There were a few discrepancies in the remodel of the room, but I chalk some of it up to the fact that between my architect boyfriend and me being the product of a family who works in construction and craftsmanship, we were bound to notice.  The bathroom was a little on the small side (although the shower itself had plenty of room). The air conditioner also gave us some trouble, although I'm not altogether sure it was the air conditioners fault and not mine as I attempted to turn it on sleepy and blind in the middle of the night.  We had a later check out at noon in the morning (so relaxing to wake up the the sound of the waves).  Downsides: You do have to pay for valet ($24), although it was nice not to deal with the hassle of trying to find a place to park in Laguna.  Pacific Edge also does not seem to be very handicap friendly.  There are a lot of split levels and stairs going on, so if you are in a wheelchair, you might have some difficulty.  Other than that, it appears to me if you get one of their beach front rooms in a newly remodeled tower, you should be good to go!
It wasn't fair. My review above...thinking back it was a great great experience. It isn't the Four Seasons but it IS a great place. Great location. Great staff.

If you're not willing to pay for an ocean view room, you may not like this place. We had an ocean view room with a king sized bed and the view was amazing. The room was updated, but the AC unit was a bit loud. The hotel offered complimentary loungers, beach chairs, umbrellas, and towels. The staff was very friendly.If you're into fitness, the hotel has a deal with the Art of Fitness where you can work out for free. This place is close to everything. We parked once and never had to drive anywhere.Overall, we liked it and would stay here again!

Love love love it ! I've been coming here for 4 years at least . The rooms are clean, not so modern but that doesn't matter to me . They have private beach access for guest along with providing chairs and umbrellas with an assistant to help you . In the past I've rented out the bungalows for a birthday and had the best time .
I was charged for valet. Even thought it states on yelp that's it's a complimentary/: I ended up paying 19 dollars and I didn't stay over night

The front desk was great got me checked in quickly and even gave me a beautiful upgrade! Room 105 is amazing and so breathtaking. Once I arrived in my room the front desk called me to make sure I was comfortable after that they sent me a lovely bottle of wine to enjoy and watch the sunset!! This is 100% the place to stay in Laguna Beach!! Can't wait to come back service is outstanding !! Check out the Reef building

This was our first time staying at this hotel.  I'm confused about the pictures that was on the website. I have to admit they looked a lot better online. But don't let the other negative comments from other scare you. It's still a nice place.The  beds were really comfortable I was surprised actually. People at the front desk were super nice. I went to 'the deck' and took a peak it was beautiful. I had just missed music entertainment, so I was a little bummed. The room decor was really nice. I took a picture of the lobby for my own ideas in my home. Next time I would like to stay again but on the full ocean view side. I would stay here again for sure if the price was right again. There was a nice breakfast place just up the street. We walked to it both mornings. It's called the penguin. Check it out.

I live in Los Angeles, but wanted a little "staycation" out of the city, for my birthday.  Several of my girlfriends & I stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel last weekend.  It is a small, boutique, beachy hotel right on the water - of course the views don't get any better and you can walk directly onto the beach from the property.  The rooms were small but very clean & seemed to be recently remodeled.Aside from great views & perfect location, the service was amazing.  Everyone was very friendly & welcoming, from the valet to the front desk to housekeeping.  This is a quaint little property that I would recommend to travelers or locals looking for a little get away.Also on property are 2 restaurants; The Deck & Driftwood Kitchen - both had amazing food and an energetic atmosphere (both look out onto the ocean).  The Deck is a little more casual / bar feel, while Driftwood Kitchen is a little more upscale.  Oh and behind Driftwood Kitchen is a little bar they call Stateroom.  So fun after dinner!

I stayed here in August of 2012 with my parents, and we had a room with a balcony with the ocean view.  I just read a few other reviews of recent stays and it sounds like not too much has changed since my stay - the bathrooms were gross when I went and it seems like they still are.  The staff was awesome - pretty and friendly people.  I love the colors they chose for the walls and the decor of the rooms.  However, I was a bit shocked with the dirty lounge chair (beautiful but dirty) and I was most disappointed with the bathroom.  The bathroom, especially for girls, is essential to be beautiful.  This one had horrible fluorescent lighting and paint that was peeling off the walls; the showers were old and not clean feeling.As others have said here, the location is quite phenomenal though.  I remember my first night sleeping there - I couldn't get over how amazing the sound of the waves crashing against the rocks was!  And the smell of the ocean is sweet!  I think if the hotel just revamps a bit and works on their cleanliness and updated their bathrooms, they will be in great shape.

We took advantage of a Travelzoo deal and upgraded to an ocean front (and I mean front) room, Room 128 and loved it so much, we are already trying to make this our NYE tradition, for many years to come.  Only two little things were a wee bit annoying . . .1. The bed was way too soft for our liking and we awoke with stiff backs and necks.2. The check out is at 11:00 AM with zero wiggle room, no late check outs so next year we just need to book for two nights rather than one.  The ocean front view is absolutely spectacular and the roar of the waves was a real plus. And their staff was most gracious.

The place has a very nice ocean view, clean rooms and relax atmosphere. But the best part of it is they have very professional and nice staff specially Michael Reilly, their Front Office Supervisor. He is excellent!!! I'll surely come back.

This is my first time staying here and from the minute I pulled up I was impressed with the customer service. Joe who is in charge of maintenance (I think) literally ran to my room to get me a shower chair. Also, since the room is a bit older I couldn't fit (with wheelchair) into bathroom so the owner himself came over and took off the bathroom door! From when I checked in to all that happening it probably only took 30min. They were on it and removed the door no problem. The room is hanging right over the Pacific and is spacious even for a wheelchair. I can even roll out into the deck fully independently. The bed is comfy and the decor updated, clean, and nice. One massive high five to the Pacific Edge for having accessible outlets to plug everything in. They are easy to get to on the wall by the bed as well as outlets built into the top of the nightstands and desk. Nice!! It's the little things! :-) I ordered room service this a.m and they were here in about 15-20min and it was quite good. Not super hot but I don't know what room service ever is?The only downfall is the wireless here. I'm not sure if it's my computer or their wireless but my partner isn't able to get online with her computer either. I did call the front desk and they connected me with their internet company straight away and I walked through a couple steps with him but the problem was never resolved.

This was our first time staying at this hotel. We got a special from Travelzoo for a village room for $99 which included valet parking ($24) and a free appetizer at The Deck restaurant. We paid an extra $100 and upgraded our room to an oceanfront suite! With a view like this we didn't need to go anywhere but our own balcony which was very nice. My only complaint was the wi-fi was weak. We had to use our 4G to get Internet. We will definitely be staying here again.

I was a bit worried to stay here based off some of the reviews that I read about Pacific Edge but I noticed that most of the good reviews were from people who stayed in the Ocean View rooms. I made sure to to get an ocean view room so I requested to stay in the Reef building. The entire property does look a bit old but I didn't mind it since the room I stayed in was great. It was clean and the view from the balcony was gorgeous. We had waves crashing below us and slept to the sound of waves all night long. The person who check us in knew that it was my wedding anniversary so she had a bottle of champagne sent up to us. Free champagne? That's never a bad thing :)FYI, valet parking is 20 bucks a day. I saw a lot of people park their cars outside in the streets in metered parking. I found a neighborhood a short walk away and just parked the car there. It was safe and only a 5 minute walk from the property. There are also a ton of places to eat around there. I was extremely happy with the stay. It's not the Four Seasons but it's a cozy hotel in a prime location and comfy bedPOSITIVES: reef rooms offer great ocean views from balcony, very friendly service, great location right on the beachNEGATIVES: valet parking fee, a bit dated. I will definitely come again. Great place to spend a special night

I'm very disappointed with our overall experience with this hotel for several reasons. I don't travel often but will run the range of budget motel to luxurious hotel and will always be fair in my expectations based on how much I'm willing to pay. I paid for a three star hotel and received two stars (at best). I strongly recommend Hotel Laguna as it is a few blocks away, cheaper, and much nicer.It started off badly as soon as we pulled into the hotel parking lot. The mandatory parking fee of $30 is excessive as many other reviewers have mentioned even for Laguna Beach.  Hotel management will comment that you have other options (metered parking on the street for example), but traffic is horrible here and parking is few and far between. Also, tourists not familiar with the area (like my wife and I) don't want to run the risk of tickets or getting our vehicle towed. I can understand charging fees of a few bucks to $20 (like other hotels) but be reasonable. The worst part is that you have to valet. Why must I turn over my keys to a stranger to park my car? I will gladly park in any designated spot the staff directs me to. Don't you think it's good practice to give guests reasonable accommodations? Also, my hesitation for valet is for good reason.The valet staff lacked professionalism and overall good customer service. Upon arrival, they look like a bunch of college kids gathered around a podium playing games or texting on their phones. Hotel guests (including myself) had to tap one of them on the shoulder to get service. No greeting or paying attention to guests around them - too busy on their smart phones. While I understand that the valet staff is a third party (not affiliated with the hotel) it will reflect on the hotel itself since this is the opening experience (and a bad one). The very next morning when my wife and I passed by the valet stand on our way to breakfast, one customer was standing around waiting for the only attendant currently on duty to bring his car around. No problem there except I noticed ALL THE CAR KEYS were clearly visible and unattended!!! Basically, the valet forgot to lock the key case, so for over five minutes anyone could have grabbed a bunch of keys and took off. Very nice - this is why I don't valet.Checking in to the room is in itself a poor experience. The carpeting leading down the dark hallways is disgusting. The elevator that we needed to take (my wife has knee problems and cannot use stairs easily) looked very poorly maintained as it squeaked and shook excessively while in use (very unnerving). The room itself is roomy but very outdated. I found the room to be on the same level with as a Motel 6 not a three star hotel. Why? Read on.Nothing fancy about the room but a major complaint being the old and stained carpeting. The stove was also old, but I can't speak to its functionality since i did not want to use it. The small refrigerator was fine though. The bed and linens were clean and comfortable (to be fair). The bathroom was poor though. It was the size of a closet! I don't know why the hotel room was so large and yet in the bathroom you cannot take more than one step in any direction without bumping into the sink, toilet, or bathtub. It was beyond cramped! The fixtures looked thrown together at the last minute, and the ground did not feel level. The bathtub was okay but the shower head was old and covered in disgusting grime/mildew. In taking a shower, the fixtures had a mind of its own since it would randomly switch between hot and cold on its own. Not goodWhen my wife and I left early morning 8:00am to check out the beach and shops we expected to return to a clean room with fresh linen and towels (a.k.a. room service). We wanted to take a quick shower and short nap to recharge for a night out on the town. In getting back to our room after 4:00pm there was no room service yet!! The hotel had over eight hours to clean up our room! I've been to cheap $60/night cheap motels (bigger than this one) that cleaned my room late morning/early afternoon. This is not unreasonable and is a fair expectation. The maid came by fifteen minutes later but hours too late. The worst part about the room is that the walls are paper thin, and we had a hollow door (or just a very cheap one) that separated the neighboring hotel room. Basically, after just a few minutes of settling in we heard (loud and clear) our neighbors every conversation! We first though there were other people in our room! A part of the neighbor's conversation was private and I'm sure he would not have been happy to know that a stranger was able to hear his every word (even though I tried not to).  Keep this in mind **WARNING** that you might be by the beach, but don't expect privacy if you don't keep your conversations at whisper level. Management has been called out on this in 2014 by another Yelp reviewer and agreed that this was an issue and would look into it. Well it is 2017...still looking into it?

We are here right now.Thank God we have an ocean view.  We have a balcony with Adirondack chairs staring straight out on the sea.  Absolutely spectacular and truly wonderful sea salt smells and so-so-soothing sounds of the ever-rolling waves.BUT tiny room, terrible bathroom (unless you happen to like mold, rust and broken ceilings), tacky Endless Summer posters (don't get me wrong -- I LOVED the movie -- but learn to matte your posters before you frame 'em; otherwise they ripple.  Any minimum wage Aaron Brothers clerk can tell you that...)  AND Housekeeping never came.  So we have old plates, old towels, no new (meaning, not used up) shampoos, etc.  Good thing my OCD husband likes to make the bed!Room service, if you can call it that, is sketchy.  It feels like the "hotel" broke up with The Beach House and The Deck because now you have to order room service from the restaurant across the street at the Holiday Inn -- AND they have minimum $ order (like $50 for dinner minimum!)  Plus limited hours. VERY strange.We got no "welcome note" or "welcome bottle of wine" as others have written here.  The web site is so pretty -- but DO NOT trust it!  We have been to many Joie de Vivre hotels and are shocked.  This can't be the same management/ownership!  Yes, the ocean views are gorgeous -- but everything else is a shock.  Mold?  Rust?  No housekeeping??  REALLY?

I stay at a lot of hotels and I see a lot of quality. This ranks in the low. The rooms are depressing, no useful furniture tiny cramped bathroom. No facilities for breakfast, they force you to use valet parking when you could drive your car to your own room. The pluses are decent in room coffee maker ,excellent TV and cable options, and close proximity to the beach. Don't look to this for a great hotel experience it's basically a place to flop and enjoy the beach.

This hotel sucks! Worst experience ever! Don't book this place unless you like a cheap motel like room. We had to change our room because our first room the people next door we could hear everything to there fighting to them in the bathroom it was disgusting. And they only had one room in the whole hotel so we changed to that. The walls are very thin so you can hear everything. The beds are super small and not comfortable at all. The pillows suck and the mattress does too. I did not sleep at all, it was awful. The website was a false advertisement of the hotel. Nothing like how it looks on the pictures. The only good thing is that the beach is right next to you, and the pool is always empty so you can always go no matter what time. Other than that I would never stay at this hotel again!

For a boutique hotel of this caliber, expectations were rather low. My walk in closet is bigger than the entire room, the bathroom is ridiculously small, water pressure in the shower barely trickles out--I would imagine in an attempt to save water--and the lighting for a beach front property was rather dingy and then.dark. Paying close to $200 a night, I felt I would have received better accommodations at the Holiday Inn across the street for less than half the money. Wouldn't reconsider this hotel ever again. Definitely needs improvement.

Not again. The lobby's got a niece view and coffee. The room we got was not representing the hotel as per the pictures on the internet. We asked for a quite room and got one next to the stairs. The hotel is pet friendly and close to the beach. Will not stay here again. The hotel is overpriced for what we got.

This place truly sucks, definitely not worth the $$$ they charge. $30 for bullshit valet that is parked within eyesight of the shitty room facing the busy road with the door that doesn't work....We opted to find a meter and park during our stay but upon checkout these mother fuckers charged us $180 in valet charges for the 3 days we were there not even utilizing their bullshit service anyway....The room smelled like pee and was old and not updated at all.  Would highly NOT recommend staying here.  There are many more options that include parking in the price of the room and have nicer updated rooms and not bait and switch photos on their websites.  The only bright spot was the cleaning staff which were very friendly and kind.  Other than that we will seek other options and will be leery of the parent company in future trips anywhere else.

My wife and I were very disappointed with this hotel for several reasons. First, the room was very old and drab looking. It was large but it had very little furniture. Lots of open wasted space which could have been used to expand the very small bathroom. The room had a small but loud air conditioning unit which did little to cool the room down. Every time the neighbor shut their door our whole room would shake. For the size of the hotel the pool area was way too small. It was a drab cement area with no lounge chairs just regular chairs. The hotel is on the beach so you would hope the pool area would have a ocean view but it was in the middle of the facility with no grass or plants, just cement. The restaurant area was crowded with tables placed way too close together.   To top it off the police visited to break up a fight. The one star is for the private beach area that provided lounge chairs and towels but no drink service. Do yourself a favor and avoid this hotel.

My husband and I had an amazing night's stay in the Pacific Suite. Started off great with the friendly staff and even greeted by the general manager. We got to the room to find ice cold beer waiting!  We had an awesome dinner at The Deck (The Deck shrimp tacos are the best I've ever had). And of course the view of the ocean is second to none. Even the Valet service was outstanding. Overall, the best experience we've had at a hotel. I can't say enough good things about our stay, it was perfect. Pacific Edge is a cool, surfer vibe hotel with high end touches and 5 star staff. Check it out.
Response to Sean Castady, asst. GM:Favorite thing about Laguna is the ocean and room 129!(Am curious tho about the two story "cottage")Will be back at Pacific Edge very soon!
The location of the Reef tower is the best!!5 steps out your door and your feet are in sand.

We stayed here for NYE. I used a Travelzoo special and upgraded to the remodeled section of the hotel on the beach. The remodeled rooms have a shabby chic beach theme. Our room and private balcony were spacious. The hotel is on the beach and within walking distance to downtown LB. We would stay here again and I recommend it to others.

So we stayed for a tuesday to friday stay last minute and it was amazing. we had a problem with the first room which i have to agree was a little dated but it's set up like a beach room, you can tell they don't expect you to be in your room much, but i digress, the room they transferred us to was amazing! Right on the water. The reef building is where to stay if you want to get your money's worth. So we decided to extend our stay through the weekend. The new room we were given was sub par. It was about the same size just had a full kitchen. and a bigger tub or as my husband said the shape was just different so it looked bigger but it wasn't. I was highly disappointed with the second room. if i had known it was going to look like this i wouldn't have agreed to pay more or extended my stay. i could've went home. you can't even see the beach, unless you look around a building. As well as the driftwood kitchen traffic you hear all night and then you have to deal with idling cars shaking your room so you can't just enjoy tv without a minor earthquake every 15mins. I give 3 stars for the first part of our trip being exceptionally amazing and the last 3 days over the weekend being sub par if not below. we had to ask for a microwave and a bottle opener which the bottle opener never came and the next morning when we asked again, the guy went on a search hunt around our room to see if it had been misplaced. dude don't you think we did that?!?! just go get another one. my husband asked the cleaning lady to come because the floors hadn't been done in awhile . We never left the room so the floors shouldn't have made my feet black.. she never came back. . the first night was great but after that.. ehhh..

Wishing we could leave 0 stars!! This place is disgusting! Small dingy rooms. Torn curtains- no heat - dirty floors and cold showers!  Just to name a few!  Went to front desk to let them know that this room is nothing like the room on their website only to be told they have various sites and over 100 styles of rooms, so basically there may be a handful of the cute rooms on the website and the rest are below Motel 6 quality!  The staff also smirked and basically laughed in our face at our concerns. As we Post this review we do see that there are multiple yelp sites for this hotel and the management comments back to the reviews are basically the same-they don't care!  Buyer be aware!  Much better options are available for $200!

Stayed here 6/28 thru 7/3 in a Beachfront King - Reef Tower, 5th floor.  Was so worried after so many opposing reviews, but really wanted to take the plunge.  So glad I picked this hotel!  Loved the room, looks just like the advert, the view and sounds of crashing waves was just so stinkin' awesome!  while it may be an older property, you would be hard-pressed to find any brand new hotel in that area.  So that assessment I've seen in previous reviews is frankly a given for the beach area overall.  One thing that might help improve the experience is improved directional signage while on the property - many buildings to navigate through to get around - never found the gym!  lolI've already convinced one couple to try it out.  :o)

First off, if you read any good comments or 5 star reviews, you could be sure it was from either a staff, friend, family member, or a patron who paid for an Oceanfront room.  For the rest of us who paid an upwards of $250.00 a night for a regular room, got just that, a regular room, somewhat to that of a Motel 6. To say the least, I was extremely disappointed. No heater, hot shower broke into cold in the middle of my bathing, the iron stopped working in the middle of my ironing, super loud air conditioning unit that has an option for heat, but it does not work, the swimming pool is freezing cold, but even if it wasn't, the ambiance is little to be spoken of, likened to that of a cheap apartment complex. And last, be sure to bring your own power strip because, although there are many power outlets, all of them are being used by the amenities in the room such as the lamp, TV, Icebox, Air conditioner, clock, phone, Coffee maker, which stop working in the middle of making coffee by the way. All of these things, and this was the better room. I asked for an upgrade because the first room I was originally assigned to had an awful mildew smell, the carpet was extremely dirty, and was muggy and wet.The windows were dirty and did not work properly, the room was very old and dirty feeling, the bathtub knobs were nasty, old, and full of soap scum. I absolutely hated my stay at this hotel and I am not even that picky. The spirit of the hotel is like they give you just enough, no more, but a little less. Almost as if to say, "Look, you're by the beach in the downtown area, stop being picky, shut up, and enjoy the outdoors, you're not supposed to be spending much time in the room anyway."So BUYER BEWARE!!!!! Even if you come and ask to see the room first, which I did, but was shown one of the Ocean fronts, which impressed me, so I booked right away, thinking all the rooms had somewhat of the same spirit. I knew I was downgrading by not getting an Ocean front, but did not realize the downgrade meant a low grade. Also, I noticed management replies to some of the previous reviews, which apologized, but never offered to make amends by returning some of the cost for all of the inconvenience, just the typical, "Oh we are so sorry that we did not meet your expectations." but please believe me when I tell you, I am a very simple person, not hard to please, and easy to be content; but bad smells, broken appliances, and un-kept surroundings are unacceptable from a hotel that charges an upwards of hundreds per night. All I could say is to make sure to get a tour first, and not of an Ocean Front unless that is the room you will be purchasing. To get the true spirit of the hotel, get a tour of a regular room, one by the pool that has the Jacuzzi, and I guarantee, you will be having second thoughts. To management: Please take more pride in your establishment. Don't wait to get 100's of these kinds of reviews before you make changes.

For almost $400 a night don't you expect a little luxury and a few snazzy amenities? Not here! This old 50s motel has a few cosmetic upgrades (mostly the entrance) but the room we had was terrible! Old furniture that didn't match, crummy carpet, veranda view of rooftops (partial ocean view advertised), just shabby and dated and definitely not luxurious! The first night we couldn't sleep because a nearby malfunctioning machine, probably an air conditioner, was humming loudly and vibrating, on and off, all night. We requested a room change for the second night and got another dated shabby room with less of a view. The staff seemed pleasant and willing to help, but it didn't compensate for the fact that the place is extremely overpriced and really crummy. I booked this online and wondered why there weren't many photos of the rooms. Now I know why. Also the valet service is $35 a night. The only nice thing was the beach with great service from the staff for lounge chairs and umbrellas.

Amazing let down for me and my family!  Tiny room with a view of...an alley!  No one helped us with bags from the car. $30.00 a day to valet my car in front of the room?  We were next to their hotel restaurant that played pounding, loud music from mid morning til night!  Our polite requests for some modification were met with "Would you like to check out?"  Antique heater works all on or all off. Why was there cellophane tape all over the walls above the beds? What caused the Hawaii-shaped stain on the carpet near the door?  For us, this was not the hotel that we saw on the website, and we will NEVER be back.

Got a great deal on Groupon for a one night stay. C.J. at the front desk was really helpful and welcoming, made sure we knew about metered parking as well as valet. He pointed out where the pools, beach access, nearby food and bar options were. I was even more surprised when he offered us a choice of red, white, or sparkling wine. I thought it would only be a little cup but instead it was a while bottle, totally complimentary. Once we got to the room I was again pleasantly surprised to find a small kitchen, about the size of the one in my own apartment. Included was an empty mini fridge. Since we brought out own drinks this was very welcome. The room itself was homey, with a beach lifestyle vibe rather than an sleek L.A. high-rise that some hotels go for. Personally I like this kind of décor, but don't go into it expecting the Westin. The pools were easily accessible and warm. Even when the security came around to close it they were very nice and gave us plenty of time to dry off and get going. In the morning we slept through my phone alarm so I called the front desk and asked if they could give us a little more time to check out. C.J. gave us another hour no problem. This is a great place to go and I'd love to come back whenever I'm next in Laguna.

I always forget to read the reviews before i sign up :(  I went here for a fast get away on the beach.I fell for the ole "$60 will get you an ocean view" routine from the front desk.The best $60 i ever spent . . . on the beach . . . great . . .the room?  not so much.horrible, basic motel room . . . having stayed at several other Joie de Vie properties i was very disappointed.  Of course, I complained . . . worthless.  The one BIG complaint besides the hotel room being dirty and old, was the fact that they allow dogs . . .great, ey?  not so much.dogs are not allowed on the patio . . . the only place to eat at this run down flea bag motel.in fact i asked the front desk for a list of pet friendly places to eat, the list referred me to the Shorebreak Hotel in Huntington Beach (one of my faves) . . . 20 miles away?  WTF?  so yelpers, read the reviews first . . . and focus on the beach and you should be ok.After all, it is Laguna.The General Manager seems to reply to all the complaints on Yelp, but nothing seems to change.

The views from this hotel are really spectacular. Also rented out one of the cabanas by the Deck for a party and we had an amazing time.Only reason I gave it a four is because non-valet parking is almost impossible to find, it can be a pain if you have a large group.

Spent Memorial Day weekend here. Stayed in the oceanfront surf wing. I loved the room. Recently renovated, super clean, nice decor, beach is steps away and a big balcony with a great view. Great staff/customer service. From the fast checkin, to valet, and help with our luggage. Really loved our stay here. Looking forward to our next visit.

This is for event planners.I've tried contacting this hotel for an event over and over- by phone, by e-mail, by their sales department and they just don't seem to respond. With such unresponsiveness, do I trust them with my event?I heard good things about them, but I guess I have to take my business elsewhere.

Yet another bad experience calling the hotel. I had called a few weeks ago asking what I needed to do to gift my night to a friend. The representative said all I need to do is change the name on the reservation and have my fiend bring in the voucher.I called today and spoke to KELSY. I mentioned to her I wanted to change the name on a reservation. She was quite rude. At one point, I ask a question and there was dead silence on the phone. I even made the remark if anyone was there on the other end. She then told me I needed to call Plum District and have them change the name on the voucher! With all the millions of subscribers Plum District has, I highly doubt this a common thing they do. Pacific Edge is pretending to be something they are NOT. They should not call themselves a hotel, but rather a MOTEL.I agree with all the other yelp reviewers. Buyer beware. There are plenty of other hotels in Laguna Beach that are not trying to claim to be something they are not.

I have to give it 4 stars for room service issue. Was going to be 5. A friend referred me to this hotel I was coming in town for my birthday and work and requested an ocean view room and even though you pay for an ocean view room you sometimes do not get the best room but I was given what I would say is one of the best rooms on the property with the most amazing view and had amazing service when I checked in. Also was delivered a bottle of champagne for my birthday. Very happy with the accommodation. The rooms inside are very nice. Comfortable bed amazing Oceanview comfortable to stay in and walking distance to everything and amazing restaurants and coffee shops. I couldn't have been happier with everything. My last night I had a 15 hour workday was starving just wanted room service came back to the room called room service no one answered left a message called the front desk they told me to keep calling and to leave a voicemail then waited 30 minutes called the office again to be told room service wasn't even on property that they would transfer me to the restaurant that does the room service they transferred me to the wrong restaurant after placing a large order realizing the mixup and hour later and even more hungry.... Everything was amazing but definitely go to Ralph's the grocery store across the street to be prepared food wise or plan on eating out. The office should've told me and other guests room service was a separate venue when I checked in. Again other than that everything was amazing and the manager Matt I believe it was super nice.

I was not impressed with my stay this week.  I realize I booked through a discount third party site. However we still spent a decent amount of money to sleep in a dark box and paid $27 a night for parking. I did not expect an ocean view whatsoever but what we got was a tiny room with very small beds that barely fit 2 people and were not very comfortable.    Our small window did not stay open unless we put the trash can up to prop it up. I was so depressing sitting in there. I figured all of the rooms are nice but some have better views.  Definitely not the case!!! There was blood on the bathroom door, the TV remote worked sometimes, the TV volume is very quiet and can't be adjusted, and at 6am our alarm went off (that we never set) as well as the alarm in the empty room next door.         We spent most of our night at the Deck next door which was amazing, the only highlight to this hotel is the location.  I will never stay at this location again.

Pretty expensive hotel for a really crummy stay. Yes it's old but you can make old comfortable and nice, they don't though. Shower heads are cheap and poor pressure, beds are cheap and pillows flat. It just feels like a cheaply done hotel with little regard to comfort and customer service. Would not recommend staying here.

I read lots of reviews and took a lot of them into account when booking my room and it was worth it!! We scored! Oceanfront, top floor and newly redesigned rooms! I thought it might get noisy at night w the Deck restaurant/bar being so close to the room but everything got quiet around midnight so not a big deal. Granted this isn't peak season but all we wanted was time away and the sound of the ocean... Everything else was a perk! The staff was super friendly and helpful. The area is so gorgeous and so much to take in... The rooms are fantastic for what we were looking for! Ask for room 701!! ;)

You can't beat the location. Waterfront and right next to multiple restaurants and little shops. Yet the general feel of the hotel is a bit funky. Very outdated. He pool and general areas are in need of major renovation. The worst part though, their major asset, the beach was completely destroyed due to a massive erosion from the last storm. No sand, just large stones. Even with low tide it's dangerous to walk by the hotel. No towels, no umbrellas. What a loss! Spoiled vacation for us and for many people coming to this hotel in the near future.

Wow, I wish I would have paid attention to the Yelp comment about parking. We were thrilled to get two rooms last minute for the 4th of July and didn't expect much for the price. Great hotel location for Laguna (thus 2 stars) but the rooms are small, bathrooms even smaller and the beds, yikes. The decor is cute, but really doesn't cover up the negative. Then to leave this place the next day, our car took over 45 minutes to get from valet. We approached someone who looked like a manager after 30 minutes with no apology and a dumbfounded look, he disappeared with no explanation, 15 or so more minutes someone comes to us and says it was already brought to the front, which is where we were still waiting and nope not one of the 3 cars in front of us. So, that guy says ok, he'll get it..hmm, then low and behold someone else brings it up as the other guy walks away. The guy never apologized or even looked me in the eye when handing me the keys and never offering to help with bags. So, when I get home, what do I see - huge scrapes along the entire front grill. I guess I know what was taking so long and why the manager looking guy disappeared. Such a bummer.

We started off in the "Bahia wing, room 3". This room was some where between the ENDLESS SUMMER and the BATES MOTEL.  Heavy stain on the pull out bed, dirty carpet and a 3/4 bath:(. We complained and got out our wallets, and got moved to room 704.  Top floor beach front!  Beautiful View.  Now we thought the family get away was back on track. We got back from dinner that night and discovered the TV was on the fritz.  No sweat we have an ocean view!  Morning came and we discovered we only had hot water!  We ended up showering in another room:( and the topper, THEY FORGOT TO PUT COFFEE IN OUR ROOM!  The only reason I gave it a star was for the view:)Went to management and they compt the room plus gave us another night free!  The seconds and the third star for the management:)

I wish I could give this place zero stars. Short story: the valet took my Lexus convertible for an 80 mile joy ride. Long story: we needed to leave early in the morning, we woke up and were ready to go by 8 o'clock. We gave our valet ticket to the front desk at check-out and waited...they brought up someone else's car. We informed them that it was not our car, and gave a description of our car. They told us that we were at fault for giving them the wrong valet ticket as if we had more than one - the one they gave us when we dropped off the car. After searching for our car for 15 minutes, we decided to go help search. We discovere that our car was there, but they had "lost" the keys. The valet on hand at the time, Drew, blamed us saying that we must have taken the car out the previous night. We were very clear that we never took our car out from the moment we dropped it at valet. Drew asked us to wait until 9:00 to speak to his manager, Jordan, who he had on the phone. When we asked to speak to his manager Jordan, he refused to allow us to speak to him. After throwing a hissy fit, Drew called Jordan back and spoke to him furtively around the corner - then he allowed us to speak to Jordan. Jordan again asked us to wait until 9:00 to resolve the matter - we didn't see how waiting would make our key magically appear especially given our time constraints. After promising to get us a cab, we went to wait for the cab. We waited quite a while...until 9:10 am at which point Drew showed up with our car keys - acting as if he had miraculously found them. When we asked where he found them, he would not disclose that information. We were so happy to have our keys that we just decided to leave - considering we were an hour behind our scheduled departure. When we turned our car on, we noticed that our gas tank was above the full mark - when we arrived at the hotel it was half full. Additionally, we had just taken note of the milage the day we dropped the car off and were able to calculate that the valet had put an additional 80 miles on our car. When confronted, they gave us blank stares. The hotel itself is not the cleanest, it is not exactly what it appears to be online. They only provide you with 2 towels, mediocre service, and the rooms are on an alleyway right above the valet station so you listen to people picking up their cars all night long while trying to sleep. Most importantly they are not to be trusted.

I'm updating my review because I've had a few days to cool down.Walls are paper thin, beds are not very comfortable, you can hear people outside, etc.  We have a door in the back that we can't open with bright lights shining in and you can hear people talking.  There's no bathtub ( the description on hotels.com clearly says they have a bathtub/shower combo ) and the valet isn't really optional, we were just told we had to use valet.I do have to say though, I left EVERYTHING in my room somehow and they not only found it but it got it shipped out to me in a few days so I really appreciate that.

I stayed there many years ago for Valentine's Day but never got around to writing a review.   I had called ahead to make sure everything was set for my first Valentine's Day with my girlfriend (now wife).  The lady on the phone confirmed I was booked in a room with an ocean view and a kitchen.  We arrived at sunset and entered our room to find no kitchen.  I went to the front desk and they wouldn't admit they screwed up or fix the problem because they were all booked.  I wasn't very happy since I couldn't very well cook the dinner I had planned in the room.pick another place...trust me.

We stayed at this hotel based on the pictures shown. First of all, the pictures don't show their ghetto section which is where we got stuck with. The furniture and pillows shown in the pics are new and nice, unlike what's in the rooms. The only items missing were cockroaches, dead bodies and crack cocaine. The pictures show a completely different picture than what it really is. We were completely disappointed and when we expressed our dissatisfaction, they move us to another room in the same old, ghetto section. This room only had 1 queen size bed. We have 5 people. They provided a roll a bed which was a box spring without a mattress. We should have stayed home. You couldn't pay me to stay there again. The only reason I'm giving it a one star is because it won't allow me to give it negative stars.

Updated Review:Pacific Edge did not disappoint. Per my review below before arriving I was nervous about our stay. But once I got there my mind was put at ease. -Oceanfront Room in the Reef building. the view- WOW. I mean, it seriously cannot get any better. My first time in Laguna Beach and I totally fell in love with this area. The water is beautiful - and being able to hear the crashing waves from your room was incredible. We watched the sunset from our balcony/ drinking wine and it was very memorable. I wanted to freeze time. I can't speak for the other rooms but I truly think this is the way to go. So worth it. -The room was upgraded - and I liked the touches added. Again, the property is not "new" - it is older and renovated and knowing that, I felt accommodations were comfortable, clean & maintained. So you need to come in with the right expectations.-The staff is all very helpful & friendly -The private beach area is nice where they provide beach towels and chairs, it was fun watching the surfers-I loved that it is walking distance to all the shops. We went for a stroll in the evening, there is a Ralph's & Whole Foods close by. The hotel partners with certain shops and we got a discount from Quiksilver because we were staying at Pacific Edge. Awesome!-Ate at Driftwood and it was all very delicious. Didn't get a chance to try the Deck. But both restaurants are also on the water. -The decor was cute & beachy. Overall, I would def. stay here again!Will be there next week - and hoping to increase the rating. There are mixed reviews on here - so I am a bit apprehensive but also hopeful!  My husband and I have never been to Laguna Beach - this is our first time, so seeing the area and accommodations with fresh eyes! The oceanfront room really looked like the way to go so we are staying in on of those. (reef building, i believe). I was tossed up with which building because from traveler's photos the surf rooms looked more modern/better upgraded but they are closer to the restaurant and over the bungalows so possibly more noise...hopefully the Reef rooms have the same upgraded touches and also from what I read, crossing fingers our room is renovated. Andrea helped me on the phone to book my room- and she was very sweet & helpful! So far so good! :) Will update with more details after my stay!

Stayed in a reef room on Sat April 25 and checked out on Sunday April 26, 2015. The front desk staff was very friendly and inviting. We had booked our room online and this was the first time that we had stayed here. I booked a king room , room 103. The views were amazing. The deck with crashing waves just right outside your door. They had coffee and refrig. The rooms were nice, older but still amazing. We had to valet our car which we do not mind. They were super cool as we left several times during the day as we had events to attend. We also had our little yorkie with us who is very used to staying in hotel rooms when we go places. We brought his crate with us. We were excited to have him join us in our stay and we walked on the beach together.We did not use any of the beach chairs as we did not stay long Sunday. The deck opens up at 11 and we had an amazing server . They are not dog friendly but we just left our dog in the car as it was in the shade and cooler outside. This is the only thing I wish they would be okay with is having maybe a dog policy of maybe a certain size and well behaved to be able to go down to the deck. The food at the deck was amazing. We had mussels and clams, their hamburger and chips. We had a couple bloody marys to end our morning. The service was excellent and no issues with any part of our stay.We will definitely be back for sure. We got a really good deal on our room as well. Thank you for such a great stay.

We just celebrated our daughter's 16th birthday at Pacific Edge Hotel and were treated very well by every member of the staff.  Akiko, from the front desk, took me to three different rooms before I booked to see which room would best accomodate our guests and patiently answered all of my questions.  The suite was even ready for us before check in time so we were able to settle in before the beach party began.  When we returned to the room several hours later, there were cupcakes and a birthday card wishing happy birthday.  What a sweet, personal touch that was definately appreciated.Bryan also worked the front desk and made sure the girls were having a good time.  He patiently hooked up my daughter's iPhone to the sound system in the pool area so that the girls could listen to music while enjoying the big jacuzzi.  Bryan was very personable and just an all-around great guy.The valets were super helpful and friendly. We made multiple trips to our car and they were always ready to help us load and unload.The beach worker brought us plenty of chairs and made sure we had everything we needed.  He was friendly and a hard worker.The hotel is not a chain hotel.  It's in Laguna and feels like Laguna.  There's color and peronality and no sense of a corporate vibe.  Plus it's right on the beach.  I would come here again and again if we didn't live 15 minutes away.  The girls loved it and plan to return for more parties in the future.Great job, guys!!!

We were mainly happy with our stay. The location is great. The customer service was great, from the front desk to the beach workers to the valet guy. All very nice and helpful! The hotel beach was a bit disappointing. Pretty small strip of sand for all of the customers of the hotel. Chairs are pretty much crammed in rows. We stayed in a room facing the road. Pretty loud but mostly ok due to air conditioner blocking it out. Pool in front is nice, but again, lots of road noise. The room itself was nice, no frills type. We thought it was clean and comfortable. Not luxurious by any stretch but perfectly fine. The $27 valet parking fee is expensive for sure. But we'd stay here again mainly due to location and great staff.

Came here as a weekend getaway with the GF for our anniversary. I called for early check-in and mentioned it was my anniversary. They proceeded to upgrade us to their best suite which overlooks the ocean and has a 'cottage feel'. It was fantastic. A separate guest room, and a fireplace in the guest room, the main room, and our bathroom. Skylight in the showers.The food at the deck is also very tasty. Would stay again.

This Hotel is overpriced and has rooms that are not heated. I booked a stay over Halloween and upgraded to an Ocean Front Room. The hotel is old and in need of major work to rooms.  I booked a two night stay over New Years Eve.  Cancelled second night due to NO HEAT in Room 21. I called Front Desk to ask about heat and was told to check the thermostat in the room. There is NO THERMOSTAT... THERE IS NO HEATER. Only a room air conditioner ... They sent a portable heater( Kmart Special) 8 inch heater to heat the room. Only half the double bed received heat. I cannot believe we paid $200.00 for an FREEZING COLD ROOM .BEWARE WHERE YOU STAY

We stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel this past weekend.  The lobby was beautiful, bummed that we had to pay for parking just to stay overnight.  However, this was my first experience of staying at a place where you can hear the ocean waves come in throughout the night and first thing as you woke up in the morning.  Talk about being able to just relax and enjoy the moment.The rooms were a bit outdated especially for as much as the hotel rooms go for on the ocean front.  They come with their own refrigerator and small keurig.  The rooms are brightly colored with yellows and blues on the wall, and they have these adorable adirondeck chairs on the patios that overlook the ocean.  i made sure to check out the cabana areas and these look like a great place to host a party.  A place to eat food while others played out on the beach all day.  Definitely a good idea. And many people recommended the Deck restaurant that is part of the hotel.  Although we didn't go there, however, with your room key you receive 20% off breakfast and 10% off dinner.I do need to call the hotel to discuss my charge though.  I was told at checkout valet would be added.  I read the signs and was expecting 24 dollars, except 50 dollars was charged instead.

I live locally but I decided that I needed to get away for the weekend and I because I love Laguna Beach so much, I chose to stay at Pacific Edge. I didn't do my research before I booked the room but all I cared about at the time was getting away to relax. If you drive, you need to keep in mind that they have valet parking only and it's like $20.00 a day. I didn't drive but I did get a chance to meet a few of the valet guys when I stopped to ask them about good places to eat. They were friendly and helpful!The staff at the front desk were very welcoming and full of smiles. I got to my room and there was an issue with a flickering light in the bathroom but someone came in to fix it. Okay, he actually took the light out which was fine with me because it was too bright anyway, so I was left with the dimmer light in the bathroom. It worked!The maids are FABULOUS and so over the top accommodating (although head of housekeeping needs to get their act together)! Make sure you tip them. :)Now for the not so good stuff- My room was dirty. The walls had grime on them and there were dust bunnies in the corners. I had to clean my bathtub before I was able to use it. This is ridiculous but that tells me that while housekeeping is great in every other aspect, whoever might be in charge of that department, needs to check the condition of the rooms. The furniture is outdated and dirty as well. It would be very easy to call in all your housekeepers for a day and wash down the walls. Do this once a month and the problem would be solved. The restaurants on the property are okay but expensive because you have a view of the ocean while you eat. I ate there a few times but they are not gluten free friendly, so I had to venture downtown to find food. However, if you do eat there try the grilled artichoke- it is out of this world!! The noise level at night was insane and out of control and this was AFTER I put my ear plugs in. Come on management, don't tell me that you don't hear all the screaming and running up and down the stairs! Go out there and tell them to knock it off, especially after midnight. Would I stay here again? Meh, I'm not sure but to be honest, it's only because of how dirty my room was. I require a clean space and instead, I had to wipe things down. I loved that I was able to run on the beach in the morning and that there were so many shops and dining places just a few blocks away.

Our first experience was admittedly less than great, because their WiFi was completely down all weekend. BUT this was almost 2 years ago, and they have since upgraded their system and all was well. (The only reason I can't give 5-stars now is because some of their standard rooms without any views are quite average, but go get an Oceanfront Room, and boy are you in for a treat!)In fact they get very high praise from us because the manager without hesitation almost 2 years later not only honored the chance to make it up to us, but went above an beyond. We were pampered to an absolutely gorgeous 2-night stay in a view that is literally overlooking the ocean. You can hear and practically feel every crash of the waves, the seagulls visit the cute balcony, and it was otherwise silent and serene and beautiful. The room was clean and a good size, the entire staff was friendly and helpful. In fact even the valet guy was great, he seemed to tirelessly work every shift day and night we needed our car, with a smile on his face. We enjoyed a few dips in the Jacuzzi, and walking around the neighborhood and the fun stores as this is right in the middle of where you want to be in Laguna Beach.Definitely a place we look forward to visiting again!

I've only been to the bungalows here (right next to The Deck), but the view is breathtaking! You're literally just steps away from the beach, which is really amazing - you get to breathe in all the fresh ocean air, watch the sunsets, and enjoy the open panoramic views! It's truly magnificent!!! You can rent a private bungalow for the day, which is basically a decorated living space with a snack bar, bathroom, couches to lounge in, etc. Each bungalow has a different decor theme - and they all lead out to the deck, which has umbrellas, tables and lounge chairs. Well worth the money (though it's pricey - hence, the three stars) to rent a bungalow if you want to have a fun and private little day gathering right on the beach, while still having easy access to both an indoor and outdoor lounge space for hanging out. They offer valet parking here, which isn't cheap by any means...but at least it's convenient!

I would go again.  We had 8 adults and 2 children in 4 rooms in the recently remodeled Surf Wing.  Everyone there was nice and accommodating.  They comped one of the rooms when 1/2 the electricity including the AC went out one night.  The room was clean and beachy.  The deck was marvelous.  The bathroom was small, but hey, it's an older hotel and we didn't spend a whole lot of time there.  Overall, I was pleased and would like to go back this winter for a staycation with my hubby. #pacificedge #lagunabeachhotel #lulledbythewaves

These photos must be from another hotel.I have one word..."RENOVATION". There must have been an inch separation between the bottom of the front door to my room and the threshold.....my first sign. The rest doesn't even matter.I was scared.I could hear the crashing waves outside my lanai but couldnt see the ocean...how cruel!....suffering

This year we decided that we would hit up Laguna Beach for my birthday.Pacific Edge was one of the lesser expensive hotels that was right on the beach.  We wanted a suite but they were sold out but they offered to give us an adjoining room.  One with a double queen overlooking the pool and a king overlooking the ocean.When we arrived we were greeted by Javid and he was a total sweetheart.  Our rooms weren't available yet so he gave us pool keys so we could get towels and instructed us how to get to the beach. He also alerted the hotel staff that we were there to expedite our room cleaning.  The hotel is literally right on the beach.  It was awesome.  The cabana boys grabbed us some chairs and got us all set up on the beach.  the water was freezing but it was crispy hot outside and we chilled listening to the tunes coming from the beach house.  It was a lovely day.We hit up the Beach House for lunch.  The service was a tad slow in the beginning I think they were changing over waiter shifts.  but the food was decent and reasonably priced.The hotel contacted us to let us know our room was ready and we checked in and got to our rooms.  ok.....The rooms were a bit on the janky side.  We were in the suite directly above the restaurant and it was LOUD!  In the king room there was a full sized fridge and it was rusted out and totally gross.  It looked like they founds this refrigerator on the street and put it in the room.  Hand to god.   If I was staying for more than one night I probably would have asked to be switched.  That being said, I can't say enough about how nice everyone at the hotel was.  The noise didn't end up bothering me as much as I thought it would and Javid's service as well as everyone else there really made it worth it at the end of the day.  I hope next time we can get a nicer room but if you are looking to just be on the beach and have a great experience I would definitely recommend this hotel.  If you are used to much classier places, I do hear that some of the rooms are nicer so maybe just see if you can get one of those but we had a great time.

Such a great location.  Such a weird experience.  Now I've stayed in some "not so nice" hotels - especially at the beach.  I've also stayed at boutique hotels.  I  can say I have never had the unique experience I had here. Ok, $20 for valet.  That's cool, whatevs - maybe this is indicative of a nice place in Laguna Beach. Check-in is cute, kind of a kitschy nantuckety thing happening there.  Well, that's unusual the elevator is broken with a trash can in front of it, don't need it anyway...up the stairs we go.  Man, it's been a long drive from Anaheim - kind of Ikea-ish up here, reminds me of that one place we stayed in London.....lalalalala....think I'll use the bathroom - HOLY PUBIC HAIRS ALL OVER THE FLOOR, BATMAN!  Eck! Think I'll take a seat and chillax on the sofa, maybe take the edge off of the whole wayward hair fiasco - what the what? Is that seriously a Cheerio and a candy bar wrapper? Guess we were really getting a favor by being able to check in on-time.  I need some air, man.  Think I'll go sit out on the balcony.  Ah, this is nice.  Could've sprung for a better view but....what is that?  Wait, ohhhhhhhhh! THAT'S what I am looking at. I guess THAT'S how you roll at this place.  So happy that super special couple was experiencing the joy of life together, in full splendor, for everyone to enjoy. Meanwhile, I need a scalding hot shower, five cocktails and a different hotel.  Later gator!  Oh and thanks for making things right by giving us half off and having the housekeeper, you know - clean the room....um, yes.

We booked one night last minute for our anniversary, and they really took care of us! Everyone was so nice and accommodating - Bryan made sure that we had an ocean view room for a good price! It was lovely to fall asleep to the sound of the surf and wake up to watch the sun rise over the Pacific! We had a late dinner in their restaurant (The Deck), where we had really good service - the staff was all very nice and attentive. We had burgers (great) and had no issues getting a table (it was the night before Thanksgiving, so that might be why it was so open). Our room was super bright and cheerful! While the rooms/halls aren't super posh, we liked them just fine. :-) The hotel does have you pay for valet, but you can park on the street if you want to save - you just have to be up early to move the car/pay meters. It's very close to the main strip of shopping/beach, so we were able to walk around a lot and go to breakfast in the morning without having to stress about getting back in time for check out. Overall, it was an awesome way to spend our anniversary, and we really appreciated that everyone made an effort to make us feel welcome!

I have stayed in a number of Joie de Vivre Hotel properties.  When a Living Social deal came up for this one I jumped on it.  The fact that it is right on the beach is a big selling point.  What's not to love, right?  Ok, so parking is valet only.  They suggest dropping off car, walking upstairs to the lobby, check in, find out where your room is, come all the way back down to get your bag and then hike back to your room.  Yeah, park in the tiny lot off PCH, walk right in to the lobby, check in, then go to valet.  We live locally so I tried to book my stay at the hotel itself; I literally walked in to the lobby.  2 front desk folk took over 10 minutes with 2 other guests before I get to the desk to find out they won't do that since it is a Living Social deal; I have to call the 800#.  Are you kidding me?  Why didn't they get on the damn phone and call it in for me?  Ok, so I book a pool view room.  Little did I think that meant a room facing PCH.  This is an old renovated motel.  The windows aren't insulated, the walls are thin; noise on PCH on a Saturday is loud all night.  They offer a check in gift of wine or sparkling water.  It was delivered sometime after 6 and was set out on the desk so that sparkling water was nice and warm instead of cooling in our fridge when we got back.  The walls were dinged and dirty looking.  The bathroom was hideous; there was a nice mold growth all along the tiles in the shower.  Between the noise from the cleaning crew's tv in the room behind us, the noise off the street and the gross shower I was apologizing for bringing my boyfriend here for what was supposed to be a birthday celebration staycation for me.  Had we stayed more than one night I would have marched up to the front desk (which is harrowing, uneven pathways, poorly lit event) and demanded a different room.  I'm a Joie de Vivre member and have always loved these places.  I filled out the guest satisfaction survey as well as sending an email to people at the hotel.  Heck, I even included photos of the mold.  Rafael Gutierrez, the hotel's front office supervisor sent me an email apologizing for my stay.  He said he was going to send me a gift certificate for another night's stay; this time in an ocean front room.  I thought that was great customer service.  Its been a few days and I haven't received the promised certificate.  I'll be sure to update this one way or the other.

Cute little hotel on the beach front in Laguna.  Location is great, walking distance to everything, so once you park you can just walk and forget about driving.  The beach services are real nice (complementary use of lounge chairs, towels and umbrellas) and it was lovely to hear the ocean as I slept in my room.  This hotel isn't a big fancy resort (like they try to make it look on their website).  Think of a older motel that had a recent facelift.  I'd give it more stars, but I was very disappointed when I checked in I was told I had to pay $20 A NIGHT to park my car.  This was no where on the website as I checked before booking the place.  For $180 a night for a super basic room you'd think it'd be included.  My other complaint  was that the staff was very noisy and woke me up around 8am everyday either talking loudy outside of my room or the maids blasting the radio as they cleaned adjoining rooms.  I wanna sleep in with no disturbances on a vacation, but that was impossible.

We found Pacific Edge Hotel by searching on Kayak and getting a quote from AMOMA.com  We searched the Huntington area, Newport but decided on Laguna Beach. It was a bit longer drive but well worth it. I do not think I have ever been so relaxed for just a weekend stay.

We love this place. I don't get all of the bad reviews. You are right, it's not a luxury hotel. It's a cheap boutique hotel. Ikea style furnishings.
