Love The Deck, great drinks and snacks.Everyone complains about the valet and the cost. I live in LA so I guess that isn't a big deal to me, the hotels here can be $30-60 for valet per day. Yes, it could be in a little better shape. They don't have a great attention to detail. Scuff marks, etc., on the walls here and there. The first time we stayed here we were SO nervous about the bad reviews, which I didn't see until after booking it, but we were SO pleasantly surprised. For the rates and the location, the beach and the umbrellas/chairs, beachfront bar and food, great staff, etc., it's a STEAL. We only stay here when we come to Laguna, going this weekend and expect an amazing trip as usual!

This hotel really deserves a zero star rating. We spent a week-end in Room 12, the two-bedroom apartment. The service at the front desk was incompetent (though pleasant) and the room looked like a run down Frat House. The worst aspect was the unsanitary condition of the unit.We arrived at 3pm, an hour before check-in. We were told they would put a "rush" on the cleaning of our room and call us when it was ready. 1 1/2 hours and 6 phone calls later, we finally entered Room 12. What a disaster!The following issues were immediately apparent (photos attached):1.   Greasy finger/handprints on walls and window frames.2.   Excessive chipped paint on walls.3.   Front door & frame w/chipped paint, jimmied frame plate, dented lock plate, flimsy lock.4.   Wall w/a BIG cut out of sheet rock that was completely unsealed.5.   Bathtub w/a quarter size chip in enamel......black and rusted. 6.   Washed bath towel w/blood stain.7.   Carpet pulled up and frayed in corners of rooms. 8.   Small, medium and large stains on carpet throughout unit.9.   Doors missing from closet in the bedroom w/2 twin beds.10. Filthy & scuffed white dresser is same room.11. Sofa in living room w/a huge tear in the upholstery on one arm. 12. Peeling and shredding outdoor carpet on balcony.13. Completely rusted air-conditioning unit on balcony/deck visible from inside.14. Pillows did not have liners under the pillowcases. My family is allergic to down pillows. When I removed the pillow case from a pillow in order to find the "materials" tag, I discovered a nauseating black stain that covered the entire corner of the pillow. I then removed the case from another pillow, and discovered mold. Once again, I called the front desk, explained about our allergies to down, and specifically requested four poly or cotton-fill pillows. It was like the people at the front desk did not process spoken language. The response, "I'll see what security can do." 10 minutes later, a security patrol showed up at our door with 3 pillows; only ONE was not down. Needless to say, we slept w/out pillows.15.  Valet area is also used as a SMOKING AREA.*16. The straw that broke the proverbial camel's back: While carrying my luggage into the bedroom w/the queen bed, barefoot, I stepped in the area between the end of the bed and dresser, and felt a pinch on the bottom of my foot. When I looked down and lifted up my foot, I saw that I had stepped on a man's large TOENAIL.....Absolutely disgusting!!!When I called the hotel directly to make the reservations, I should have been told about the location of the unit:1.   The balcony and one bedroom directly overlook the valet area. From morning until evening, we listened to the constant stream of car engines, opening and slamming of car doors, and voices (many intoxicated or on cell phones) generated from the VALET SERVICE.2.    The balcony and one bedroom also overlook a swimming pool. At one point in the afternoon, there were 17 teenagers (I counted) in the spa, and a group of intoxicated young women celebrating what looked to be a bachelorette week-end. 3.   The balcony and one bedroom also overlook the roof of the Driftwood Kitchen restaurant, including the up-drafts from inside the kitchen. From the time the restaurant opened in the morning until closing at night, we smelled every dish cooked in the kitchen, from bacon to fish, coming from the updrafts. 4.   Throughout the day and evening, the smell of people taking their smoking breaks near the Valet area was added to the food aromas. So much for the sounds and smells of the fresh salty ocean and breeze! This hotel is part of the Joie de Vivre Hotel Chain. I've been a JdV member for almost 10 years. We have stayed in numerous JdV hotels. We have always received friendly and knowledgeable service, and stayed in clean and well maintained rooms. But unfortunately, this hotel is a dilapidated health hazard with poor customer service. I wouldn't recommend the Pacific Edge Hotel to anyone.

Going on a beach vacation I would expect a peaceful, convenient, and laid back time.  Unfortunately, there weren't many perks to this stay...Here are the pluses to this hotel:great location, beach access, up to date furniture in lobby, and friendly staff.  Here is why I gave a poor review:a sleepless night, paper thin walls, repairs needed, and poor service.Repairs needed - First, our TV didn't work - the technician came during the night to try and fix it - ultimately had to replace the TV box.  We hurried to put something decent on so he could come in and fix it.  Poor Service - aka lack of creating a lasting impression - Next, if you want a wonderful time laying out on the beach, instead of listening to the crashing waves, you'll be hearing loud vacuums cleaning the rooms above you - Have some respect - close the doors.No one attended to us when we came down, so I grabbed us 2 lounge chairs to find a spot - these are not light either.  The lazy guy just sat there as he watched us.  Unbelievable!  A girl next to us was smoking.  Is this allowed at the beach - is there an area for smokers?   The Deck (restaurant) is really a pretty setting, however very crowded.  The hostess told us an hour -hour and a half wait - so we put in our names and went back to the room to change.  We got called early about 40 minutes - we weren't ready, but she did save our seat.  The waitress was busy, in fact the manager had to start us off after noticing weren't greeted for the first 10 minutes.  **Paper thin walls**Our neighbors were smoking on the balcony - which means the smoke was coming into our room.  If you have allergies - this could ruin your trip completely.  Security came and told them to stop.   - In addition, the same neighbors were fighting and talking really loud.  We had to call security again, just so we could get some sleep during the night.  We waited an hour to see if they would stop.  The most important reason for this 2 star is the noise level on the street.  I couldn't even take a nap because the loud cars were driving by  - including honks, a siren, and that's not including people passing our rooms.  This ruined our night completely, and we didn't get a chance to go out at night time because we were so drained from the sun, and we couldn't take a nap due to the noises. Maybe because we got the deal on travel zoo, that the people that stayed there weren't the classiest or considerate of their neighbors.  Or could it be the expectations are not too high here.  During checkout the front desk did take care of our extra taxes and said we could keep our car there longer.  This gave back an extra 1/2 star rating...In the end we were happier to leave the hotel and find a nice quiet beach with out the vacuum VROOM, VROOM noises, kids running around,  and smoke on the beach.  You can't compare this to a top notch hotel.  SO don't expect a lot.  I would however expect 3 strikes and you're out.  If a guest calls at least 3 times for 3 different valid reasons, some excellent quality service should have taken place - breakfast, upgrade, or something that shows "our standards are higher than what you have experienced."  Then maybe this review would've been a bit different.  I've stayed at many hotels - high end to bed and breakfast places - so I do have experience in this field.  This is not a quiet, secluded beach hotel, like the Surf and Sand Resort.  There is no comparison.  I spent my summers at this hotel growing up and was excited to try a new beach hotel in close proximity.  TIPS - if you do stay here - ask for a room closest to the beach and away from the street.  Check that everything is working in the room.  On the beach, try to go as far away from the rooms as possible, so you won't be bothered with cleaners and maintenance noises. Pools are not the best.  Don't expect a good night's rest.  Good luck!TIPS for hotel - serve cold refreshing water on the beach, not just the lobby.  Try to accommodate the rooms as best as possible, to an enjoyable stay if you have lots of rooms available, then a room closer to the beach would be more enjoyable.  Be aware of the noise level and let other workers keep it down - valet crew, maintenance, to even guest.  When a guest calls and complains about different occurrences, it would be a good idea to try and please them.  Would I stay here again?  I don't know- I don't like feeling like crap the next day due to lack of sleep from outside noises.  This would be my number one annoyance.

Surprised at all the terrible reviews of this place. My fiancé and I have stayed here twice and we loved it both times. We requested a room with a view of the water and they made it happen both times. It is amazing to be right on the water. We left the patio door open and fell asleep to the sound of the waves. I'm giving it four stars and not 5 because I called prior to getting there to request a bottle of champagne be placed in our room, to be there when we got there. They assured me it would be there and it wasn't. I called the front desk and told them it wasn't there and they brought over a bottle immediately. The staff at this place is helpful and we never had any issues with them. All in all this place is great. Like I mentioned, I was really surprised to read the bad reviews. If there are such issues, take it up with the manager while you're there. I'm sure the staff would do what it takes to make your stay better.
Get the bridal suite. It's worth it!!  You get the entire building to yourself. The room has two fireplaces

Reading the yelp reviews prior to arrival helped a lot with this property.  We booked an ocean front room for one night and mainly chose this hotel because it takes dogs.  Their website is pretty great, and the photos on here (posted by the hotel) look really nice.  The room itself is a little blah compared to what you see in their photos.  But being directly on the sand practically makes up for it.  The price you pay is high for a ocean front room, but comparatively speaking to other hotels it's less. We read that they were pet friendly so it was decided we'd take our dog with us for this overnight getaway.  Well online a statement from their manager says " Pets do have to be placed in a kennel if left alone in the room for the safety of the pet as well as the owner."  So we brought a crate with us.  But when you get there they say that you can't leave your pet unattended at any time.  This really conflicts with each other!  It even says on the statement they make you sign that if your pet is noisy YOU have to pay for the rooms of people that might complain or something scary like that.  Because of this, we didn't know what to do.  They did have some information about pet sitting, which we tried, but since we didn't know about this until we got there there was no hope of getting anyone to come by on short notice. In the end we ended up taking our dog home (luckily this was just a getaway weekend and we were within an hour of home and could do this).  I really think they need to put this policy on their website and not have conflicting policies online.  I wasn't about to pay for my neighbors' room in case my dog whined a bit when we left.  I mean I understand if she was barking or crazy noisy but that policy left it open to who knows what. The other problem was the shower.  It does that rotating temperature "feature" (haha) where it goes all the sudden cold and then back to hot.  This can be kind of dangerous because when it goes cold you tend to turn the knob to hot more, and then it comes back and you practically get burned. The elevator in our building was a little freaky too.  You feel like it's not moving and at least twice I thought I was stuck in the elevator and then all the sudden the door opens. Valet parking is $20 a night, but they say that upfront so I was prepared.  You do have "in/out" privileges so that was OK. Our sliding glass door wouldn't close without feeling like we were going to break it either.  We couldn't lock it if we had tried.  You can't checkout on the TV either, which I'm so used to everywhere else, so you have to stop at the office to leave.   Despite all of this, we ended up having a great time.  Sleeping to the sounds of the ocean is very soothing.  They have a pool, jacuzzi, and even table tennis as well.   The motel-like room was sufficient for what we needed but the price should really be lower than it is, despite the oceanfront address. If I could give this a half star, I'd probably make it 2 1/2, but that's about it.

This place is awesome! We stayed here for one night and got top notch service!! Luis was working that night and made sure that our stay was amazing! We got to take a look at the rooms, before we checked in, to pick which room we wanted. We got a bottle of wine and got upgraded for free since it was our first time there! Would definitely recommend this to anyone!

Since we paid a mere $60 for a one night stay, I can easily give this "hotel" 4 stars. It definitely needs some work though. Customer service at the front desk was excellent. The location is perfect. The room was clean and the toiletries smelled amazing. I appreciated the Donut Shop K cups in the room. We brought our dog and they didn't charge us any extra fees!However, the hotel needs a lot of work... the little fridge in the room looked like it was from 1985. The tiles in the shower were cracked and the bathtub chipped in several places. There was one towel rack - two would be ideal. The bathroom door was hard to close and the lock didn't work. The window in the bathroom needed a fresh coat of paint around it. The curtains in the room don't go with the light green and blue walls (they're a shiny brown). The jacuzzi was closed for renovations. Parking on site is $20 a day - ouch. None of these are huge concerns of mine, just suggestions for improvement. I would most definitely stay here again because the price was right, it was clean, centrally located, and the staff was friendly. I believe it will continue to improve. We didn't have an ocean view room, so I think that would be better for our next visit.

I could not have been more disappointed then our stay this last weekend (checked in Saturday March 19- checkout Sunday March 20).  When I booked this room for $ 400.00 for 1 night - I expected the accommodations to align with the hotel description.  I am shocked this hotel has the audacity to charge $ 400/night for this room.  Even if on a Saturday evening in March.  Paint peeling, chipped concrete, valet w/o any offer to assist with baggage.  The smell of sewage as we approached our room and that remained throughout our stay.  The room was exceedingly small, the carpet and furnishings certainly did not look high end.  The 5.00 Ikea lamps are a good indicator of the lack of quality of the furnishings.  The room had no ventilation, was very warm and stuffy.  The balcony and view were nice, although again - chipped/peeling paint was prevalent.  the room next to us - their AC is on our balcony, although only March - because of lacking room ventilation - they had their AC running which certainly did not add to the enjoyment for us of our balcony.  We often stay at boutique hotels, and have stayed a LDV hotels in the past.  This was a huge disappointment - what was a splurge for a special evening - was very disappointing.  Staff were nice at check-in.

Luis was amazing  nicest guy ever even helped us with a bottle of champagne! Showed us each room and upgraded us with no problem! The room was so nice and clean and the view was spectacular! I would recommend this place to anyone. Staff was great and the overall experience was stress free. Can't wait to come back

I stayed here, along with plenty other family and friends as my sister got married down the street.  I had the opportunity to visit half a dozen rooms.  During the time I was there they were halfway done remodeling some of the rooms and the untouched rooms were pretty sad.  The remodeled rooms however were fantastic.  The location of the hotel is great, right on the ocean, with their own beach that has a couple employees that bring you towels, longboards, etc.  The restaurants and bars inside the hotel were always fun as well.  The penthouse suite that my sister (the bride) stayed in was amazing with tasteful finishes, breathtaking views, and ample space to throw a party.  Overall I'd give my room 3 stars but the renovated rooms would get 4.5.

THE LOCATION WAS AMAZING! Stairs lead right down to the sand. I stayed in the Reef Tower I believe, in room 104 and from my bed with the curtains open I was able to relax and watch the sunset no problem :) AMAZING BATHTUB, best part of the room besides the view. They are also across the street from one of my favorite places to eat in Laguna Beach, Taco Loco. Literally right across the street. This hotel is also right near all the shops and restaurants, so it will never take you more than 5 minutes to get somewhere to eat, enjoy a good drink or shop. The staff was pretty good too, the young blonde that checked me in was sweet and gave me all the info I needed to know. They have valet parking and allow you easy access to your car during their business hours.So really the main issue with this place is the rooms, even though they were able to offer a view of the water from my room, the room itself needs work done and lots of updating. The paint color, was uuuggghh, dull yellows and bright blues with ugly floral patterns. The bathroom needed some major updating as well, idk what "decor" the mirror was supposed to have, but it just looked more like cracked, stained glass? tile was falling off under the sink and the cabinet doors and drawers were also broken and slightly falling off as well. I've slept in waaay comfier beds before too and rooms that felt a lot cleaner. Small tv, which yes I understand the beach is outside, so why would I care about the tv size.. I still like to enjoy a movie while hanging out late at night. Not trying to sound like a complainer, I just think the insides of the rooms could use updating and would make this hotel almost 5 stars. I just know that I like to come back to a hotel room that kind of feels like home for the time being, and I didn't feel that too much here. I think until I hear about some fixing up, I'll pay the extra $20 to stay somewhere a little more updated that's also on the water.

When we booked the Pacific Edge we expected the same customer service that we received at the Dream Inn in Santa Cruz. Same type of property. We were right. Customer Service was excellent!! The reason that I rated this property 3 stars was that we stayed in the apartment number 12 and the amenities were scarce. 3 forks, microwave handle was missing....it also seemed that the local teenagers knew how to access the pool and property without the signature wrist bands, identifying us as staying at the hotel. At any rate for the cost, great customer service and close proximity to Main beach our kids and us had a great time. We can't wait to check out the updated renovations next year!

This hotel has an incredible location, right on the beach. We paid up for a king surf room with a balcony and it was totally worth it. Incredible views, surf sounds in your room, sunset views..the works. Make no mistake, this is a motel like place which has been given a facelift. Don't expect fancy fittings and amenities but once you have an beachfront room, it really does not make much of an incremental difference if you are staying here at under $200 or at other beachfront properties at $400-600+. BTW when we checked in, they were kind enough to suggest a better room than the one we booked as it had a second exposure / corner view as well. We'll definitely be back.

Apropos name since it's right at the edge of the water.   We stayed in the Reef section of the hotel in September 2013.  Friend won it at a silent auction.  The room was very comfortable and spacious with an upbeat beachy decor.  The view was amazing and I loved the way the balconies were staggered for privacy.  So relaxing to hear the waves and wind!  Private beach with super nice attendants who give you towels and set up lounge chairs/umbrellas.  Parking is expensive.  Great location.  Walking distance to a couple little markets as well as tons of restaurants.  One big plus is the entire hotel property is non-smoking and they enforce it.  The guest next door was smoking on her balcony and it was horrible to smell in our room and on our balcony.  We called the front desk and they called her and told her to stop, which she did.  So nice when places actually enforce non-smoking!

My husband and I came here for anniversary/staycation. We got a deal online for an oceanfront room.  It's so great!  The reviews on here had us a little worried, but we took a chance anyway given the proximity to the beach. It's so much better than what we expected! People, it's beach worn!  With constant moisture from the water, chipped paint happens! The room we got looked like it had been recently repainted.  Very nice!  The room was spacious, comparable to any other hotel. But THE VIEW!!!!  Oh my goodness, we were in heaven!!  And falling asleep to the sound of the surf is just so amazing and relaxing.  Also, you're only a 5 minute walk from all the restaurants and shops in Laguna Beach.  We will definitely be back!

I didn't check Yelp before booking this hotel (I typically do check Yelp before any bookings).  I am shocked this hotel got less than 5 stars by anyone.  I honestly received the best service I have ever experienced at any hotel here.  My husband and I celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary and brought our dog with us.  The staff here was incredible.  The room was small but cozy.  The view was incredible, free dog friendly beach, walking distance to everything we needed, free internet access, nice flat screen TV, comfy beds, etc... this place rocks!

This was the first time my gf and I stayed at this place on a whim and wow...I was impressed.  Very reasonably priced hotel and right on the beach!  Comfy simple rooms with a dinette even!  I must say the most refreshing thing was the customer service at this establishment.  Everyone one from the front desk to the cleaning ladies were super helpful and friendly.  Definitely coming back in the near future!

love this place! The location is the best.   Right on the water and within walking distance of restaurants, bars, and shops.  And of course right on the beach.  The rooms are nice, nothing fancy but very comfortable.The big plus is the staff.  Everyone is professional, courteous, helpful and friendly.  Front desk personnel are engaging and always have time to answer your questions,  The night crew, Luis and Stacie, were delightful.  A special shout out goes to Ben, who works down on the beach.  He has the unenviable tsk of getting the chairs, towels, etc. for the guests to relax on the beach.  We really enjoyed his happy demeanor and attentiveness when we showed up each morning to stake out our little spot of land on the beach.It's hard to think of staying anywhere else when we go to Laguna.  We highly recommend the Pacific Edge to everyone looking for a stress free and relaxing beach getaway

Overall I was happy with this hotel but there is lots of room for improvements.  This is an older hotel and has been semi-remodeled.  Rooms were clean but very small, THIN walls!  The pool areas are outdated but clean.  The main reason to stay here is the location and restaurants!  The food from the Deck and Driftwood was excellent.  Both are popular places and very crowded, but being a guest can help get you a table.  The beach is beautiful, clean and not too crowded.  The hotel offers chairs, towels and umbrellas at no extra fee and has clean, close restrooms available.  Lots of close shops and restaurants to walk to, very relaxing!  Staff was great and accommodating.

I had a great time at the Pacific Edge hotel! There is great beach service! Cameron was extremely nice and accommodating for our vacation. I have never felt compelled to write a review before, however I felt this hotel deserved the recognition.

My husband and I were looking for a romantic one-night get away for Valentine's day with one catch...  it needed to be dog friendly!  This place was perfect on paper!We got there and the staff was awesome.  We checked into our room, it wasn't perfect, but it worked!  The kitchen area wasn't the best but it did the job of letting us create a romantic dinner.  There's only a short walk to the beach and we loved the fact that our dog was able to roam around on the sand.My only disappointment was I was looking forward to sleeping with the sliding door open.  I LOVE hearing the water!  That's what I was paying for...  but to my disappointment at 11pm a loud live band started to play which seemed to be right outside my sliding door.  No one relaxing, paying a lot of money wants that surprise!!!  Live music killed the romantic atmosphere because now we had to close the sliding door and sleep in a stuffy room.  It did have a window a/c but it was way too small for the room.  On top of the live loud music upsetting us, it upset my dog.  He barked a few times and was very upset.  My dog never barks.  And that is what keeps me from giving 4 stars.  In all reality, if I could, would give it 3.5 stars.

FIRST BAD REVIEW IVE WRITTEN. Awful place. Horrible customer service. Walls dirty. Too bad bc it's a great location. Air and tv kept turning off bc of a breaker shared by two rooms- lame. I asked to move rooms but they said they were full so I couldn't move plus my window is screwed shut so I cannot even open the window. Asian woman at the front desk is rude. Never stay here again. U would b better off at the Holiday Inn. It's clean and the air and tv work.

i don't even know where to start, i had such a great experience from start to finish! amazing customer service, and i was blown away with the best views from the room's balcony. best sleep i've had in so long because the ocean wave sounds were so close to your room. clean, comfortable, easy to find. highly recommend!
Reasonably priced hotel. Great location. Rooms could use a little updating and more king sized bed options.

I and some friends/clients stayed at this hotel the night before our planned deep sea fishing trip out of Dana Point Warf. We arrived on a Thursday 09/03/2015. The next day 09/03/15, when I went to the front desk to get some change and my car; the clerk, Mathew, called the valet guy, Santos, who took a long time, because he didn't have his Walky Talky in hand to be reached. Needless to say this delayed us a bit. Anyhow, it was really early, we are running a bit behind so we left. When we arrived to Dana Point; I realize I didn't have my key because when I turn off the car and tried to turn it back on, it didn't and the dash board showed NO KEY. I drive a keyless G37 2013 Infinity, which you can actually drive without a key. I called the front desk clerk at the Edge Water Hotel 4 times to ask him to PLEASE contact the valet guy for my keys. The 1st 3 times I called this guy Mathew kept on asking me what was the matter. By the 4th time, They told me the keys were given to my friend who was actually standing by the front of the hotel. I asked my friend whom I have j own for 20 years and he told me the valet guy NEVER gave me any keys. By this time, other people in our crew started to take everything out of my car to find the damn key. There was no key in my car. So, my friend and I told the rest of the group to go on with out us, as I could not leave my car unattended with the window down for 12 hours. So we TOTALLY missed out on our trip I planned for weeks. Took a taxi back to the hotel. Nobody had a clue about anything. I spoke to the valet guy Santos and he told me he gave the key to my friend. I asked him how come he didn't give it to me since I was the one driving, and his reply was that because he was getting in the passenger seat he figured it was ok to do so. Not cool, I have never experienced this when the valet gives the key to the passenger, it is ALWAYS given to me. Anyhow, I went to complain again and the kids at the front desk made me go over the entire situation again as the other kid, Mathew, who was well aware of everything didn't care to report the issue to his peers. I'm frustrated and still no answers. So I went to my room to shower, and the valet guy Santos knocked on our room door and my friend opened the door. Santos went to tell him that the car would have made a noise if we were to drive away from the key, however, the car was already running when I got into it. Then Santos went to tell him he gave him the key, and my friend told him he was out of line saying that as he didn't he ANY key from him. After I showered, I went back out side and decide to walk up and down PCH to see if in deed the key was place somewhere on the hood or roof. I found nothing. Totally frustrated at the waste of time, energy and money; I went back to the hotel to ask the kids again what to do. Everyone washed their hands and turned me on to some guy named Miles whom I have never met before. Miles is the owner of the valet service. He was really nice, and told me that his employee swears he gave us the key. He offered to pay for uber to go back to my car and search for the keys again, so before I left, I asked the kids at the front desk to check on the video recorded while this incident happened between 4:00 am and 4:25 am. Some young lady told me she would take care of reviewing the video and after 20 minutes of me waiting she came back to tell me their cameras didn't reach the FRONT OF THE HOTEL  so they couldn't tell. So at this point is our word agains their valet guy's word who never handed me my key. So, I figured the staff at this hotel nor the owner of the valet service were going to accommodate me for the lost key and so I called my wife who would have to drive an hour from our home to bring me my spare key. I also had to request from one of the kids at this hotel to give me some sort of form to file this incident. What I find funny is that no one offered it to me before and I actually had to requested. Very strange. Later, I decided to go back to Dana Point, paid my own uber, stripped my car again and found nothing. Called the valet service owner and ask him what to do. He said he would try to get me a key through his insurance but it would be very unlikely to do so. WOW! What to do? My poor wife finally arrived, gave me the spare key and my friend and I proceeded to test it out and see if in deed the car made any noise or signal as we drove away from the key. So I stabbed my key, started the car, gave the key to my friend who was standing outside the car, a small two beep noise went off and then I proceeded to drive away and there was no other warning. We tried this 3 different times. So obviously we are pretty pist off at this time because we realize my key in deed was NEVER given to me. Call the Miles guy again. He called me back left a message and told me he called  my dealership and blah blah and the car should of made some sort of sound or signal.
Not really worth my money and time. The room was old and out-dated. Even with an ocean-view, not the best deal in the area. It is centrally located. We will not be going back.

I will agree that this is more of a large scale motel.. But it wasn't a bad place.  I went here through a deal I bought on Bloomspot.  I got an oceanview room for about 150.  I loved the view. Not sure i would have been happy had I not purchased the ocean view room.  My room was right by the pool and jacuzzi which I liked.  (And the jacuzzi was huge). I was also above the patio at the restaurant.  I was there on labor day so I don't think it was very busy..  I'd think if it were during the summer weekend it may have been a little noisy.The hotel also had a nice location in the main drag of Laguna Beach.I agree with other posters who said the hotel is older.  You can definitely tell this though it looks like they have renovated.I have two major complaints.   The valet parking fee of $20 that several people mentioned is ridiculous.   Since I was there on a weekday I was able to avoid the valet and parked at a meter on a side street right next to the hotel. I got there on a holiday when the meters weren't enforced and set my alarm for 7:30 a.m  the following morning and put in 3 bucks to cover me from 8 a.m. - 11 a.m. (check out time).  My other complaint is I found the mattress uncomfortable.  I know this is just a personal preference but I slept horribly even with the ocean in the background..  Woke up with a backache the following morning..  Overall I had a good stay (was just there one night) but not sure I would have paid full price for the room.

I am specifically rating the cabana as a group of friends rented one for the day.  NEVER IN MY 28 YEARS ON GODS GREEN EARTH HAVE I HAD SUCH A SPLENDID RELAXING DAY!!!!!!!!!!!! Yes MA'AMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I chose to valet as I didn't want to have to deal with the hassle of finding street parking.  The goal was to relax right? Valet was only $15 which was reasonable in my book.  The cabana was amazing!!! Actually it was ill named as it truly was a bungalow that was a gorgeous (decorated impeccably) private room with all the amenities connecting to a balcony that overlooked the ocean.  I didn't know this is how the upper crust rolls LOL!!!!!!!!  In my mind, when I hear cabana I thought of 2 raggedy sticks propped up together in some makeshift tent with a cooler.  And THAT would've been FINE in my book.  I was truly blown away!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We were served tacos for lunch and NOMNOMNOM yum get in my belly!!!! So delicious!!! Watch out for the green salsa!  It was spicy which I loved but it catch others off guard.  Our server's name was Nancy and she was a doll!! Another server, David, was real coo in a witty and clever type way!!! I was the first to leave as I had to finish a work project and he demanded I work there in the cabana as wireless internet was provided.  I complained that I couldn't focus and work in such a beautiful distracting environment!!!  Staff quickly set up reserved lounge chairs for all of us (thank you as i was not built for manual labor), umbrellas and towels on the sand. Lounging and listening to the waves with my home girls was literally one of the most relaxing things I have ever done.  Period. Not having to worry about chasing after kids etc...you get the idea.The only CON (minus a star) is that when we went down to lounge on the beach, we locked up the cabana as we had electronics, our purses etc.  One of my friends went back up to grab something only to catch Christina, the sales manager, showing our cabana to a group of prospective customers.  Um excuse me? I don't know who these people are and you got them all up in our room with our stuff??? You're wack...and don't look all busted when we walked in on you showing the room but don't even have the decency to apologize.

We recently stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel. A real disappointment.The room in the Bahia complex was one of the worst hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. The apartment smelt of dirty carpet and some disgusting odor in the 2nd bedroom. The carpet was filthy and the bathroom and kitchen were a mess. On top of that the room was sandwiched between the busy PCH and the even busier valet area that everyone in Laguna Beach was using. To top it off we were woken every morning at 6.00am to a Penske loading truck. Wouldn't the hotel think to respect guests by starting work a little later??The kitchen at the deck restaurant was being fixed and they were serving re heated fried chicken that had been cooked earlier. The pool in the middle of the complex never had fresh towels when my kids went there either.Only highlight was the gentleman that put the chairs out on the beach that had a great demeanor ANC the front desk. I can't comment on room service because every time I called no one answered.If you want my advice stay well away- the rates they are charging for this type of room is completely  outrageous- don't be fooled by the nice pictures on the web site!

Who needs a sound machine when you've got actual ocean waves lulling you to sleep? Pacific Edge acted as a place to rest my head during a Cinco de Mayo staycation - and it more than did the trick.It's a JDV hotel, but looks like it's still in transition (either that, or they just stopped) because it looks 30% like a boutique, but still 70% like an old beach motel. I will say, the price definitely ain't too shabby for beachfront digs. Plus, there's a huge hottub, a fridge in the room, you're mere steps to the beach, and they even have a pillow menu for the discerning sleepyheads out there.

We only stayed one night, and we can't even claim to have taken advantage of anything but the Pacific Edge's great location, but all in all, a worthy experience because 1) it was fairly inexpensive, 2) we were walking distance from the bars and galleries we hit up for the art walk, and 3) we had a poolside room but the entire hotel has the beach at its back. The morning before we checked out, Mrs. Q and I took a nice leisurely walk along the beach and saw a pod of dolphins practically within wading distance. Apparently I wasn't the only who thought so, because a lady in jogging garb actually did wade out to try and swim with the dolphins. Mrs. Q went from aghast to annoyed to angry in the space of about 5 seconds. "Why is she doing that? Doesn't she know dolphins are aggressive swimmers? Well I hope they attack her." As far as I know there was no blood shed in the waters that morning, else it would've shown up as a news teaser that we speed through on our DVR - "Local news at 11: shocking dolphin attacks in Laguna Beach."

Surprised my boyfriend for his birthday and took him here for one night. We spent one night in what I can only describe as "Paradise". The guest services, the amazing view...OUT OF THIS WORLD :) We were very satisfied customers. Brandon on the staff on the beach was helpful and very hardworking. He brought us lounge chairs, fresh towels, boards, anything we needed. This hotel is wonderful :)

The problem with so many hotels is the "extra fees" you are hit up with upon arrival.  This is unfortunately another one of those.  $37.00 for parking and then the valet service wants a tip on top of that...rooms are ok but the elevator was broken and the place is nothing special.  It's location is great but when you get reamed for parking and have to haul your bags over all creation it really sucks.  I felt ripped off.

Awesome hotel!!! Older but very clean and rooms are updated and decorated cute. We had an amazing view and it was so relaxing hearing the waves as we fell asleep.  Awesome hotel staff. We live in Huntington Beach and wanted a quick get-away for  my Fiancé bday. Kimberly at the front front desk sent  a bottle of champagne to our room. Very nice touch with details.  Can't wait to stay again, hopefully for a couple of nights next time... Also, our doggie loved the room too!

I hate when people write extremely long reviews, so I'll keep this short.The only reason this hotel received two stars is because the staff was nice, very friendly and the hotel was in a good location.We stayed in the Bahia building which is located behind the ocean view rooms and on Hwy 1 (aka PCH). When we walked in, RENOVATION 911!!!  The carpet probably hasn't been changed in 15 years and was filthy.  Kitchen cabinets were old and the doors were hung uneven.  Instead of the shower being retiled at one point, they painted it.  Yes, that's correct, painted tile in the shower.  So as you can imagine, it's peeling and in very poor condition.  Cheezy retro furniture.  It's apparent that this use to be an old apartment complex.  Unfortunately, when they turned it into a hotel, there was no additional sound proofing done.  We could hear people walking and running upstairs, which shook our room.  Anytime someone got off the couch, we knew about it!BTW, the pictures you're seeing at the top of this screen in NO WAY represent the Bahia building.  I would have been elated if those pics represented correctly.  False advertisement!

I second the motion to turn the name into the pacific edge motel.  You can definitely see the age in this property, but the location makes this place worth while.  Oh, and the beds were comfy.  I got my money's worth bc hotels.com had a 48 hour sale, but I didn't get to take advantage bc we checked in late and left early.  Depending on how much you pay, I do think this is a good value bc the hotel alternatives are expensive too.  Do take in consideration the $20 parking fee.  I got around it by parking at the meters in front, which are $1 an hour and start at 8am but read the restrictions bc there was a time limit.  I would stay here again if it was under $100 and I had time to take advantage of the beach.

This place was surprisingly great! Our room was on the top floor, had an incredible ocean view and also had a whirlpool hot tub. It's amazing to go to sleep with the ocean waves crashing outside your window! The sunset was also gorgeous to watch.It's a nice hotel but not fancy by any means. I think it's been remodeled and the colors are kind of funny (olives and blues). The pool was kind of a joke though...they should remodel this sometime soon. Overall, it's clean, comfy spot to rest your head and it sits right over the ocean. I'd recommend getting a room with an ocean view though.

My husband I stayed here for two days with an ocean front room for our honeymoon and it was by far the best experience I have ever had !! The staff was incredibly helpful and attentive to our requests. They also gave us complimentary champagne bottles for us newlyweds. We are sad to leave. But will definitely be back again! Thank you Pacific Edge for the wonderful memories
Lovely experience from beginning to end! Perfect view and accommodations. Will be back very soon! Gonna live life on the edge....pacific edge that is!

My wife and I stayed at The Pacific Edge Hotel in the reef tower awhile back for my brothers wedding and we really enjoyed our stay. So much so that we plan on coming back as much as we can. Everyone one that worked there during our stay from the front desk people to the beach guys were super friendly and really went out of there way to help you. The view of the ocean and the coast line from The Pacific Edge is incredible. If you stay in the reef tower the waves come all the way up to the building during high tide. You can look straight down from your balcony and see the surf. That being said we did have a few minor bumps in our stay. First off a few days before we arrived my wife called with some questions and the girl that answered the phone was really rude and short with her. When we got there and checked in we went to valet to park the car and have our stuff brought to the room. We had some fragile decorations for the wedding in a box and told the valet guy about it. So he proceeds to put that box on the bottom of the valet cart and pile all of our stuff on top of it. Then about half way to our room he ends up dumping all of our stuff off the cart. Not a good way to start our stay. When we booked our room we requested a low room but we got there they had given us one on the top floor. Also the pics of the room we got showed a full size refrigerator. We were bringing up some perishables for the wedding and were counting on have that full size fridge. The fridge that was in our room was a mini fridge . We ended up getting everything into the mini one so I guess it all worked out. Next the way the building is designed your next door neighbor's AC  sticks out onto your patio. So when they run it it blows hot air on you when you sit out on your patio. Also the condensation from the AC floods the floor of your patio. If you are wanting to order some room service you have to go and get a menu from the front desk. There are none in the rooms. I know that it sounds like I'm complaining a lot but I really did enjoy my stay here and do plan on coming back. I would just be a bad Yelper if I just pointed out the good. These things I pointed out are minor and if your looking to stay somewhere in the Laguna Beach area I wouldn't  hesitate to book your room at the Pacific Edge.

Great Service! The staff was prompt with satisfying my requests. The rooms were a bit old modeled. The offset of the old hotel rooms was The view which was awesome and the location, steps below onto the beach. Looking forward to visiting again. :)

What a DUMP!My wife and I stayed here for a couple of days.  Our room had dilapidated furniture, the TV didn't work half the time, the phone didn't work, the coffee machine did not work. The maids are lazy and would dump their laundry from the other rooms in front of our room.  House keeping would not fix the curtains that broke.  The pool didn't look clean.  None of the staff would pick up any trash or cigarette butts all around the property.  I called the GM and did not get a call back.   The only good thing is it is on the beach!  I would not go back nor would I recommend this place!

After staying at this hotel for 26 years (formerly family-owned Vacation Village), we were forced to re-locate our annual family reunion last summer.  We rent 10 rooms for one week, and they were completely IMPOSSIBLE to deal with.  You can't beat the location of this hotel, but the customer service is horrible!  They are not willing to work with large groups to try and accommodate room location.  The beach set up can be very stressful because the beach is not very deep.  We spent 26 years setting our alarm to get in line at 6am to get a good spot on the beach.We are now working on developing new memories and traditions at the La Jolla Shores Hotel.  It's not Laguna, but the Customer Service is so friendly and accommodating, which makes our stay so much more pleasurable.

Incoming guests beware!!While portending to be a high end destination, this hotel is fraught with issues, most of which I will leave for other reviewers who have already found (and others will discover) with this place.What we found were several instances of mold and we saw it in the only rooms we were in.The hotel staff, while attempting to ameliorate us, were void of any real assistance.As a reminder, most researchers believe  serious effects may result from mold exposure, including fever, flu-like symptoms, fatigue, respiratory dysfunction (including coughing-up blood), frequent and excessive nose bleeds, dizziness, headaches, diarrhea, vomiting, and liver damage. Even more alarming, is that the California Health Dept states there are no current regulations for mold in commercial properties.Hence these places have no incentive to remediate these issues.Guests beware, this hotel has serious health concerns for you.

The location to the beach is amazing. The staff there was fantastic. From the valet guys to the guys working out at the beach doing towels and umbrellas. We ate at both restaurants, the Driftwood for breakfast Wednesday morning and the Deck for dinner Thursday night. Both times the food was amazing and our servers were great. We had a large party Thursday night and they were really accommodating. Our room was a little small but for the price could not be beat and it was totally sufficient. Next time we will book further in advance to get ocean front. We peeked in our neighbors and it was much larger. All in all it was a great experience and we will be back.

IF YOUR WONDERING WHY THIS HOTEL GOT 3.5 stars AND YOUR READING REVIEWS TO PURSUED YOU STAY HERE.......THERE IS A REASON WHY ITS 3.5 STARS WITH 210 reviews. I'm not the only one who was not happy. What got me about this hotel only was location. I read the reviews and looked at the 3.5 rating and said it can't be that bad........... I initially wanted the whale and dolphin package and what was even more exciting was the late checkout included.Long story short I was not able to get it b/c there was a glitch in the system. They told me they were sold-out. When I called the marina, Dana Point where we get tickets they had plenty and I could go at the time I wanted. I was mad they lied. But I thought maybe if I called them and told them that they would still honor the late checkout. The difference maker in booking this hotel b/c there was nothing great about the hotel besides the location. They told me yes and they would make a note of it. I wake up this morning only to find out that they did not honor it. What makes me feel even more disappointed that I've been wanting to stay here the past couple times, but past it up for better places. I should have stuck with my instincts and never came, the pictures are VERY compelling. Especially, when there are other hotels around that have better deals or pay $30+ for a nicer room elsewhere off the beach as well. Service was ok, but I did not like being mislead to think I was getting a late checkout when really they had no way to honor despite, I was lied to about the whale watching packages. Don't lie just to fill your hotel.And no I wouldn't come back just because there are better hotels around.I was going to go whale watching at 2:30 b/c I thought I had a late checkout, but since I have to checkout early, instead of calling the marina to get an earlier time. I'm taking my son to universal just to make it up to him ( season pass holder), b/c I took him out of school today just so he could see the whales. #lifelessonAs I was loading up my own car  I seen one of the gals from the front desk outside in the front if the hotel complaining about her job.....lol wow. She filled up cup b/c just when I was thinking my trip overall and how everything went it all buckles down to the employees. From her conversation on the phone they are under stress, but don't let that interfere with making the guest happy.

I had issues with the room on my first night last night. The AC unit not cooling the room enough, a television going in and out of signal, and a light fixture with lighting issues. Once these were addressed, management followed up with them right away. Brian Sullivan, the manager turned my unhappy questionable moment of stay upside down when he transferred my family and I into a beautiful, clean, and superb room. I truly appreciate his concern for my concerns during our stay. He was professional and excellent with his service and delivery. I plan on re - booking here in the future. Customer service is 2 thumbs up! Thank you!

I don't know where to start....I had a vision in my head of what I wanted my wedding to be and this place BY FAR exceeded my expectations. My husband and I have never had a bad experience here - we initially found this hotel on a Groupon and used that for a "staycation". Our great experience then led me to having my birthday there and then our wedding dinner. The reason we've done this is because the staff goes over and beyond. It's a "boutique" hotel, which means it's unique but I soon realized that also includes getting personalized service. I started working with Karolin, who went on maternity leave and then Becca, who soon introduced me to Rose, who was in charge of events, weddings, etc. They were a team and I was always responded to with my questions in a timely manner. Rose went over and beyond to make sure our needs were met - I could list them here but there isn't enough space. The staff who serviced our dinner - Luke and Andy - NO WORDS! They were amazing and were so on top of it making sure drinks were full and our needs were met - not just my husband and I but for all of our guests. We had 18 people but I know both guys asked every single person for their specific needs. I had many guests approach us throughout the dinner, commenting on how amazing Luke and Andy were. To the Pacific Edge Hotel - thank you for making our wedding reception a memorable and AMAZING evening!! We will be back soon!! Love, Cori & Geoff

Brian in guest services is awesome. I just called and he was wonderful! My brother and sister in law are checking in and have been through a great deal with their son who recently overcame cancer. I called, hoping to make the trip awesome and memorable. He happily sent them a complimentary bottle of red wine and cheese and crackers on mine, and my husbands behalf.

I see that "Thomas L., Business Manager" responded to my review below. I want Yelp readers to know that he did nothing to make up for the many problems with our stay. We will be searching for a new hotel in Laguna for our next visit.

This place is gorgeous.  Not only is it gorgeous, but the rooms are great and I had nothing short of a stellar experience in my four night stay.  Huge comfortable duvets, great pillows, clean rooms, attentive and amazingly nice staff, beautiful views and a fantastic bar on the beach to wile your evening away.

This review is strictly for The Bungalows on Laguna Beach at Pacific Edge Hotel.  If I could rate a business ZERO stars, I would!  Anyone considering renting out a private bungalow at this hotel, please read my review first before doing so...We were a part of a 10 person group, renting the FOX racing suite for the day to celebrate a milestone birthday for a dear friend who is a Laguna Beach local.  Those friends rented the suite not only for the birthday celebration but to test it before booking their wedding rehearsal dinner at this hotel.  Thank God, we came before booking the rehearsal because the level of professionalism at this hotel/bungalows is beyond low.  To start with the positives, the view and location are amazing, you are right above the beach, with your reserved beach chairs right down below.  The price of the bungalow will set you back about $1400.  You have to put down a large deposit and then on top of that hit around an $800 food minimum.   I will highlight the negatives now... beware, there are a TON of them!* All of the food comes from a catering restaurant ACROSS the street, which means the wait time is ridiculous and your food comes back cold!  We started by ordering simple appetizers:  calamari, chips & salsa, ahi tuna.  The calamari was very cold (both times we ordered it) and came without the sides (marinara & aioli), we told our server and she came back with a bottle of catchup and told us to make our own cocktail sauce! We explained that the calamari was to come with a marinara sauce and she explained that she could get us the side but she would have to WALK across the street to get it and that would take her 10 minutes.  We COULD NOT believe this.  First, we paid $60 for the calamari, it was cold and without sides and NOW the waitress tells us she has to walk across the Pacific Coast Highway to get the marinara! OMG! *We ordered margaritas and buckets of corona, twice came without limes, straws and napkins.  The appetizers (once arrived) came without appetizer plates for our group.  Had to hunt down the server to ask for these items each time.  You probably are expecting that they were super busy by the type of service we received but only 2 of the 5 bungalows were rented out on a sunny Saturday.  Looks like their reputation has already traveled by word of mouth because this place SHOULD have been packed...It was SLOW!*Because the bungalow next to us was empty, and closest to the bar we had groups of people wandering in and sitting at the open bungalow next to us.  They even ordered drinks and the server seemed okay with this.  We told the server that we thought this space was to be rented and not just open to the public, I mean, we did PAY $1400 for this bungalow for the DAY so we expected it to be private and it wasn't.  The server rolled her eyes and told the group of people that were sitting in the open bungalow that WE had a problem with them being there... She made us look like the bad guys so the group had a few choice words to say to our group before exiting.  Really professional!  * The parents of our group asked to speak to a manager before we left to tell them of our experience.  We got the restaurant/bar manager who told us the bungalows were completely separate from the Hotel/Bar and that there was nothing he could do since the bungalow manager went home for the day.  He pointed out that he took off the COLD calamari from the bill (WOW, THANKS FOR THAT!) and we explained that it was not about the money it was about letting him know of the service.  He was very uninterested in our feedback.  We explained to him how a member of our group was going to reserve this space for his wedding rehearsal dinner and now after this he wouldn't.  The manager (can't remember his name, maybe John?  Shorter guy, brown hair, thin) said, "Well if the service SUCKED as bad as you say then don't come back!".  Unbelievable. If you still want to go through renting one of these bungalows after this review, just know you have been warned... it is not worth the money and you would be better off bringing your own food and having a party on the public beach ten feet below this space.

I was looking for a hotel in the Laguna Beach area for a relaxing night to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. I stumbled upon this hotel and decided to book a night here because of the reasonable price and great location. It's literally steps away from the beach and short walking distances to all the great restaurants and shops!The employees working the front desk were friendly and the guy who checked us in even upgraded our room! Also the guy working the beach towel/seats giveaway area was particularly accommodating. Sadly, I had to knock off a star for the unfriendly valet employees. I didn't mind paying the $24/night but a smile or even a greeting would've been appreciated.

Im sorry but this hotel is pretty much in the Motel 6 category.  I was extremely disappointed in the room, the property, etc..  The front desk clerk was not accommodating and didn't really seem to care as well.  They don't have food or drink service at pool- which is another EW! in itself.  Just saying!  They did however let me leave the property without any hassle or fee.
Stayed in the Reef Building in room 106. Huge balcony and a great view overlooking the beach. The room was spacious and vibrant. Definitely an awesome place to stay!

Wow this place is great. Just stayed down there for a wedding. The room was perfect for a one nighter. We checked in got unpacked and looked out the window and there was the ocean!! That is inspiring I almost went out and painted with all of the artists on the strip. My wife and I took a long walk on the beach and then had an amazing lunch at The Deck right next to this hotel. Amazing food, great service and good drinks.We were in town just for one night so we did not spend much time in the hotel but when we did the room was nicely decorated the bathroom was the fun part it had blue shells hanging from the wall on the mirror and it just made the room feel really warm and inviting.The valet was nice the guys were friendly and had the car when we needed it.I really loved that all night I could hear the waves pounding it is soooo relaxing. I loved this hotel and I hope you try it out. Really great place to be and not to bad on the price.. Just check coupon sites that's what we did.I recommend the hotel to everyone.

I was greeted with "Welcome to the Pacific Edge Hotel, would you like to upgrade your room for an additional $129?" So service was rocky throughout, but we did have a comfortable (albeit old) room just steps from the beach. You just can't beat the location.

I stayed here for 5 days in August with my shih tzu, and an 11 month old baby (and my spouse). We picked this hotel for the location and for their pet-friendly policy (it wouldn't be a family vacation without our pup!)We were in one of the two bedroom apartments in the Bahia wing. We booked our rooms on Priceline because booking a 2 bedroom apartment was not an option on the hotel's own website. I was looking for something more than your typical hotel room because frankly, we have a lot of stuff for the baby, and because I wanted the convenience of a mini kitchen for prepping baby food (I hate using hotel bathroom sinks for this kind of stuff). BONUS!! When we stepped into our room, we discovered the room was equipped with a FULL- sized kitchen (full-size gas range, dishwasher, microwave, big kitchen sink, etc.) I mean, one could prepare Thanksgiving dinner here! Huge plus for us (we even thought about making dinners here but that never happened ...). I also wanted the 2 bedroom because there was a balcony (more on that later) and a a separate sitting area/living room. Unless you are in one if the ocean front rooms, I don't think balconies are available otherwise (but I could be wrong). Having a balcony was important to us so we could sit outside and enjoy the natural air, drink a glass of wine and relax without fear of waking the baby once he went to sleep. The room was literally an apartment - for our purposes, perfect! Oh, one thing before I forget, I actually had to make 2 bookings for 2 different rooms (a single, and a 2 bedroom apartment) because the 2 bedroom apartment wasn't available for all the nights we needed at the time of booking. At check in, the front desk staff, upon realizing we had 2 different booking for 2 rooms, "upgraded" us for no charge and let us check straight in to the 2 bedroom apartment - I thought that was awesome because I was dreading changing rooms after 1 night (just imagine ... a pack and play, stroller, the toys and, getting our pup accustomed to another room).The balcony for the room literally overlooked the valet stand - not a huge deal as we had reasonable expectations for the type of room we booked. The issue with this setup though is that there is a smoker section next to the valet station which was outside of our room and the when people smoked there, the smell drifted on to our balcony, and into our room. I have a baby - this was not cool. Also, depending on the way the wind was blowing, smells from the restaurant could waft in (not as bothersome as the smoker station). I thought about asking for a different room, but (see above), moving into another room would have been a pain in the ass, so I just closed the patio door when the smells became unbearable. We weren't in our room all that much, so I only had to do this a few times luckily. The staff was very friendly, the housekeeping service was also friendly and thorough. I tried to "schedule" housekeeping service around my child's nap time, which worked some days and not others. The room (Room 2) was furnished with old-school beach type furniture - nothing fancy, but I thought it fit the atmosphere. My only problems with the room were (1) there was some weird staining on the bathroom walls - I hoped it was just water marks, but the bathroom walls could use a fresh coat of paint or a scrub down; and (2) carpet that was not tacked down as my child quickly discovered. Other than that, the room was nice, clean and comfortable.  The beach in front of the hotel was awesome, and clean. They have super friendly beach attendants that will set up lounge chairs and umbrellas for you. Breakfast at the Beach House was decent - great morning views of the beach and ocean, and while the food was nothing to write home about, it was decent. We had room service dinner on our first evening there from the Mare (?) restaurant. Awful. Seriously, not good food - I wouldn't want to eat that again at any price (and we paid $70 for 2 dishes!). I am trying to get an $8 charge removed for "water" that was not offered in our room, and that we did not consume. No response yet, but I am confident that will work out. I know it's only $8 but being charged for something that wasn't used just bothers me. We enjoyed our stay here overall. For the price, Pacific Edge was decent and we would stay here again but would hope for a room free of odd wall staining and away from smokers.

Love this hotel! I have been to many top rated resorts and this hotel is right up there with them. We had an oceanfront room, excellent location. The staff is awesome, the beach attendants are very helpful and accommodating. We never had to drive anywhere! We had a nice short walk to all the best restaraunts. Danced all night, partied in the pools and huge hot tub. Played ping pong, body surfed, laid out in their lounge chairs on a private section. We had blast! We can't wait to go back!

Stay away at ALL cost!! This was the worst place I have ever stayed!! My wife and I booked the room so we wouldn't drive after our friend's wedding. They actually gave us a room with a conference table in the living room.. "Oh sorry we must have over booked and put you in our conference room and that's the only room we have left" ??I mean really?? we were told we were getting suite and we ended up with well..the conference room?? we had a wedding to go to so whatever..I'm  not going to look for another room now.. Our friend's wedding  was beautiful and we had a great time.. Come morning we decided to have a bit of breakfast before we head out... nice breakfast at the Surf and Sand with some other wedding goers.. So back to the room and ready to check out..thought I'd drop my bags off at the car.. Oh wait!! The car is GONE!! The valet guy told us where to park and said.."oh no worries, you're right by your room..you don't need a ticket for that sir"  They towed our car!! What? I'm a pretty mellow guy but when the lady manger said there was nothing she could do I almost blew a valve. NOTHING?? But you towed my car and I'm a guest?? We couldn't find your ticket sir.. and the same valet kid is standing there... Did you ask him if he knew the car?? NO.. He even told her he knew it was our car after I asked him.. The managers response..wait for it.....she actually shrugged her shoulders and said.." Sorry, there's nothing I can really do" At first I thought maybe I was being punked by my friends..I wouldn't put it past them.. But no..I was in a Hotel nightmare..the girl at the front desk finally found out what company towed my car and gave me their number.. After begging them to open the tow yard (see this all happened on Sunday and they are closed until Monday) and after explaining to the guy what happened they let us come get our car.. Yeah...and we took a cab ya see the hotel wouldn't shuttle us or even pay for the cab..so that worked out..So to sum everything up... Thank you Pacific Edge for letting us stay in your conference room and for towing our car..I appreciate the discount you didn't give us on the room for messing up and for not giving us a ride to get our car that you had towed($200 to get the car out)... maybe next time (NEVER) you could make sure to have our room robbed and all our belongings stolen..This is a NOT RECOMMEND review..

I've stayed at several of the Joie de Vivre properties and will again.  But this is the worst and I will not go back.  I will stay at the Holiday Inn or the Riviera.  Edge has great location, but terrible service (1 out 5 person was actually nice, the rest "hey, what do you want"), lame room (bad smell, broken a/c heater unit, really bad shower), terrible facilities (no elevators, no signage)...I do not recommend it and they charge for parking.

I'm updating my review because customer service goes a loooooooonnnggggg way.  And I didn't give them the opportunity to make any changes when we checked in cuz we didn't feel like fussing.  But management did contact us and offered to make it right and delivered.  Thanks for caring.

Stayed here last week with my wife and parents. For what we wanted this was perfect. We only stayed 1 night and wanted somewhere close to the beach so surfing was easy. It's on the beach so that worked perfectly. We got the most basic room. No ocean view but you can hear it which is soothing. Honestly didn't spend that much time in the room. If you want somewhere you can spend time on the beach, warm in the hot tub, and close to Laguna beach town. This is awesome. We will go back.
This place was beautiful. Check in was easy and quick. I will be back! For the money, you can't beat the beach front rooms.

Great value, staff, and location! The room was clean and spacious for the price and your only steps from the beach :) And theres a Taco Bell next door to satisfy your late night cravings if your up at 2 :)

Stayed in a oceanfront in the surf building. The rooms were beautiful and the view was spectacular. The waves were crashing right outside our balcony.  my only complaint is that on top of the $350 for the room valet is an additional $27. And they were renovating the pool area and had nasty pulled out carpet and chemicals right next to the hot tub. We will be back for the room and the view.

After reading some of the previous reviews, I have summed up my experience at this location.  It's on the beach, the rooms take a beating during the vacation season, so think practical.  During the vacation season this place is great to sleep and shower.  It's clean, every member of the staff was super nice and attentive, and anyone that expects anything more has their expectations too high.  The attitude of the staff is the heart and soul of this location and I appreciate that type of culture.

A very big thank you to Brian the general manager for picking up the pieces and accommodating us. The care and concern for the upper management was great to fix the mistakes of others. We are looking forward to our quick, and very much needed, 24 hour vacation. Thank you Brian!!!

Love this hotel. Got a beach front room in the surf tower.  Very conveniently located right on the water.  Front desk personnel very friendly & helpful.  Requested early check-in when we arrived at 11:30am.  They suggested we use the beach attendant services for the day and they would call my cell phone if the room opened up early.  Got a couple of lounge chairs, beach umbrella & towels and comfortably enjoyed the beach.  They have a clean and well stocked bathroom for guests to use close to the water also.  Received a call at 2:30 pm to check in early.  The room has absolutely stunning view and is beautifully decorated with a modern beach motif.  The bed is very comfortable with the most cushy pillows.  So close to so many amazing restaurants.  We walked to K'ya (half a mile south on Coast Hwy).  Woke up o the sound of the crashing waves and enjoyed a fresh cup of complementary coffee (brewed in the in-room Keurig coffee maker) on the patio.  Ate breakfast at the Beach House next door.   Enjoyed the room until late check-out at 12:30pm.  It was our 1st year anniversary and we stayed here on our wedding night as well.  I think we will need to make this our annual place to celebrate.

I grew up coming here back in the Vacation Village Days, and have such fond memories however with the change in ownership, I must say that quality has slipped, and that updates to the rooms and common areas are much in need. I just stayed here over the weekend with girlfriends, and we got an ocean front room. Upon first walking into the room, the smell of chemicals was overwhelming. It appears that they had just steam vacuumed the carpets because they were still sopping wet. Aside from that, our room was ok. The only good thing about it is that patio that opens directly onto crashing waves. I'd say that the valet parking is completely pointless for hotel guests. My recommendation for management is to just charge an overnight fee, but to forego the requirement to valet. It especially doesn't work if you valet your car, check in early, and have to locate your car to get your bags out from valet. Or even worse, if you leave your bags at the front desk, and then have to schlep them down stairs, without an elevator and over to your room once its ready.  If you're looking for a luxurious room, this isn't the place for you. If you're looking for oceanfront, the location would be the only reason to stay here. The $$$$ is for the price range paid, and not the quality.

We spent over $1000 here the other night at the bungalows because they charged $400 to rent the place for the 5 hours that we were there and then a minimum food and drink amount I which we went over that. I would have expected better service and at least a server who dressed decently. To spend that kind of money and have a person dressed in flannel serve you and not even be really friendly is beyond me. On top of that it was pretty cold and we couldn't stay outside to enjoy the sunset for long since the heater was broken. The view was amazing and it was disappointing we could not enjoy it. On the brighter side we did stay at the hotel in an oceanfront room and had an amazing view and the best breakfast at The Deck! The food was outstanding!

This hotel is the best hotel by far at laguna beach. Excellent location, staff is friendly and helpful, very accommodating, and any room you stay in either beachside or village will be a wonderful experience. Close to town, right on the water this hotel has it all. I stayed here the last three times I have been to Laguna and will never consider staying anywhere else. It has two restaurants associated with the hotel, hot tub, pool. They are fixing up and renovating the rooms which I have seen the old and new and have to say they are doing a wonderful job. Will be staying again!

Pro's:  amazing 180° view of Laguna Beach from your balcony, nice comfy bed, easy beach access, beautiful water for swimming, fishing and kayaking, a convenient outdoor shower, clean room, and reasonable price for what you're getting (it isn't cheap though).Con's: office staff never told us about the amenities (beach chairs, umbrellas and towels, pool, etc) and were a little "cold" but then again we saw them having to deal with some really entitled patrons/jerks, which might partially explain their aloof attitudes.We'd go there again for the great view, ocean access and ability to walk or ride the free Summertime shuttle up and down Coast Highway to survey beautiful museums and cool little restaurants.

We were assigned a Junior Suite on the 4th Floor, Reef Tower.   It was in terrible condition.View was great but the accommodations were dingy with paint peeling from the window sills and on the balcony chairs.  Mold in the bathroom.  Dingy furniture. No bed bugs, tho.We were able to move to a Junior suite on the 1st floor.  No mold.  I've stayed atBest Westerns better than this.  My guess is that they don't really care about the product they offer their guests.Sad.

Let me start off by saying that our room view was incredible, falling asleep to the sound of the waves was pretty magical. Unfortunately our check in was anything but. We stayed here on our wedding night and were greeted in an annoyed manner right away by the woman working the front desk. My husband who was asking the woman at the front desk if they had the best room available as this was our first night as husband and wife and the whole time she kept giving us short, curt answers and not only did she not crack a smile once, she was borderline flat out rude. My husband had called prior to let them know of our late check in and the occasion we were celebrating. Guess I was hoping for at the very least a friendly staff towards us on the happiest night of our lives. There was also zero acknowledgment or extra attention to help us celebrate our special day. If you are looking to feel welcome and that little something extra on your stay in Laguna, I suggest looking elsewhere.

I will start by saying that the customer service was outstanding, except for one incident. This incident was the requesting of a bar of soap for the bathroom, and not ever receiving it.The rest of my stay was nothing short of disappointing. We stayed in the two bedroom apartment and we were very disappointed in the condition of the room. The walls were very dirty and there were many mis-matching paint spots where imperfections were tried to be covered. The couch in the livingroom had a large rip in it.  The baseboard in the bathroom was cracked and pieces were missing. The grout in the kitchen was filthy and the stove and oven were dirtier than my own. Not to mention, the refrigerator was disgusting on the outside. The carpet on the inside of the apartment and on the balcony had many stains. The two louvered windows were broken, and what remained was taped with electrical tape. Only one remote control worked, and there were not any quilts on any of the beds. As well, a visiting friend broke her toe nail in half after tripping on the uneven threshold. I took pictures of these things and plan to email the general manager directly to express my extreme disappointment. for the price I paid I expected to be wowed. This was, unfortunately, very far from the case. While it looks like there were buildings that were new and renovated, this was definitely not one of those rooms.*I have since received a free night in an oceanfront room.  I am thankful for the response of the hotel team and look forward to my stay. I hope my opinion of this place will get better after my upcoming visit.
For what it is- an inexpensive, beach front hotel- it's great! Get the ocean view room.

The best thing about this place is that they are dog friendly which is not always easy to find. The views are great too, but we didn't spend much time inside to enjoy them. Also if you get the Jr. Suite, you have your own beach entrance (very nice). It's in walking distance to some amazing food: Taco Loco (across S Coast Hwy), Orange Inn for breakfast pastries (just up the hill), and Broadway for dinner was amazing! Finally compliments to the cleaning ladies, they did a wonderful job.On the other hand, we parked on the street which was a little inconvenient, but the only way to avoid parking fees. I would also like to say that the photos of this place (as advertised) make it seem much brighter and newer than it feels when actually inside. Some details were missed when they renovated this place.

This is such a cute little hotel. It embodies the "beachy" old-school feel of the town. The staff was very nice. The room was expected. It had a "Endless Summer" theme. It was nice that it has a kitchette in it, including a fridge and stovetop. Located conveniently close to the downtown area, we parked our car and just walked around. As a warning, do not park your car on the main highway. We saw a car get its sideview mirror taken out and the woman driver just kept on going.Their restaurant was great. Good food and good drinks. The patio in the Beach House restaurant was small but had such an amazing view! This place is perfect if you don't want to spend too much money, but want to enjoy Laguna Beach. My only reservation is that I wish we would have paid the extra money for the Cabana room with the ocean view.
