First things first... all the staff we dealt with were great. We had no problems with the staff. The rooms on the other hand..When we walked into our room for the first time it smelled... REALLY, REALLY bad. Like sewage. That was not going away anytime soon. The hotel had no other rooms for us that night so we had to hang in there until the next day They had some maintenance guys come with some spray. it helped for about 5 minutes.. Meanwhile, our A/C went out. I called and they had to have someone go turn on the breaker again. Come on.Next day we got moved to a room just above us, and it smelled ok. We could deal.. Until I went to take a shower and the shower didn't work. Had to call down AGAIN.. 3rd time in less than 24 hours. They sent someone to come check it out, and the man was very nice, but we were put 30 minutes behind and were late for our plans because of this. He had to go and get a new piece for the shower and come back and fix it. SO inconvenient. We could also hear every single thing going on in the rooms around us. Lots of cussing and yelling. Just not enjoyable.The shower was the smallest shower space I have ever dealt with. Ever.The place was dirty. Just gross and made us feel gross. Also very old. So much could be updated.Just a few hours after we were moved to our new room, we saw a family moving into our old room!! SERIOUSLY? So we stopped and talked to them just to let them know what was going on.We are giving one star because the staff was great. If it weren't for them, we would be giving 0 stars. They gave us a $50 credit for the inconvenience of our first night, but NONE of these problems should have happened. Not to anyone. We should have gotten our stay there for free.We will never stay at this hotel again.

We are ocean seekers.  This is then best ocean front  balcony any where!  Friendly and accommodating staff.  Gorgeous view and beach. Near all activities of Laguna. Older building- so small bathrooms but they provide small refrigerator and coffee maker for your convenience. You can bring your well trained dog!  If you hit the right weather, it will be a convenient vacation to remember forever. Been here 3 times we will be back next year..

The first couple nights there - not so bad.  I found it to be a little expensive for the 'level' of room I had compared to the pictures they post on their website.  BUT the view and location was nice  and there was enough room to move around in the room that I was assigned.  I decided to stay another night.  Ended up paying MORE than the first two nights, was moved to a completely different building and was a little shocked at what a complete and total downgrade it was from the other space.  On top of it all, I ended up with the flu and decided to leave early (same day and actually about an hour after I had to change rooms).  They wouldn't give me a refund  because housekeeping had left for the day.  I checked out, settled my bill completely... AND 5 days later, they still have two holds on my account for 'deposits'  of almost $400.  I stay in a lot of hotels, have had holds put on my account but never for this long.  When I called they said the manager would need to fax something to my bank to release MY  money.  NOT cool, Pacific Edge.  A plus?  They let dogs stay for free.  The rest of the experience has left a sour taste...

I give it 2.5 stars really. It needs a lot of TLC, and it was right on that fine line between almost dirty and barely ok enough. The AC in the room was not working well and it got pretty hot. Both pool areas are tiny and don't have towels right there so you have to walk all the way to wherever to get them. At one of the pool areas there are no lounge chairs at all-or lounging space for that matter-, the other one has only 4, so early bird and all that. However, the hotel location is great, close to shops and restaurants. The food in the hotel restaurant was delish, and our server, Megan, was wonderful.  Loved the beach experience; even though it's a small area that can get pretty packed, it's nice that there's staff that accommodates you with lounge chairs and umbrellas.The staff is absolutely awesome! Super nice and friendly. They provide parking and allow doggies too, which was a must/plus for me

This place isnt so bad if your driving through and need a good motel type beachy place to stay. I would say the best thing about the pacific edge hotel was the location. On the beach and centrally located between the shops and restaurants. As far as the actual "hotel". its for sure more like a lodge motel. Our first room smelled like sulfer. Then the second room they gave us reeked of cigarett smoke. Finally the 3rd room they gave us was a nice ocean veiw room. The staff was very friendly as well.

I was REALLY disappointed in this hotel. The room I stayed in this weekend was more of a motel than a hotel. It was in desperate need of an upgrade, the water in the shower never came close to hot, and I could hear the family in the room behind us clearly through the thin walls. The cleaning service was rude and knocked on the door three times well before check-out time even though I hung the "do not disturb" sign out front. I happened to be taking a conference call from my room before leaving for the day and was really frustrated to be interrupted repeatedly. This hotel was such a let down. I would not recommend it, nor would I ever stay there again.

Let me say that the main reason for the 5 star review is the fact that I left two shirts and hair gel in the room and the cleaning people bagged it and left it at the front desk. - 10 stars.The room is a standard motel type room, but with a fantastic location. - 2 starsAC in the room was horrible - 1 starThe DECK bar and grill is awesome and has a view that cannot be described by words! - 5 stars

One of the worst booking experiences I have had.My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for the Valentines day. I booked a beach front room which was the highest price room and paid for the room in full at the time of my booking(April 11th) .  The only reason we were considering this hotel aside from the location was to stay in Beach Front room where we could see the waves from our Balcony.This is what my wife and I love, and I wanted to surprise her this Valentines day. Long story short, they did the old "Bait and Switch" on us.They acknowledge that we had paid for a beach front room, but put us up in a room with partial water view at a distance ( overlooking the top of the building where the beachfront rooms were in) and kept our money paid for Beach Front room anyway.The front desk staff acknowledged their mistake in booking a room that was not going to be available , but did not even apologize or try to make this up to us somehow. Aside from their unorganized and poor customer service , I have to agree with other comments that this is not a "Resort" as they like to call it, but more like a Motel.You will be disappointed if you expect anything more...

STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!  My car was completely scraped on the right side by the hotel valet.  It's complete chaos.  I admit that it was my fault that I didn't do a complete inspection before I left the hotel but after having to wait over 20 minutes for valet to get my car, I didn't have the time to check.  When I got home, I noticed the damage and immediately called the manager.  The response:  They interviewed all their valet attendants and no one acknowledged damage to my car (why would they?)  They looked at the surveillance cameras and they didn't see my car on them (like that's my problem).  They invited me to file a claim with my insurance and settle it that way.  Like I need a hike in my premium.  Worst stay ever.    [This place does not even deserve a star but since there is no zero star option, I am forced to give it one star.]

Ok yelpers this place is Not the montage or the ritz carlton its old and a little funky, but it's beach front , clean, nice beds, friendly staff, and good food. The price is right! If you know going in you can enjoy the positives of this place. My wife and I will be going back!

DO NOT STAY HERE. I paid over $200 for a room here and my friend and I were expecting to relax in a beautiful resort for the weekend... Not what happened. I knew I did not book an ocean front room, however I did not expect it to be a motel (literally, with the outdoor entrances and everything). The pool looked like something in a trailer park and was not appealing. We left before even staying the night because it was so gross even though I did not get my money back. The pictures they show are incredibly misleading and not AT ALL what it looks like so don't be fooled.

Great location- walking distance to many shops and restaurants. Reasonable prices for what you get in amenities. Rooms are simple, but good. There are 2 pools and one hot tub and there is a beach attendant who will set you up with chairs, umbrellas, towels, toys, etc. - all free (tips, of course, appreciated). Your room key gets you discounts at some of the local places, but grab a list of participating ones from the front desk. One caveat: there is only valet parking for $24/day, but it's unlimited in and out and we didn't really need the car anyway. Bonus: They support the Pacific Marine Mammal Center with donations from every room and, as a result, guests of Pacific Edge can visit the Center for a VIP tour. We did this and it was such a treat for us and our kids. Be sure to call the Center to schedule. The hotel won't do that for you and they have to schedule based on available docents.

Impeccable customer service, beautiful hotel and excellent location. I would love to come stay here again! Exceeded all my expectations and was a great value. Jadid was also very friendly and hospitable.

The valet crashed our car and then denied it! Valet manager would not reimburse us for damage. There is absolutely no parking there and we had no choice but to valet.It was nice to be right on the beach, but the sliding glass door to the balcony was so cheap . It didn't block out any sound at all. Waves can be really loud.We ordered a movie from our hotel room, and it had no sound. It took the hotel an hour to figure it out and get it up and running. Employees of the hotel were very nice, but a little too pricey for what you get. I will never stay there again. If I go to Laguna, I'll stay somewhere else.

My boyfriend and I are avid travelers and professionally I have been on the road for over five years staying in hotels on a weekly basis. Never in our experiences combined have we gotten such rude service as we have here. We cannot even begin to talk about how presumptuous and outrageously rude the hotel staff is here. And the lack of quality in hiring staff concerns me as we considered this as a potential place for our wedding guests. Though we have issues with one person at the front desk - as I would for my team, one person can ruin the whole impression of the entire hotel. That being said, we canceled our stay here and will never return again.

Worst customer service ever!  Dealing with group sales was a nightmare.  It takes Rebecca days and days to return phone calls and her co-workers are not much better.  Even with $6000 to spend on an event, they don't give you the time of day.

I booked my room via Travelocity and got an extremely great rate for Laguna Beach (79.00)....so I didn't mind so much that it wasn't exactly as I expected after looking at the hotel website.  Because I got such a great deal, upon checking in I decided to upgrade to an ocean front room.  Unfortunately it rained my entire stay which made the walk to the ocean front rooms not so much fun as there is no covered walkway, and my room had only a window unit which was pretty loud, and the doors to the small patio leaked.  But the room was HUGE and had everything I needed.  The Staff is very helpful and friendly, the room was clean, good linens, and coffee.  Room service has to come from the adjacent restaurant "The Beach House"...and even with the rain...they were fast and food was excellent.

Location is great.  Room 203 the tv doesn't work.  After 2 calls to guest services and 2 trips from engineering I figured out that I had to unplug the tv and plug it back in every time I want to watch it . Sad because a new tv at Walmart cost a third of one nights rental rate!

The villa there, the venue next to the hotel where they rent out for weddings, it's super cute.  It doesn't look all that savvy, a little run down, paint chipping, but it gives you such a boardwalk kind of atmosphere, which it basically is, as it sets up on the shore, right near the ocean.Having a wedding there has its pros and cons.  Because it's right on the beach, you have a plain, perfect view of the ocean, and you can watch the sun set. The light ocean breeze and hearing the waves crash is an incredible sensation.  However, though the venue is built open-sky, it's blocked off on 3 sides, with only one side open, the side with the ocean view, so when it's warmer, it's harder to catch the ocean breeze.  The smell of the ocean isn't always pleasant though, especially through a wedding procession.  Ocean, fishy water smell, sure it reminds you that you're right on the beach, but I wouldn't say it's always a good smell to have.  But it's nice that after a wedding procession or any sort of party, you can head down to the beach in just a flight of stairs. :)The venue indoors is fairly cute, and the looks from the outside of it is deceiving, as it's not as 'old' looking as it looks on the outside.   It's a fairly small venue, and it has its maximum capacity signs up at less than 30 people, but it can definitely fit more than that, it just gets a little crowded, but workable. They have valet parking there, super nice, super fast, and you definitely need it.

LOVE this hotel. We stayed in a two bedroom suite. There is a decent sized kitchen, large open space containing a huge rectangular dining table and to the side of it a living room set up. The balcony stretches across the span of the living room and one of the bedrooms. Had a beautiful full ocean view. You could hear the waves crashing against the shore no matter where you are in the suite, I loved that part! At night we hung out on the balcony and spotted quite a few lobster boats getting their midnight catch. The room definitely has an updated retro vibe. It's fairly priced and the perfect location to hit up all the shops, eateries and the beach. I would consider this place a must for an after party (like we had) or a romantic weekend away!
Great hotel on the ocean. Upgraded to a newly renovated room. Would definitely stay again
Awesome views! Beautiful renovated rooms! Love our stay here. You're literally on the beach.  They also have awesome party views.

We pay for the "Penthouse" and were offered no help to our rooms with our luggage(keep in mind that "Penthouse" is up three-flights of stairs and there is no elevator,) there were no proper utensils, room dirty, walls dirty, pillows hard as rock, tiny TV, for a "Penthouse." Lighting in the entire room was very insufficient. No light in the closet. Felt that the price was not worth the visit or experience, of a "Penthouse." If it were not for our dogs, and the hotel being pet friendly, we would not have stayed there. Also the most pressing issue was the check in. They charged my card for the full price and "$200 in incidentals" upon check in. I have never heard of that ever...also I can not believe that the "Penthouse" is in high demand. You can not check in until 4pm. What is that? The DAY BEFORE, I purposely asked for an early check-in...The hotel is not even that big. I do not know if they only have one room maid. I will say  the easy access to the beach is wonderful.

I just love this place (call it a motel at best). Highly overated, sub-standard, sometimes dirty, and a grossly overpriced motel that is still simply fabulous.THE PRO'S: Location! Location! Location! No attitude or pretencious Orange County lifestyle.  A staff to die for! They excel in customer service (hello Stacie...can you come home with us?) Restaurants and shopping abound and many within walking distance.  The sound of the surf everyday  is so wonderful. Very FAMILY in a great way. We came with zero kids but so welcomed their sounds every morning beachside.THE CONS: 'FORCED' valet parking at $22.40 ($20 plus tax) a day plus tips in/out. Insane! Annoying! Slow! No options to self-park; even with a fee. The very worst feature of this property was FORCED valet... Dirty, older rooms. Minimal effort to update, let alone clean them. Not even a low-end $59 cheap microwave is included for my $332 a night motel room tarriff. Bring your own bar soap and your own Kleenex (our maid never supplied either all 4 days of our stay).Okay, I've picked on this wonderful Laguna Beach property because I can. I came here decades ago (this property is now 40-plus years in age) and at that time it was called VACATION VILLAGE (now a facade name replaces that calling itself PAFICIC EDGE HOTEL). It's still VACATION VILLAGE; just they've designed a way to charge you now for parking, charge you for kitchen supplies ($20), offer you Wi-Fi speeds for $10 (it's free if you like dial-up speeds). It's become a nickel & dime property. Again, I return to their sub-standard and forced lousy valet parking at $22.40 a day plus $5-10 for tips.Our check-in found us with no working elevator, no working remote for the TV, no microwave for our $332 a night room with kitchenette, no room available/ready at check in at 4:30PM.  Our balcony had torn carpeting that was a bit dangerous and when I sat down in the balcony chairs, it broke placing me onto the floor (yes, I'm fit).It's classy BEACH from an era without Marriott/Westin style and for that reason and that reason alone (plus staff), I suggest this motel on the beach. I still love it!It's a 5-star experience for this tacky dive motel that is at best a 2-3 star motel.  Your personal experience will greatly vary based on whether you have a oceanfront room or not.Advice:  Also read reviews and see photos on TRIPADVISORS.COM.

Great access to the beach. If your goal is to be near the water then this is a great location. However, if you're traveling with family this is probably not the place to stay. The rooms are very small, not even enough room for a rollaway bed. Valet only-$20.00 a day- not too bad compared to hotels in Newport or San Francisco.Service wasn't great, we asked for extra linen to make a bed on the floor and it took a second phone call and total of 30 minutes to receive it.Overall, I probably won't ever come back to this location because the rooms are just too small for a family of 4 or 5.

Positive:Location is amazing, nothing more is really important to us.Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable.Gifts for my kids for 4th of July were thoughtful and appreciated.When they ran out of umbrellas on the beach, someone ran out and bought 20 more from the store.Things that were odd, perhaps negative:Valet parkers seemed mystified that we wanted to park our car there and go to the beach though we couldn't check in for another 6 hours.  Were we the first to do this ?No shower pressure.Ironing board and iron take up a huge amount of space in the tiny closet area, they should remove these and provide upon request.My family had a wonderful time staying here.
Beautiful location and it stops there. Not one room had a working shower. The valet guy backed my car in to a tree. And the place is kind of a maze.

Ocean view was great BUT the bungalows below us were terrible! We're here right now and can't even hear the ocean! People below us are loud and obnoxious! They are playing there music so loud! We called front desk and they said they had to turn off at 10:00!  So we have to close our door and not hear the ocean!  Sad for Laguna Beach. Would not recommend staying here!

Stayed here on Saturday, January 19. We had one of the "Village Rooms" which faced the ocean but without a view. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We opened the windows and could hear the ocean. We weren't bothered in the least by undue extraneous noise or midnight revels like some other reviewers complained about. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of shops and restaurants. The price for the room was very reasonable. They have valet parking for $20 with in-and-out privileges, not bad for a crowded town like Laguna. Like all Joie de Vivre hotels, the staff is very friendly and accommodating. This is not a fancy hotel by any means, so if you're expecting the Ritz Carlton, then drive to Laguna Niguel and stay at the Ritz Carlton. But if you want a nice place to stay in Laguna at a fair price in the middle of town, then this is a good choice.

Not pleasant. Tried to get away from LA for a night with my wife (for our anniversary). They did me a "favor" by getting me into my room 15 minutes earlier than a 4PM check-in. As soon as I got to the room I called the front desk to see if another room was available. Our room was just over the restaurant deck, noisy and NOT private. You should also know that they are not accommodating with late check-out. Do NOT expect to squeeze in any "beachtime" on a single night stay (since you can't checkin until 4 and LATE checkout is 12). Also, there is a STEEP valet fee per night ($27 per night I believe). I work in a guest service business, with a corporation that has a hotel on property. The excuses given by the manager the following day were lame. "At check in we should have gotten a better idea of the type of room you were looking for", even though I was told by the front desk that they could not change my room when I asked for that. And rather than discounting a grossly overpriced stay, the manager also suggested "the next time you stay with us you might prefer the Surf building". I told her I would not be staying with her, and I urge you to contact me regarding the full story before you book this hotel. It looks like an UNbelievable deal...it IS!

Although the Pacific Edge hotel is great to view, the customer service for group parties is horrible! While attempting to view the property for a wedding it took sales a week to get back to us. We ended up visiting the site on our own and ran into the wedding coordinator who was very rude! Although we weren't planning on having the event at the hotel, we still chose to block rooms at their hotel for the wedding party. Reservations was so busy that it took 10 minutes to get an operator for my family and when they finally picked up, they said that they needed to take my number and call me back. The mother of the bride could not even get the room type that she wanted when she booked. You would think that due to all the extra traffic from the wedding group that the staff would be a little more appreciative and treat the mother and father of the bride a little better.

Location great -rooms ok-however, prices for oceanfront rooms are not worth it at all compared to Surf and Sand down the road. Many rooms dated and dingy but worth it for the lower-end ones.Oh, visit the tide pools-they  make it worth any type of visit!. two weeks back  spotted many an anemone, crabs and a 12 " purple octopus sliding between exposed reefs/rocks, brilliant!

I wanted to take my (then 15month old) son to the beach for the first time and thought Laguna Beach would be a good start.  I chose this little hotel mainly because of convenience.  It's located adjacent to the shore.  Due to a recent health issues, I decided to book a room that is simply steps away from the ocean.  I originally booked a first floor oceanfront king room but was somewhat disappointed when we were given a 2nd floor oceanfront king room.  I didn't want to ruin our mini vacation so we kept the spirit up.  Upon entering our room, I was again somewhat disappointed, the room and the building felt a bit like a motel than anything.  But our room was clean, spacious with a medium size refridgerator and a little kitchen sink.  No microwave, apparently that cost extra.  Our room was also not too far of a walk to the water.  I mean, it was definitely not just steps away like I initally have thought but not too bad at all.  The elevator also helped.  I would rate this hotel a 3.5 stars if I could but pushed towards 4 stars than 3 stars as follows:PROS:- Location, location, location:  5 stars for this alone.  The hotel is beachfront and conveniently situated.  Our oceanfront room have absolutely stunning view.  We can hear the waves crashing all throughout the day and night.  Hotel is also walking distance to a lot of establishments.  There's restaurants, shops, cafe and even grocery store (RALPHS)  just accross the street. - I love that our room have a good size veranda with 2 chairs and a table.  A great place to just relax and watch the amazing view; enjoyed the sunset view the most!The veranda is also enclosed by a plexi-glass railing system.  This makes it very safe for my toddler.  I don't have to lift him so he can see the waves or the ocean.  He can also run around the veranda without me fearing that he might fall over the railings or slip between the railings.  I mean, you still do not leave a toddler out there by himself but I can just sit, relax and not have to follow him around like I would in other hotel verandas.  - Staffs are helpful and accommodating.  Our porch light did not work one night and the maintenance guy came rather swiftly and fix the problem in due course.  Barbara or the hotel manager also sent us champagne the next morning.  That was a nice touch. - Towels, beach lounging chairs and umbrella are provided.  You just pick a spot and they will set it up for you.  Very helpful esp. when you have a toddler and/or have health issues.- 42 inch Flat screen TV.- Clean and heated outdoor pool  CONS:- Valet parking fee daily (plus tips if you come in and out).  I was actually already prepared for this, thanks to yelp reviewers.  But it doesn't mean I like it.- No bellhop.  You will have to load and unload your own luggages.  They will provide the trolley but you will need to bring it back.  - Building and room looks old; almost feels like a motel than hotel.  But our room, our overall floor and building was clean and well maintained. BOTTOM LINE:  Yelpers, you'll need to adjust your expectations if you want to enjoy this hotel.  The pictures they posted here and on their website was cleverly and professionally taken (as expected) but this hotel does not look as elegant as they portray.  Personally, after seeing the old building and room, I did not think $250-$300 a night was worth it but after our 2nights and 3days stay here, I realized that I really had an enjoyable and relaxing mini vacation here.  Almost everything here was easy and convenient.  I did not need a vacation after a vacation.  I went back to work rejuvenated.  So, the price we paid was worth it to us.  Will I come back here again?  Yes, I would but there's so many competitive hotels around Laguna Beach that I might want to try as well.

I stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel this past weekend and our stay was nothing short of incredible! I booked 3 beach front rooms and they were even better than I could imagine; you are basically right on top of the ocean. We loved watching the sunset from the balcony and listening to waves at night as we fell asleep. We were celebrating my sister's bachelorette party and upon checking in the staff provided us with a complimentary bottle of champagne, which was a a thoughtful touch! Everyone was incredibly friendly and accommodating, from the front desk staff to the valet guys who were quick to retrieve our cars when requested and help us bring our bags to and from the rooms. The location of the hotel is unbeatable too. Right in the heart of downtown Laguna and walking distance to good restaurants and shops. I would love to stay here again! Thank you to the Pacific Edge Hotel for an amazing weekend!
The staff is courteous. There are suites that overlook the beach. Stayed for one night during my time in Laguna Beach. Restaurant, bar, pool, jacuzzi, and valet parking.

I have not personally stayed here, but have thought about it and have recommended to family and friends and after talking with a lady on the phone the other day I will not recommend this place to stay at anymore. I am not happy with Pacific Edge and one of their employees, her name was Becca. She was very rude, disprespectful, and pushy which is not good for business. I have nothing nice to say about the service and I think she does not represent Pacific Edge in a good way at all.

I yelped about a year ago and gave ranting reviews ! We decided to bring the kids this time since we had such a great time last time! However the prices were ridiculous and a lot of upgrades are definitely needed for the price that we paid! We paid $255 for a Thursday night and it was going to go up to $400 for a Friday night!! I get there are beach views but do we need to pay to sit on the beach for free!? BEWARE PARENTS ESPECIALLY. ....THE ELEVATOR IS DEFINITELY A HAZARD!!!! We had a baby's hand stuck in the elevator and grown adults that were stuck in the elevator because the doors shut on everything!! We complained about it a year ago and nothing has been done! Definitely a liability and possible lawsuit on their hands!! The water in the rooms don't drain and there are cracks and all the porcelain and countertops. Just a little disappointing since we gave such great reviews last time and really would love to come again if either the prices are a little lower and affordable or the hotel was upgraded just a little bit. Simple things like so the fact of water draining and the kitchen countertops and bath tub without cracks and everything!
Friendly personal, clean room, and the most important great ocean view. I'm glad that I picked this hotel for Valentine's day this year, we had a very relaxing time  there.

I've stayed here twice so far and i'll probably be back. The first time was a last minute trip during Valentine's day weekend. Needless to say most hotels in the area were full. So i came across Pacific edge online and they had a couple rooms left at reasonable prices. I wasn't able to get an ocean front room but i did the 2nd trip. The rooms aren't luxury rooms so don't expect 5 star amenities here. But the rooms are clean for the most part. If you aren't able to get an ocean view room you at least hear the soothing sounds of the ocean.I really like the location as well. Right on the beach about 5 minutes walk south of the main town area.also, they had probably the best room service food i've ever eaten at a hotel. Largely because the room service comes from the nice restaurant next door.Give them a try but again if you are looking to blow $300 - $400 a night on a high end hotel look else where.

So my boyfriend decided to treat me to a romantic weekend at a beachside hotel in Laguna beach. So we drove 2 hours to get here and get to the front desk. The parking lot was small and the first thing I thought was, this looks more like a motel. Ok so we've checked in. Where is valet? Oh wait, we have to drive around the entire.property to get to it and it's 20 bucks for your inconvenience. We park and then try to find our room. NOTHING IS LABELED!! The building is old and rusty. We find our room and were really disappointed. The interior decorations are unprofessional. There are beaded curtains on the mirrors in the bathroom. Really?? We burst into laughter. And the first thing my boyfriend said was, it smells like a cess pool in here! Ok so we decided to make the best of it and use the jacuzzi tub. But there was no bubble bath. So we went to cvs to buy bubble bath. Very nice :-) Oh btw, there is an apartment complex in this hotel. We walked into it while trying to find our hotel room. Was there a sign? No. Luckily a custodian gave us the 411. Ok so wanna watch some tv. Nope! The fuse is out! Oh and maybe they should upgrade to a tv that was made in the last 5 years. The bed was ok, no complaints there. And the a/c worked fine. My boyfriend paid 300$ a night for this. I think we should have been treated better. We will never be coming back here. There are other hotels that are even cheaper that are better. I do not recommend this place to anyone. Except to those who want to waste money.The only way this experience would be good is if you had an ocean front view.

First off I gave this hotel a 5 star for a very good reason. People don't have to do what these people did for myself and family. From the managers, front desk, valet (which were so amazing), to the cleaning ladies. we were down in Laguna on very unfortunate event and were put up at the hotel by an organization in OC. Upon arrival we were greeted by the front desk with water and they had our room ready for us to check in. They got us all set up with hygiene products that we had forgotten. We planned on only staying one night but ended up having to stay for 6. On our second and third night we received a cards from the managers offering there condolences. They sent us to the Driftwood to go eat dinner on them and was amazed there too. They made us feel like we were one of their family or friends. They kept it quiet for us as well safe to be able to come back and relax without any problems. The valet kept our vehicle front and center just in case we had to leave. They saw us walk out and would grab our car in a hurry. The hotel is clean and quiet I thought they really did a nice job on keeping this hotel a cozy but luxury hotel. We stayed in the back rooms and they were very nice. It was very quiet at night and the beds we're comfy. Bath towels were soft and big too. I like the coffee in the room but they have fresh hot coffee and newspapers in the lobby as early as 5am. The location is PERFECT too. Good beach and restaurants. The thing is we had to come back some days later and again we were treated the very same. When asked for the same room we had before they got on it right away.  The management never had to do any of this for us.  I didn't just see this with us, I sat up in the lobby for hours at a time and saw them treat every single guest professional and kind. Anytime someone asked for something they made it happen. joie de vivre should be honored to have such a great staff there and know what beautiful job they do there. I will forever love the entire staff of this hotel and will come back to visit often.

Exceptional staff, great location, average room.  We stayed for 1 night over the weekend for a short romantic getaway from San Diego.  Upon arriving, the staff was friendly and accommodating.  Zach at the front desk upgraded our room to a west facing room with views of the ocean.  The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Laguna Beach, 10 minute walk up or down the coast will get you to all the sights.  We had drinks at the Rooftop bar located in La Casa Del Camino and enjoyed a beautiful sunset.  Pete the bartender makes a tasty Whiskey Mule or Mojito.  Afterwards we walked 5 minutes north and enjoyed the best sushi at San Shi Go.  The following morning Javid at the front desk allowed us a later check-out for no additional cost.  We grabbed coffee and croissant sandwich at Orange Inn just 2 minute walk south then strolled along the beach.  We got back to our room, enjoyed a little HGTV, laced up the running shoes and took a great run along the coast through Heisler Park.  All in all, Pacific Edge hotel is a great hotel for a romantic getaway in the heart of Laguna.

This place is an 80 year old shit hole and should be condemned. I couldn't sleep at all with the freeway buzzing by all night. It should be against the law to rent these rooms out, I would have slept better in my car.

Incredible location and nice staff are only pluses. ONLY stay in an oceanfront from so you can hear the waves which might distract you from your run-down room. Trying SO hard to be chic but it's hard to get past the rusty shower rods, carpet stains, bad paint colors, and faulty plumbing. Sorry Joie de Vivre--I like your hotels but this one's not cutting it.

We have been enjoying this hotel for over 30 years. We like the updated colors and theme from Vacation Village. Ocean front rooms is where you want to be as you are right on the ocean and sound of surf will put you to sleep. Service is friendly and good. It is casual beach house style and we can bring our doggie which we love. Love the addition of The Deck restaurant along with the wonderful Beach House restaurant. Be prepared for laid back and casual and you will love your stay as much as we do.

Stayed here for an anniversary weekend. The staff was wonderful and I felt like they did everything they could to make sure we enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and the ocean front room was spectacular. It was right over the ocean and it was cool to have the door open to hear the waves crashing at night. I would definitely recommend this hotel and go back.

If you are looking for a Hilton quality hotel stay, this isn't it.If you are looking for a charming beach hotel with dated, but comfortable rooms, then this is it.The room was spacious and slept 4 comfortably.  Easy to find.  Clean. good mattresses and pillows and adequate amenities.  Our room wasn't as fresh as the photos listed here but decent.  The bathroom could have used some caulking but the kitchen was equipped with a small stove and decent size fridge.Staff was friendly and efficient.The location was perfect.  Walking distance to the Pagaent of the Masters.  And definitely close to the beach.The rate (150 ball park) had me expecting a bit more til i read some of the reviews.  Those knocked my expectations down somewhat but after staying there, i was a satisfied customer.
This is NOT a do over. For the price we paid ($1000 per night) the staff is neither helpful nor accommodating.

This hotel is not the best, and definitely not the worst. It ranks right in the middle. If you want four to five star accommodations then go to a hotel with that ranking, and pay for it. My wife and I showed up during season with no reservations, along with two medium size dogs. We were placed in a room with ocean views. This room was clean and comfortable for less then two hundred a night. You can't beat that for an ocean view, conveniently located in Laguna Beach. Trust me I have stayed at some awesome hotels on beaches all over the world. You won't go wrong here. They are keeping the property up and well maintained, I did see rooms being renovated during my stay here. Oh and by the way, I forgot to mentioned the complimentary bottle of red wine they sent to our room, for being first time guest. The service was great and spot on. Just be a cool customer when you check in, and they will treat you right.

We just came back from our 7 day roadtrip to SoCal and that was the best hotel we stayed in! For that price it was really nice! We had a partial ocean view. We could hear the waves! It was so calming. It's directly at the beach! They have a great service. It was very clean and comfy! 4 different pillows to choose from! Our dog was allowed in our room! We also went to the Laguna Health Club where you get free admission if you stay at the hotel! Plus other freebies. We definitely would come back!

Loved this hotel! My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last week for a quick getaway for our anniversary. We don't live far, so it was perfect for the price and the location. The staff was unbelievably helpful and so sweet. We almost felt like a menace sometimes haha because we kept needing things. Not only was the room perfectly beached out, decorated in weathered beach cottage furniture (perfect for us beach bums), but the room included a full kitchen, an extremely comfortable bed, a great beach view, and the sweet girl at concierge, Kim, sent up a complimentary bottle of wine and a card for us. We were so grateful, and stunned! They also let us keep our bikes safe in their back room.The only downfalls I would say was the $20 Valet Only parking, and the hold on our debit card was a little long after we left. Other than that, we have already talked about going back for another getaway! :)

I just got off the phone with Carrie, the reservations supervisor.  Wow, I hope our stay is better than the reservations experience.  Her tone was very "curt" and she seemed put out that I had so many questions.  Since she is the only person in reservations, I was stuck trying to book our rooms through her.  Usually, the reservations people are the nicest.  I think that if you are having a bad day, you should go home.  That ruined my morning.

If it wasn't for the location and the view. This wouldn't have been a 3. Stayed at an oceanfront junior suite. View was awesome from the room but that was it. Stayed at room 103, and the room was old, dirty, smelly and disgusting. Couch looked like it was picked up from the trash, floor looked like it hasn't been vacuumed, deck chairs look so old, kitchen and bathroom is like from those old motel type places. Good thing customer service and the good restaurants close to it (deck, DK and cliff) leveled it out. But for the price, I would have payed something lower than $850 for 2 nights only. False advertisement online for the rooms!!!!! At least paint the rooms, and clean the furniture.

Unless you're staying in one of the oceanfront rooms, I would suggest another hotel. This place has a great location and is quite reasonable but unless you're in an oceanfront room, I'd skip. I am a JDV Joy of Life Club member and so I am a bit familiar with the JDV hotels (mostly in SF). I like the idea, boutique concept and the semi-stylish approach to these hotels. It was unfortunate that I didn't get the oceanfront upgrade that I put my name on the list for . (They were at capacity). We were put in a room on the first floor, which was near the Valet area and what must have been the alley for the garbage truck pick up.Boo. Waking up to garage trucks. Boo. The Good: - Semi-stylish rooms. - Good "Donut Shop Coffee". - Close to the main area of Laguna Beach. - Free Wi-Fi. - Pet friendly. - Reasonable in price, if you're realistic in your expectations. The Not-So Good: - A motel that has basically just been renovated, which is ok but know this ahead of time so you're expectations are realistic. - Not that I was there to watch tv but it didn't work properly. There was also no remote control, which drove my A.D.D boyfriend crazy. - The walls are thin; I could hear the next room's television. -The window seal was broken; a little ghetto. - The room smelled dusty and wasn't the cleanest. - Ok; now on to the little things. I was disappointed that I had to ask for the bottle of wine that is supposed to be delivered to your room if you're a JDV member only to wait about an hour and a half after my boyfriend finally went up to ask the front desk and they acted aloof. Also, in the morning, I had to call to inquire about getting a NYT (they didn't have one, again another perk of a JDV member). I know this is more of a JDV corporate thing but don't offer your members this "perk" it you can't get your hotels to provide it.

Absolutely breath-taking views from the ocean-front rooms.  Our balcony was literally out over the water.  The staff were very kind and went out of their way to provide me comfort (I was having a horrible cluster-migraine during my stay, and, they went out and purchased medicine, music, food, and other items I desired, they also assisted in extending the reservation during a busy period for them because I could not fly in that condition), as well as excellent suggestions for places to eat/avoid/etc.  The property was well kept, the rooms lovely and clean.

We are day 3 into a 4 day weekend here and are having a great time. This hotel/staff has accomodated all of our needs and more. The rooms are super clean, (the rugs are a bit old, but nothing horrendous) it is awesomely located right on the beach. The beach portion has a great drink/chair/ towel service. The hotel accomodated my need to have one of my dresses steamed which was one less thing for me to worry about while traveling. We stayed in both their beach front room and in one of their 2 bedroom apartments. Both were great. I loved the apartment because it was so great to use their kitchenette. There is a whole foods a few blocks away so we were able to do a little bit of heathy cooking in our room to compliment eating out at some of the yummy local eateries. The support staff seem happy and well managed and this place generally has a good feeling to it. The only thing I wasn't terribly excited about was the valet parking..I like to have easier access to my car, but it could be that they have to do it this logistically.  I will come back for sure next time I am in Laguna Beach.

I absolutely loved this hotel!  If you want the perfect beachy hotel with vibrant rooms and a laid back atmosphere, this is the place! And I'm picky about beds, but I slept like a baby. The oceanfront views are gorgeous. It's within walking distance of everything.  Oh, and the staff couldn't be nicer! That's what's most important to me when you stay at hotel. They met all of my criteria and then some!  I read some of the other (less favorable) reviews and it sounds as if those people are wanting a high maintenance, cookie-cutter hotel experience.  If you'd rather inspect the hinges than appreciate the charm of this gem, you will probably never get all that this place has to offer!  This awesome hotel helped me have one of the happiest and most relaxing vacations I've ever had.

Ok, I really wish there was a 3.5 star rating as I think this place is great for the price, but was maybe a bit less than I was epecting after the beautiful photos. We stayed at the Laguna Cliffs inn last year just up the street for almost the same price of $109 with all taxes.  Pacific Edge however has direct beach access to a swimmable beach with a fairly flat ocean floor for Laguna beach...great for kids.  Heated pool a BIG plus!  Kids were freezing at the Laguna Cliffs Inn pool.  Downside to the pacific edge hotel is their $20 Valet parking fee per day.  Excuse me, but you are not as upscale as you think.  The rooms look far better in the pictures, but don't necessarily feel they were misrepresenting, they just had access to a very good photographer.  As far as our room, it was clean, a bit small, but that's ok.  The A/C didn't work, but it was my decision to just deal with it, and didin't know that it would be such a hot night in late October.  But I'm sure that they would have switched me had I asked, so that one is on me.  Back to the Valet issue.  Valet parking is for when your parking needs to be maximized during peak season, not when your hotel is at 30-50% capacity in the offseason or midweek.  This is a major issue for us and was for some other guests we met at the pool who told us they'd been coming here for 20 years and would probably not be coming back next year because of this!  For summer, fine, but offseason, let people park their own cars.  If you want to charge for parking, have a more reasonable amount per day of say $6 or $8.  We just parked a 3 minute walk away on Legion st a block in from the coast hwy and saved the $20 + tip.  Other than the A/C, valet parking cost...it was an enjoyable stay and I would likely book there again.  BTW, my kids loed playing ping pong at the table by the pool.  And just another sidenote, they have two pools, and the biggest jacuzi I've ever seen =)

Stay here if you are vacationing on a budget in Laguna. It is not overly expensive, but still cost some coin for a descent room and it has a on site restaurant which opens for breakfast/ brunch at 8am daily. Keurigs are conveniently offered in every room.

I have been both a guest here as well as put up corporate groups here for meetings and have never had a dissatisfied guest.  Not going to say there haven't been mishaps, because there have, but what makes the difference in a good hotel is the level of professionalism that they exercise when addressing & correcting the issue,  and Pacific Edge has never let me down. The sales staff is incredibly friendly and very eager to help you in any way they can.  Many of the sleeping rooms are renovated and I believe they are working to have all of them renovated eventually.  What I like (as well as  the guests I've booked there) like best about this hotel is the fact that it is not your standard "cookie cutter" hotel.   The property consisted of different hotels and houses that were purchased and transformed into hotel rooms. apartments, lofts, etc.  You almost feel like you are part of a community here.  The views are breathtaking & the location couldn't be more perfect, walking distance to everything including a grocery store.  The beach is private and they have a great Restaurant called The Deck that has live music and really tasty food.  I live locally and sometimes like to stay a night there just to feel like I am on vacation.  I highly recommend this hotel.  If you are looking for a 5 star Ritz Carlton hotel, this is probably not the place for you, but if you are looking for a laid back beach experience you will not be disappointed..

A nice place, since it is fronting  the ocean.  We got a very good deal on the "penthouse," with a view of the ocean. However, the view was obstructed by other hotel buildings, and although we were told we would be the only ones on the top floor, there was actually another occupied room.  The bed was wonderfully comfortable.  The staff was helpful, but there were no decks chairs on the balcony, and when we asked for some, they brought up funny little chairs.

I haven't stayed at this hotel, but wanted to say how awesome the manager there was last Saturday night, 9/15/12. We went to a wedding that day down the street & lots of folks stayed at this hotel, so we all got picked up/dropped off by the limo shuttle here. The limo driver was s/to pick us up and bring us back to the hotel at 830pm, but was MIA, so I called to ask the front desk to pls look for him and send him to us (some people waited an hour for this guy). The manager said he wasn't there, but asked HOW he could help us---I was so thankful, and he was going to call us all cabs to come to our location to help us out! I am impressed when people go out of their way to help others, thanks so much & give that guy a raise (sorry I forgot his name...Brian? lol)!!!

So after all the stuff we were having problems with in my last review my wedding reception turned our rather nice. The location is beautiful and if I was going to do it again I would not change my mind on the location.  The food was great as well as the staff. I would highly recommend doing your event here but just really keep an eye on the details and follow up with your event planner to make sure everything is running as you planned.  Look forward to seeing you guys again.

Absolutely love this hotel! Has such a great beachy & artsy vibe! I have stayed here once before in the spring time, and of course laguna's beautiful weather went along great with our beach front room! I booked a room for NYE tonight and am not sure who worked reservations... but the man was super friendly and accommodating! I  would have to say this is my favorite hotel in Laguna!

We stayed here for our 25th anniversary this week, and it simply could not have been a better experience for us. We felt personally cared for by every single member of the staff, valet to front desk to housecleaning. It was a wonderful time.The original reservation was for an ocean view room during the season. It was a little pricey, we thought at the time, but hey, anniversary and all, so we went for it. I signed up to be notified if an upgrade to a different, first choice room, became available. I got a phone call a week or two later, and because of being busy did not call back for a week or so. I am so glad I did!We got the new room, and a few days after that I got a phone call that due to their error (they oversold the room) we were being upgraded again to the reef tower, room 115. Not knowing what this meant, we said sure, thanks, see you soon. Wow, what a room!!Top floor, truly on the water, or more precisely over it, an unimpeded view of the entire Pacific ocean. Wrap around balcony, private balcony at that, a three room suite: kitchen, parlor, and bedroom. Such an excellent room.We got priority cleaning so we could check in early. Sometimes that means they sweep things under the rug. Not here. Great cleaning, everything was where it needed to be, restocked completely, just right!We went out to lunch, valet brought our bags up to the room, and then we roosted. No need to go out anywhere. Front desk called twice to ensure we were happy. We asked, they provided right away. Great service!Yes, some of the paint was peeling from the balcony. And yes, the handle for the bathroom sink was stiff to work. Truly no big deal, and certainly not enough to detract from this great experience.I wish you to have even 2/3rds of our time, It will be just about your best hotel time ever.

If you are looking for a frat house experience in a second rate motel that thinks it's a four star ocean front resort, this is the place for you! We are seasoned travelers who used a Groupon for one night and, trust us, no matter the deal this place is awful! Paper thin walls, loud rude guests with no awareness of other guests. Lots of partying into the night, little to no security and very motel like rooms. Dirty looking worn carpet, old fixtures etc. The bed was comfortable with nice sheets and Kim at check in was VERY nice and welcoming - others at the front desk not so much. New bar "The Deck" is nice. The ocean front rooms are right on the water but much more pricey and same condition as the other rooms. Old and worn out. Casey at the $24 valet was also very nice but all in all, we say, STAY AWAY. There are many places to stay in Laguna, don't bother with a place that bills itself as "upscale" but it is anything but. Location is nice but this is nothing but an old campus style motel with an attitude.

I make a trip from San Diego once a year to Laguna Beach to relax and enjoy the artsy town. This year I was very disappointed with the Hotel. I have stayed at the Pacific Edge since it was Vacation Village years ago. Since our stay last year they raised their rates by what seems like 25%, they are now charging $20 a day to park on the property. The rooms are still outdated but now they are charging you extra for the "oldness". The room that we stayed in was the most god awful yellow you have ever seen, the TV didn't work which wasn't a huge deal because we didn't go up there to watch TV but while my fiance was getting ready on Sunday morning it would've been nice to catch up on some Football. We will continue to go to Laguna Beach for an annual adventure, we'll just be staying somewhere beside the Pacific Edge Motel...

Note to the handicap, no handicap parking and no elevator!  I have stage 4 cancer and 1 lung and climbing 3 flights of stairs was NOT fun!  For no elevator, the staff could've been a tad bit nicer.  The greatest thing about this place, aside from the ocean is the mini fridge! The freezer works, thank God!

Meh! I've definitely experienced better!  It's basically a 1960's apartment complex/motel with the Joie De Vivre label.  The furniture also appeared to be from the 60's as everything was in a dilapidated state!  For the price, I expected much, much nicer!  I would pick somewhere else if you plan to visit Laguna Beach!

So I've seen some of the other reviews and was kind of worried but I've stayed at several other JDV hotels and decided to chance it.  I reserved a beach front room and upon arrival received the complimentary upgrade to the Villa, think your own beach house as your hotel room.  The villa was amazing living room, dining room and "kitchen" down stairs and bedroom, giant bathroom, and giant closet plus another room upstairs.  The one draw back of this room is that the resturant The Deck is right outside and it's a little noisey but they close at 10pm so it wasn't ever a problem.  We left for a bonfire the first night and when we returned the complimentary bottle of wine for being a joy of life club member was in our room.  (we forgot about that so it was a nice surprise)I could see how others would call it a motel as the property itself looks older.  I would definitely suggest spending the extra money to get the oceanfront room...there's nothing like waking up to the sound of the waves crashing.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, maids and room service were also friendly and accomodating.  We were there for 4 days so decided to not pay the $20/day valet and though it was difficult on Saturday night we were able to find street parking and probably paid about $5 to the meters the entire time we were there. Another perk is the hotel is very close (walking distance) to lots of shops and resturants and if you don't want to walk there's a free trolley (i think only in the summer though) Overall we were very satisfied with our stay at Pacfici edge and will definitely be returning...we'll just have to figure out how to get that complimentary upgrade every time :)

Since a 2 star rating is a "Meh. I've experienced better", I would still consider staying at Pacific Edge again.  We stayed during the week of August 5th 2013.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating!  The valet attendant, Johnny, gave us some very good local restaurant recommendations that we did take advantage of.  The check in process took a while since we arrived prior to check in time.  We weren't able to check in until slightly after the check in time. The first room (room 25) was very small and cramped and not at all updated.  My wife was extremely disappointed at the decor and the age of the room itself.  It felt very, very old.  What made it worse was that there is an adjoining room that houses a larger number of guests.  The adjoining door had a least an 1.5 inch gap between the bottom of the door and the floor which meant that every conversation coming from that room could be clearly heard.  To no fault of the guest, we were unable to sleep until we actually had the night manager come into the room so that he could hear how loud and un-insulated (is that a word?) the room is.  When 11:00 PM rolled around we had to call the front desk to have security request the next door guests to keep it down.  We could hear the conversation that the security had with the guests and they were completely understanding and even commented to the hotel security that the room had thin walls.The night manager promptly assisted us in procuring a different room for the rest of our stay.  The next day we stayed in room 61 and it was similiar size however more recently renovated.  It was soooo much better! And even with that room being closer to the restaurant, we were able to hear the band playing through the wall however no where near as annoying.  The bathroom was renovated as well and also the TV.  We were able to enjoy our stay for the rest of our vacation.  The staff did an outstanding job is making sure we were comfortable!  The pools were great!  The proximity to the beach was amazing!  The restaurant, The Deck, had average food at best even though I should really ding them harder for serving Kraft Mac & Cheese to my daughter *we're in Laguna Beach for crying out loud!  Step your game up!  We did appreciate the complimentary towels and lounge chairs that they have set up on the beach for their guests.  Now that I am more aware of the local parking regulations, I will find street side parking since the hotels dailyvalet rate is almost $25.00 per day...that is outrageous!  We cannot complain about the proximity to all the local restaurants and art galleries!  We were able to walk to most of the restaurants that we ate at and gave us an opportunity to do a short walk back to the room...Great location!

It's a nice hotel for the money. I would recommend upgrading to an ocean view room, it's worth it, and it doesn't cost that much more...$100 more, I think.  The room was basic, nothing really fancy, but it did smell a little moldy...or maybe "beachy"?  I'm not sure.  But the beds were very comfortable.  I would probably stay there again.

Booked a room on Expedia for a decent price. Ocean view rooms are much more. We really just wanted a place to clean up for dinner and crash after a night in Laguna. The room was in Bahia (old apartments "converted" to rooms). We thought the room was cute, but it was not up to standards for the price. Lots of space, but very odd. Popcorn ceiling, very old stove in the kitchenette, cables to router and TV exposed, bed was in a separate space and the TV was in the main room (no TV from bed - that was a first), very skinny bathroom, weak AC (they brought a fan to help), cord down the wall for a hanging light, tinny table for two in a big space, just to name a few. Hotel Impossible guy would have had a field day. Layout of the property is different. Can't really tell what is part of the hotel. Not your standard beach resort, but that's Laguna (not a lot of space). That said, the location is great. The Deck and the Beach House are right on the property, and the beach is just down the stairs. Easy walk to main beach and all of the galleries. Might try a beach view for the right price, might look around and try something new.

Not worth the $200+ a night. Beach is full of seaweed that they leave to attract many flies so your relaxing time in the sun consists of swatting flies & your sunscreen is bug spray. TV wouldn't work due to loose connections & the 2nd call we made to lobby was for the shower that didn't work. Parking fees are outrageous per night & beds are not too comfortable. Lounge chairs are hard plastic & in no way comfortable but other than that.... Nice place lol

I told myself I would never sign up for yelp to leave a negative review about someplace, but staying here for 1 night made me throw that right out the window.I bought the groupon for my lady and I's anniversary, expecting a nice little getaway at a reasonable price. Boy was I wrong!!!The room wasn't bad, though I was expecting to be somewhat near the ocean, I'll let that slide. What they fail to mention is that you HAVE TO pay them $24 for their valet to park your car, otherwise you gotta use parking meters and pay $4 every 4 hours.I was glad to see they had a mini kitchen with a fridge and oven in the room so we planned on staying in and cooking something for dinner our night there. Well as it turns out the oven was a POS and burned what we were cooking, causing the smoke alarm to go off and filling our room with the smell of burned food. Great. I aired it our and rather then complain to the front desk we just went out and ate somewhere else.Even after all that I wasn't too disappointed with our stay until I got home and checked my credit card bill and realized I was charged $200 for some reason. I call to find out it was for a smoke cleaning fee. I explained the situation and the fact I don't smoke, and "the manager wasn't in" so i have to call back Monday to try and get a refund.I see that the manager replies to a lot of reviews on here, so I expect this situation to be fixed, but if not I will come back and update what happened.

I stayed there on 9/6/13 and was very disappointed. The location is excellent, close to nearby shops and the beach but unless you fork out for a renovated Beach Front Villa, or Bungalow I don't think the hotel will match up with its fabulous location. I had a Village room and even if that were set on the beach the views couldn't make up for how dumpy and depressing my room was. I was in Room 55 of the Surf Tower. It was small and tucked away on the side of the building facing the stairway of the next building. When I walked in the room reeked of pot despite being a smoke free room. It was small, plain, no color, gray, and just felt overall old and run down. The furniture looked newer but you can put nice furniture in a dumpy room and it's not going to make it any better. The place could use some sprucing up, inside and out. I was surprised when I pulled up because the photos make the place look so nice and renovated on the outside. Truth is the building looks old and dirty. Time was taken around the lobby entrance but as you fan out to the rest of the hotel it looks like a step above a dive. I could've accepted that if my room was nice, clean, and thoroughly renovated. Seems as if they just threw a few pieces in just to make it new but they didn't complete the job. Then they push it off as a boutique hotel. The carpets were hideous and felt weird on my feet. I ended up wearing flip flops the whole time. Head board was loose. The bathroom needed updating. Could use some color. The sink looked nice but the shower/tub wasn't the nicest thing to look at. The grout was dirty and chipping in spots. The shower went from hot to cold to hot and back to cold in seconds. I got hypothermia and 2nd degree burns in minutes. Walls were paper thin. The air conditioning worked well and the TV was okay but the lack of entertainment options wasn't appealing. WiFi sucked and could barely be reached in my dungeon of a room. I don't know how the other rooms fared but you can't beat the location of this place. You just have to be willing to deal with some of their issues. On the positive side the staff was friendly and helpful. The valet staff was also friendly but I did have an issue with the $24 valet fee to just park it around the corner. I think this hotel is taking advantage of its fine location with their rates but they don't deliver on the overall experience. I would probably try it again if I had the money to do a Beach Front Villa or something upgraded. I'm sure more care were put into those rooms but based on what I've read overall, I'm not too sure now. My room served it's purpose but it was not the relaxing time I expected. At a comparable rate I'd probably try somewhere else.

Yikes. This was not what I had expected. Booked a room for 4 people but had only towels, cups, coffee etc. for 2. Floors were sticky and dirty. Bathroom clearly had not been cleaned. Electrical outlets kept blowing out. I can deal with a room that's outdated, but this was just dirty and gross. Yes, it's on the beach and that's nice, but having to ask for towels, cups etc when the reservation clearly said how many were in our party is just sad. The staff was great but I wouldn't recommend this place at all.

I stayed here for 4 nights and I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is right on the beach and there is a private beach for hotel guests only. They have chairs, towels, and umbrellas all set up for you. The hotel staff seemed quite nice. The only con I would say is you have to pay $27 per night for valet parking. I didn't see anything on their website stating that there was a parking fee so it was a surprise when the lady at the lobby told us that the hotel does not have it's own parking lot. Even with the parking fee it was still less expensive to stay at this hotel than any other beachfront place in the area. The rooms were clean and obviously decorated with a beach theme. The location is within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

Wife and I stayed here for a getaway and really enjoyed it. Yes, the room was small but its beach-front in Laguna. From the front desk to the beach-chair-guys to the maids, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.

We came to this hotel to celebrate my Mom's birthday. I did have a voucher for an Ocean Front room which I exchanged for a less expensive room for 2 nights. The reservation clerk booked my two night stay and when I checked in, the front clerk confirmed my voucher was for 2 nights in the Apartments.  I was later charged for one night but after communication with Sean, the manager, he immediately straightened everything out and my card was refunded.  The rest of our stay was fine.

Love this place. Great guest services, free buckwheat and/ or memory foam pillow, reasonable prices, clean (!), and kitchenette included with many rooms. Right on the beach, walking distance -via beach or road- to all the shops, Ralphs (for stocking your kitchenette), and restaurants. We were there for a wedding at Hotel Laguna, and while most of our family stayed there and were very unhappy with their old moldy rooms, we paid quite a bit less and ended up with this:An updated beach motel, with a mix of funky modern, surfy, and tranquil design aspects. Sounds weird but it totally works.I enjoyed the pool area, with the hot tub and game room. My only complaint is that you have to shimmy around the pool because the area is fairly small. (I dropped my phone in the pool doing this, but in all fairness, I was trying to shimmy and text message at the same time.)FYI- there is no room service, but a great taco shop- Taco Loco- right across the street, and it stays open late.

I changed my rating from 4 to 2 because of my most recent experience. My boyfriend and I just came back from the East Coast and had a hard week. We decided that all we wanted in life at that moment was to go to Laguna and breathe in the sea air. We have been to Pacific Edge before and found the views to be exactly what we needed. We booked our king ocean front room online. On the day of our arrival, I get a call from the front desk receptionist at 11:30am that they overbooked the hotel and they do not have the room that we paid for. I've been to the property before so I know that any other room is not going to meet my expectations. I give her credit for trying to give me options but seemed a little annoyed that I kept pushing back on the fact that I would not accept a mediocre room. She offered me a room at their sister hotel in Huntington Beach. I am not a fan of Huntington Beach. I lived there and I didn't feel like dealing with drunk 20 year olds wearing tap out shirts and calling each other Bro. What I wanted to do is go to my sleepy little Laguna get away and relax. We ended up taking the hotel in Huntington. The hotel met my expectations but the overall experience did not. We had to drive to Laguna to accomplish the activities we originally set out to do.We visited some other locations in Laguna while we were there that can hopefully hold up their end up of a hotel booking agreement for our next anticipated getaway. Not a happy camper for sure.

If twilight zone circa 1963 isn't your gig, find another motel er hotelThe view over the ocean (you could spit into the Pacific) and location are solid A plus...the accommodations...C minus....but who spends time holed up in their room (except for the "essentials") so close to paradise...use from here to eternity as inspiration....Based on what others report, we paid more than most....so buyer beware....and where is the room pictured?? That may have been worth $250 per night.

We do love pacific edge and have been visiting the property for over forty years since before it was bought by Joie properties.  Recently they made changes so the first floor deck is no longer rooms but a party venue. We recently stayed on the second floor just above this deck and found the late afternoons/evenings VERY noisy- as well as the mornings they began to move all the furniture and sweep at 7am.  It took away from the beach sounds and relaxing mornings for sure!  If you go, get a room away from this deck!

Stayed in a two bedroom apartment for a staycation at the beach. Everyone is so friendly and hardworking! Great front desk assistance, valet attendants, and beach attendants. The hotel is on beach and the beach attendants setting up chairs, umbrellas, and towels for you were the best! This isn't the Ritz, but for the price and the ocean view we had it was a great place for families to stay and walk around and enjoy Laguna. My daughter cried when it was time to go home. We'll be back I told her.

This hotel only earned 1 star. And the only reason it even gets 1 is because of the great staff. They accommodated my every need quickly and pleasantly, but the bad news is that I had to contact them 4 different times for things that were wrong. It all comes down to details and unfortunately, this hotel was sloppy at bestFirst, when I checked into my room, it was overlooking the parking lot. Ok, no biggie, not going to ruin my vacation. The rooms are outside rooms and I was staying by myself, so I didn't feel all that secure. Then I noticed there was no security lock inside the room for me to latch the door with. Icky. But still ok, not going to ruin my vacation. Then, I went to order room service - No menu in my book. Ok, no big deal, I'll call and have one delivered. 30 minutes later (and starving) no menu delivered. So I walked up to the front desk and they immediately gave me one stapled together and photocopied. When I called to order, apparently this menu was out of date and some things (that I wanted) they didn't have anymore. Ok, I can be flexible. Then I wanted a nice glass of wine - nope - can't order any alcohol. BUMMER. Food was excellent I have to say. The restaurant onsite is the Beachhouse. Food was great and they delivered it in about 20 minutes! Ok, time to go to sleep - wait, no bedside lamps for me to read my book by. Just overhead flourescents. Hmmmm. I then go to slide the clock on the bedside table over closer to me and discover it's odd and far away placement was to cover up a big hole in the top of the nightstand. Now I'm starting to feel like I'm staying at a Motor Lodge.Then tried to order a movie and the the TV wouldn't turn on. So I called the front desk and the maintenance guy said that with the A/C on in the room, the back of the TV's froze up. Hmmmm. I wasn't using the A/C, but ok. Whatever. He got it working.My room was also butted up against another room with a connecting door. I could hear my neighbors clearing their throats. So, I slept with ear plugs which made me a little nervous considering there was no security lock on the inside of my door as mentioned before. Bed was comfy. Got up the next morning and after breakfast wanted to indulge and take a nap before heading to the beach. Cue the bandsaw directly across the street. A construction crew was working on the property directly in front of my room. Here is where the staff come into play: they switched my room to a new one immediately and it was a HUGE suite. It was the only one they had left and gave it to me for the same price. Nice. But upon checking in to that room here is what I noticed:A huge hole above the TV in the bedroom where the cable was being spliced in from upstairs TV the molding was peeling off of the baseboards in the bathroom, the mini blinds in the bedroom and bathroom were all bent and hanging crooked, a lightbulb in the bathroom was burnt out, the reception on the TV in the bedroom was all fuzzy and the movie I was watching suddenly cut out and I couldn't get it back. I had to call maintenance and they came and fixed it. That made the reception get better too, there was a HUGE full kitchen in this place and not one single pot, pan, plate or utensil to cook with. You had to request everything you thought you might need. I took pictures and would love to upload them here, but I don't know how. :( Like I said, it's all about the details and this little hotel just didn't cut it. For $250/night plus $20 valet parking, I expected much more. I will not go back. Even for the great location. I'd rather stay further from the water, and feel a bit taken care of.

For 250+ per night, I had higher expectations. We had an ocean front room, which is the way to go here, but it was directly over The Deck, which was so loud at night we couldn't hear the ocean waves, just dance music and people laughing and chattering. Room 502 is NOT relaxing. I could have stayed at home and had a more relaxing evening. The room is fairly dingy and the sheets are a bit pilled and rough. Shower head is small and basic and the attention to detail is nonexistent. I could have dealt with the room because the porch and view is so beautiful, but trying to fall asleep to the party below was just too much to bear. We checked out early and headed home to nap.

HUGE FAN!I was in town for one night on a business trip.  I booked the hotel the morning of, and got a decent rate from Hotels.com.  This place was fantastic.  The service was good, the location is within walking distance to anything I needed.  The room was small, but overlooked the ocean.  You could tell it was an older hotel that has been re-modeled, but they have done a nice job. Very clean, neat, and comfortable!  I was able to open my window and hear the waves crash all night and morning.I will definitely stay here again if I visit for business or a vacation.  The staff is very friendly, the hotel is a great deal for the location, and it is very cute (quite "beachy" if you know what I mean)GREAT EXPERIENCE.

I would give -5 stars if I could. This place is a scam. The pictures of the rooms look great but reality is something totally different. First of all we got village room instead of sea view room and paid 250$ for night. The "hotel" is more like a shitty motel. Bathroom had mold (you can see it and they didn't even bother cleaning it), electricity blugs don't work, tv does not work and is from the 80's. They came to replace the tv and had to clean it first before touching it. The room is noisy and ac drips water all over the place. Come on guys...250$ for a night is outrageous for this place. Please do not come here and get disappointed.

5 stars goes to the front desk staffs especially the gentleman who helped us on Thanksgiving evening when we checked in for our 4 days stay. He did a great job  to make sure my family have a nice stay at Pacific Edge. The sunset from our Bahia room was awesome. I suggest to book an apartment unit, walk to Ralph's (half block), make dinner and have dinner overlooking the beautiful Laguna Beach sunset. We  enjoyed our morning walks along the beach which was only steps from our room. The only downside was the valet parking but overall we will definitely come back again.

The location was great.  We stayed here during November and so it was easy to find street parking and avoid the $20 valet charge.  Our room was nice and updated and the bed was comfortable and clean.  My only complaint is that the TV was kind of old and sort of awkwardly teetering on the dresser so you could see it while laying in bed.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  We enjoyed ourselves and the staff was excellent.

Great location in Laguna Beach.  Definitely go for an oceanview ... otherwise you'll likely be deeply disappointed.  We've been staying in this location for a few years running each summer ... it always seems as if it's a work in progress.  The rooms are adequate in a motelish sort of way ... defintely in an older property in need of some serious upgrading.  But on-beach access to the surf and sand makes it all good.  It's also easy walking distance to some very good restaurants.

Stayed here while visiting Laguna Beach.  Great views and great staff.  They have great staff.  Only draw back is you have to Valet park, but I think that is pretty standard for most hotels in the area.  Will definitely look into staying here again.
