Was in Laguna and last minute decided we wanted to stay the night, went on Expedia and this place was actually the best deal. Payed about $80 for a single queen sized bed room. The guy at the front desk actually upgraded us and our room also had a kitchen, huge dining room table, sitting area with couches, nice bathroom, and a balcony over looking the ocean. The room was extremely nice and very clean as well. Couldn't figure out something about the TV so we called downstairs and within seconds someone was at our door and fixed it right away. Perfect location, right on the beach and within walking distance to just about everything. In the morning, didn't realize check out time was 11 and not 12 but they extended our check out time no problem at all. Definitely five stars.

I would stay here again happily. The staff was amazing, genuine, kind and gave excellent recommendations for everything. The room, ocean front with balcony, was charming but I have to be fair that it was a tiny bit run down. Room service, on my little balcony with surf crashing and a cloudless day was not only delicious but something I look forward to doing again.

Got a village room, which was on the beach side but faced the pool for $160.  We had to pay a mandatory $20 for valet parking even though they just parked the car like 10 feet away from where we were standing when we picked it up.  The place felt like a remodeled motel, but the location was ideal. Everything was in walking distance.  I highly recommend making the walk to the rooftop lounge at La Casa del Camino for a drink during sunset.

We had a great stay at this hotel.  The thing that stood out to me the most was the incredible service.  From the valet to guest services to the cleaning crew, everyone was eager to help and wanted our stay to be fun.  We came here for my sister-in-law's bachelorette party and we knew we would have other guests meeting us, so they made sure we had plenty of wrist bands to enjoy their ammentities.  Also we were pleasantly surprised when we got a bottle of complimentary champagne delivered to the room.  We stayed in the family accomodation village rooms.  It consisted of a queen bed in one room and two doubles in the other.  There were 2 bathrooms, a small kitchenette, and plenty of space.  i thought based on other reviews that it was going to extremely tiny, but it wasn't.  We had plenty of room for several girls to hang out and get ready.  Yes, the village rooms are a little older, but they were CLEAN and still close to the beach.  We stepped out and we had a partial view of the ocean.  It is in a good location where we were able to take the trolly or walk to several locations.  Again, the service was incredible!  Thank you for making my sister-in-law's party memorable!

The customer service at this place was out of this world.  The only complaint I have is that the rooms are very old, ours had old linoleum burnt in places and the carpet was dirty and old.  Other than that, the staff was excellent, the location is excellent and they give you chairs and umbrellas on the beach, there are restrooms and a beach shower (for sand) right at the beach entrance.  The village deluxe room we had had no AC for the bedroom and was over the valet/Beach house area which was very noisy.  The stove was from 1950 I think, but I asked for a microwave and they graciously brought one at no charge.  The great thing is that the resort has a restaurant The Beach House and a bar The Deck right on premises, so you can pretty much just park and never take your car out for the rest of your vacation.  Easy walk to the kids park and more stores and restaurants. Also, this hotel is right across the street from a grocery store!

OMG!!!!! What  A dump! $250 ...can we talk. A cell-over looking a parking lot, the only window that opened was a sliding door on to a public hall. Room dank, smellie and beat up. Nothing like the website.

let me start by saying that I have stayed in all kinds of hotels all over the world, including 3rd world countries, and the rooms in this place grossed me out! The lobby is deceiving, which is why those are the only photos you will find on the website. I live nearby and have stayed at this place twice, in two different buildings (both times not my choice- for friends events) and I swear I'll never stay there again. 1. The smallest showers of all time. One was a single person! 2. Mold. Covering the bathroom, and you could tell it had just been painted over multiple times. Gross! and totally bad for your health not to mention.3. The air conditioner was broken so every half our or so it would make an awful loud noise and continue for 10 minutes or so. Kept me up ALL night.4. There are not ice machines anywhere you can find them, nor are they on every level. You have to walk through multiple levels, down stairs, through the alley, and finally, you find the hidden ice machine.Honestly, the only good thing about this hotel is that that its ocean front, but even then you are staying in the crappiest room ever. Do yourself a favor, book at the Holiday Inn on bluebird, or at the Surf and Sand, or even at the Hotel Laguna. Anywhere is better than here, guaranteed.

I am a huge Joie de Vivre fan and have stayed at many in the Bay Area. So when I traveled to Laguna Beach I chose this hotel solely based on the JdV reputation. Unfortunately, this turned out to be one of my worst hotel experiences ever and I am so disappointed in JdV. Other than the stellar location and friendly front desk person, there are no other redeeming values. Unless you pay hundreds of dollars for their renovated suites, you will be stuck in a room that was built in the 60's or 70's and the walls are paper thin. We did not get a wink of sleep that night because of the people constantly walking by and the extremely loud traffic on the PCH. When we asked to speak to a hotel manager the next morning, there was not one available but they promised someone would call. It's now a week later and still no phone call. If I were JdV, I would be ashamed to put my name brand on this hotel until the entire hotel is up to date.

A dingy, 60's or 70's style hotel with updated details. Don't expect a nice fancy place. It's not. Parking can be a real hassle unless you want to pay for valet. We did not, and ended up parking about 5 blocks away on a side street in front of a house that was being remodeled. With a trailer there was no other option for us. We got a room for 45$ on priceline so it was acceptable for one night, but after staying at a 3 1/2 star hyatt with rooms twice as big, unbelievable views and excellent complimentary parking for the same price it was a stretch.

It's safe to say that I'm a pretty stressed person. It's not easy for me to "let go" and enjoy relaxation time, but it took NO EFFORT to do that at Pacific Edge Hotel! My boyfriend and I visited Laguna Beach for the weekend, for his birthday. I'm so glad we did. We both had such a great time. We rented a "beach front room," at a pretty affordable price. It was definitely worth every penny! The front desk staff was super friendly and accommodating too. They seemed to remember all of the guests, so it wasn't like you had to "start over" every time you walked up there. There's a taco bell right next door, and a ralphs right across the street, so you don't have to feel obligated to spend a bunch of money on "Laguna Beach" food. They do, however, offer fine dining options, and GREAT room service! The hotel offers valet parking ONLY, so that is both a plus and a minus. It makes it very convenient, but costs $20 / night. I only gave the "sleep quality" 3/5 because I was woken up at various time in the middle of the night by random teenagers yelling and laughing on the beach, right outside my window. I don't blame the hotel for that, but they do have very thin windows. This is also sort of a plus though, because you can fall asleep to the sound of the ocean (without having to leave the window / door open), which is very relaxing. Overall, I would say this trip was a very worthwhile experience. I will definitely be visiting there again!

My family stayed here for the 4th of July weekend and we had a GREAT time! The rooms are a little on the small side, but we expected that, but it was clean and everything was in nice order minus the tv that needed to be updated, but who needs it when you are at the beach! Views were gorgeous and the pools were nice and heated. The best part was the staff, they were OUTSTANDING! From Brian at the front desk who provided my daughter with a gift bucket with all fun goodies when we checked in, to Stacy who provided another Pacific Marine Mammal Seal on our return after my daughter lost hers at dinner and was devastated. They also had lots of fun activities all through the weekend including arts and crafts, a movie at the pool, complimentary drinks etc. The director of security/valet was extremely nice and helped with an issue with the people staying in the adjacent room from us and was very attentive to ensuring we had a wonderful stay. The beach attendants were really nice and were sure to hold our chairs while we went to the pool for a bit. The DECK restaurant just opened so there wasn't much to offer on the menu but I'm sure if we come back in a few months there will be, it was packed and on a wait so we didn't go there but I have had great experience at the JDV hotel restaurants and am sure the food was probably great. I would DEFINITELY stay here again, wonderful location and fabulous staff. THANKS!

Awesome little hotel on the water in Laguna near main beach.  We had an ocean front room.  Crashing waves nice sunset, bottle of wine provided by hotel, great experience, will stay again and have already recommended it to family.  Definitely get the ocean front room.  Nice large jacuzzi as well.  I recommend eating at Watermarc two blocks away.

I had a room with one queen bed. I could hear the ocean but didn't have a view room.   Room had no chairs. The refrigerator was too large for the  cabinet which should then have been used as a desk station.  Wrong furniture.  Good location for beach access.

We have stayed at other JDV hotels and simply loved the funky chic vibe and so it was a no brainer to book this one!  We arrived around 9 pm in early march, brrrrrr, and were shown to our sweet little room, that had NO heat. Seriously. Nada. After calling the desk we we're told they would bring a heater.  After 1 hour and no heater, we called again.  Apparently they were out of heaters and were moving us.  The new room was much larger, and had heat. Unfortunately it also had exuberant valet parking attendants and a lovely jack hammer outside the door at 7 am. :-(. So our sweet respite on the beach was dashed. However when I mentioned all of this at checkout they waived my $24 valet parking fee and credited 1/2 the room cost making the total out of pocket just $50. We then retired to the deck restaurant for breakfast and spent that $50 on an overpriced, yet delicious breakfast for two on a lovely beach. We will come back, but we will be sure to ask about ongoing renovations and...heat!

It depends what you want.  The hotel complex is actually pretty large and has rooms that face PCH then go all the way down to the beach and everything in between.  decent attempts at updating but you can tell it's an older place.  Overall our room was clean and spacious and the bed was clean and comfortable.  The location is great and you are on the beach (or close to it).  Two pools and one hot tub, both are decent and they leave towels out for you.  They have a towel and chair service for you on the beach at no extra charge, it gets busy early.  The service was great and the staff really were great.  I would return.

Simply put, this hotel is good value. Don't expect mind blowing service or luxury at motel prices.Do expect clean rooms, clean sheets, an amazing sunset view from any of the ocean front rooms (you can drink above the beach not on it!) and friendly, happy to oblige staff.Yes it's older, the decor is very "beachy" and the walk up the hill from downtown isn't really that bad. We had a large family staying in the room next to us with children and didn't suffer at all. We stayed here Sunday- Monday in January so that probably explains the availability of the rooms. The price puts it just out of range from most teenagers and party animals who end up staying at motels or Laguna Inn for partying it up.

My husband and I stayed overnight in a newly renovated oceanfront room for my birthday. After reading some of the poor online reviews and initial difficulty receiving confirmation of our online reservations and reaching staff by phone, I was more than a bit worried.  My fears were totally unfounded:  the room was beautifully decorated, the staff was friendly and very helpful and went out of their way to make my overnight birthday stay wonderful.  The view from the room was spectacular, even though it was an overcast day.  The hotel is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, so no need to take the car out once you valet.  We will definitely go back and recommend this hotel to family and friends. Truly wonderful.

Our experience with the hotel was pretty good. The room we had was weak. The view was great. RIGHT ON THE WATER so be prepared for surf sounds. The carpet needed a little attentention and the bathroom was very small. It is walking close to most areas and the Pools were both heated nicely. Our kids had a blast. It is not a resort but it is funky nice. The room we had was not like any of the pictures displayed on yelp. So, before committing check with the desk. The staff made sure we were well taken care of. Not in a hurry to go back as there are nicer places but a good value considering its location. Beds were comfortable but the room was small and as a result got cluttered easily with two adults and two children.  Its the right place to enjoy Laguna if your watching your dollars and want to be beachfront.

We had a package deal for two nights. Overall the staff and location are best part of this property.  The reception staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are old and small but I liked the beachy and retro vibe it had going on.  The location on a small, intimate part of the beach is outstanding - makes up for the old rooms. I mean come on, you're right on the beach, get your booty outside!  When you want a break from the ocean (tide can get a bit rough) the pool and hot tub are a nice touch. Complimentary lounge chairs, umbrellas and beach towels for guest use - yes!  We dined next door at the Beach House for an early breakfast - the setting, server and breakfast dishes were divine.  Hopefully as the property gains its footing they can reinvest some of the profit in to the rooms - get rid of the tube tvs to get some extra room space - and update/replace the creepy stained curtains.  I did ding them a a star because their valet staff kind of struggled - yeah, they were just lazy.  Overall, I'd return, good value and great location.

To be honest, when I first arrived at this place, my initial reaction was - What a ghetto place. From the outside, the lobby and the hotel seemed run-down with the paint peeling and the limited parking space. (Some of the rooms are in the back with a separate parking lot.) It seemed more like a motel than a "boutique hotel."However, my opinion changed instantly after I stepped into the lobby. It was modernly decorated, and the staff was super friendly. It was a holiday weekend, and the front desker was able to upgrade us to an ocean-view. How sweet was that!! The ocean-view room seemed old but that doesn't mean it wasn't charming. The room was very clean, comfortable, and had everything we needed.The location of the hotel was perfect. You can leave your car at the hotel and walk to the heart of Laguna as well as the beach. When I went, the hotel had this deal with some other restaurants in the area where if you show your room key, you can get a 10% discount. I'm not sure if that deal is still going on, but it's worth a shot at asking your front desker.

My husband and I had a great experience at Pacific Edge.  The key is to get an ocean front room.  The view is unbeatable.  There's just nothing like falling asleep to the sound of crashing waves.  The staff, particularly JP and Andrew, go above and beyond.  If you are looking for peace and quiet, I suggest going midweek or even better, mid-week off-season.

Waves are literally rolling up the sand under my balcony. The location and view is an easy 5 stars for the ocean-front rooms, with large floor-ceiling windows providing a sweeping view of the pacific and Laguna Cliffs..I don't think any other property is closer to the sand than this.Also within very close walking proximity to the main areas in Laguna Beach.Otherwise, the room itself is so so, small, relatively old, but my approach to accommodations this trip was all about location not about amenities as I wasn't planning on spending much time inside.The property itself seemed clean and the staff was helpful and polite.Again, amazing location and views, this is from room 116.

Such a gem!! It's not a big resort or super fancy hotel. But its a great place to stay with a fabulous location on the beach and in town with wonderful staff. Plus the restaurant / bar (The Deck) has an unbeatable view. I stayed in a room with a kitchenette which was spacious and comfortable. I know the beach front rooms have amazing ocean and sunset rooms but we did not stay in one. I'd highly recommend for the great value.

Stayed here for memorial day weekend. The hotel looks a lot nicer from the outside, but the rooms are great nonetheless. I would recommend this place to my friends. The review before mine is exactly what I would say.

I hate to give Pacific Edge only a 2 star rating but I just don't think it deserved any better. I am a Joie de Vivre member and stay at many of their hotels from Southern Cali to San Francisco. I've ALWAYS been impressed with their great boutiquey modern feel and the personal attention the staff gives you. I decided to stay in Laguna Beach for a weekend and saw the group had a hotel in Laguna so I assumed it was a sure thing it would be great. I was wrong!! The good thing about this hotel is it is right on the water, has a great restaurant with really delicious food and an outside deck that you can sit at night and enjoy a nice glass of wine or have dinner while hearing and watching the waves. The bad part however is even though they try to have the same modern boutiquey feel as their other hotels, this facility is old and small and ends up looking and feeling more like a motel 6. Their was a part of the carpet that was ripped and bathroom looked old and their was some rust in the corners, it just really looked like it needed a good remodel. I know most hotel rooms in Laguna are small but even with it being small I just expected a lot more from a Joie de Vivre hotel than this. If you go to Orange County I recommend you stay at the Shorebreak Hotel in Huntington Beach instead, that hotel is new, rooms are wonderful, and it defines more of what this group has to offer than Pacific Edge.

This place was a BIG DUMP! HIGH RATES, FILTHY ROOMS, and BAD SERVICE. Booked my room months in advance, and asked for a ocean front room. I did get ocean front, but I opened my curtain to an overlook of the resturant one floor below me, and the gaze of its customers back at me. My kids adjoining room's sliding glass door overlooked the pool, which was also one floor below. I complained, and moved rooms. All they could suffice was a horrid room witha great view of the parking lot. It had gross dirty carpet flooring, an old bathroom with a scary looking ceiling fan and grotesque pink tiles, and a kitchenette with absolutely NO utensil and a sink with a broken water faucet. Shame on you Joie de Vivre to say you remodeled your rooms. My son called your place the "Bates Motel !" Never, will I stay at any of your propeties again. I highly recommend disregarding this establishment, or rather, a disgusting shack, as a place for your stay in Laguna Beach, CA.

We were there for one night on May 24, 2014 for our mini weekend vacation. We were in room 31, which has two beds.  We checked in around 6pm.  Nice front desk staff, there was a newbie that was being trained at the time.  Our car was valet..  Lobby is somewhat updated.  There were some lounge chairs in front of the hotel, which was cute.  We dropped off our luggage and left without checking the condition of the room.  We went to the Deck for a drink and a free appetizer that offer from the hotel.  Nice restaurant location, upbeat atmosphere,  nice view of the beach, good appetizer -Quinoa ahi tuna...everything went down hill from there.  When we got back from our dinner (not at the hotel), we heard TV from the next room through the door next to our closet.  We decided to use the bed further away from the closet.  The bathroom was tiny..looked worst than Motel 6 bathroom..I have not been in Motel 6 for over 25 years; so I don't know if this comparison is fair or not..But it was really bad.  I am only 5 feet tall and I felt cramp in the bathroom.  There is an old plastic wall shower in the bathroom..bye bye my idea of soaking in the tub with my lavender bubble liquid soap.  Room 31 is a corner room right next to the stairway facing the street with two windows.  The street noise, people talking outside while we were trying to do "our thing"...did not work out well.  All night, we could hear the TV thru the door near our closet.  The bed was uncomfortable..Did I mentioned about the bathroom already...well there was no counter space for putting makeup on.  I decided in the morning to take a quick shower..skipped the hair wash ritual... and check out early.  Too traumatize to stay around.  We should have stay at Casa Laguna Inn & spa like we did last time.  Much nicer place with a huge spa bathtub. We were actually sorry that we left our comfort place to go to this dump for one night :(

Mixed reviews. I'd give 3.5/4 stars. You definiely have to stay in a renovated room, the other rooms should not be rented out - they are not in full working condition (light fixture, heat, etc.) and they are remodeling so you hear the construction during the day.  The manager Brian was very nice and provided some discounts that offset the costs but I think they should just not rent out any rooms in the Reef buildling.  Overall, staff was very nice and helpful.  Downside is The Edge restaurant doesn't answer their phone (wanted to order food to take to beach) (not hotels fault) , restaurant associated with hotel requires a $50 min (but manager offered to pick up if less than $50) and outside of building isn't updated but it's on the beach!  Location is awesome and beach guy who dishes out chairs, towels, etc. is awesome. Valet isn't great value but not more than any other hotel.  Recommend that you stay here but get a renovated room!

Awesome location and unbeatable views. The bed was comfortable and everything else was pretty basic. The best part- they had free salt water taffy in the lobby. I think I had 15-20 over my trip. Great for the price.
Incredible view from our room. even had a stove to make breakfast. Great service throughout the hotel

The only thing good about this hotel is the location and that they allow dogs. We booked an ocean front room with an adjoining room attached and neither were worthy of the price we paid.  The non ocean view rooms are extremely small with little to no character and NO view to speak of what so ever.   If you are going to update your hotel make sure to do the bathroom as well. Not pleasant.  The ocean front room had a small kitchen that was a bit dirty and without any glasses, utensils or cook wear.  We requested a late check out and they said it would not be possible because they were fully commited but we could pay a partial fee and stay till 6pm.  If your hotel is fully booked how could you offer a room to someone with a 6pm check out.  It is safe to say we will not be returning.

Booked an ocean front in the reef building and my wife and i were not let down!  the view is amazing.  The water literally breaks underneath the rooms at night.  staff was generally very nice, hotel itself is old, but most hotels in the area are.  Our room was just fine.  If you can spring for the ocean front room, i would def. go for it.  Reef tower is much more quiet, than the other two towers.

I just got off the phone Christina Lomonaco, the manager, and I was so amazed at her level of professionalism and courtesy!! We had gone to a birthday party at one of their bungalows last summer and we met her there. She came over to us and checked on us to see if we needed or wanted anything. The service was impeccable, the bungalow was so inviting and made the party just that much more incredible!! Now, it's our turn to make a reservation for my daughter's party at the Hobie bungalow and we are absolutely excited about it. Christina was extremely efficient in providing me with specific information as well as the weekday price for reserving a bungalow was not exorbitant. Her friendly demeanor made it easy to ask questions as she took the time to explain in detail what to expect. We look forward to having our daughter's party there and anticipate that the level of service will be impeccable as it has been before and on the phone. Thank you Christina, for making the reservation experience and the time that we've spent there already such a great and memorable one!!

If you can get an ocean front room, then this place is fabulous.  I've stayed here over the past 20 years and always had an ocean front room so I continued to return because the ocean view is unbelievable.  This week, I had a regular room (view to the street/parking lot) because the ocean rooms were  fully booked.  The room is disgusting.  It really is gross.    I don't want to walk on the carpet, the bathroom is icky, the room is horrible and nothing about this place would tell me to return.  If you cannot get an oceanfront room, do not stay here.  The staff are friendly and helpful but they cannot make the rooms any better.  Save your money and stay somewhere else.

What you have read about  only getting a partial or ocean view, is so true. We got a village view room that was the size of a nice size bathroom.  A window that didn't have any natural light and which is not ok with me since I'm a natural light freak.  I asked for a complimentary upgrade (doesnt hurt to ask) and they gave us one with a partial view of the ocean where we could hear the waves.  Room was fine (not my favorite furnishings) and a large spa tub....great but later on that evening, turned on the tv but it didn't work.  Maintenance came up to fix it twice, but finally they got another tv....great--until I saw TERMITES in the bathroom...that's right TERMITES.  So the next day (they didn't have anything to move into that late at night) they had another room, again with a partial view, up on a higher floor which gave us a nice view of the ocean.  This was fine but we only were staying 2 nights, so there was a lot of moving around to do for that amount of time.I would MAYBE stay here again, but only with a" Room with a View".

I had my wedding at the Villa this June and boy was it beautiful and exactly what my husband and I wanted!  We rented the entire Villa from 2 pm-10 am, had the ceremony on the deck overlooking the ocean, cocktail hour in the Villa, reception back on the deck, and dancing and the after party inside.  The great thing about renting the Villa for the wedding was that our guests were able to stay and party for as long as they wanted.  I liked that the venue felt more comfortable and intimate than almost all of the ballroom weddings I have been to; it felt more like an elegant house party- which fits more of my husband's and my style.  Most of my guests did stay at the hotel so they conveniently walked to their rooms at night's end.  In addition, my husband and I had our rehearsal lunch and goodbye breakfast next door at the Beach House, so everything was extremely convenient for all of our out of town guests and for ourselves as well as non-Laguna-ers.  As for G.M.'s critique, although rental fees for the Villa were pricey (as are almost all nice locales for weddings), I think she is referring to the quote given to her by the private catering company/ coordinator that the hotel recommends for wedding couples.  When I contacted the hotel about renting out the Villa for my wedding, I was contacted by this private company, At Your Service Caters, regarding planning the event.  I just assumed that they were part of the hotel since they contacted me.  It turns out that the hotel gave my info to this company who has catered and arranged events for the Villa for the past couple of decades.Well, I have some mixed reviews regarding At Your Service Caters.  Although in the long run I got a beautiful event that followed my vision and the recommended vendors were fabulous, I definitely had some problems with this company- like hidden fees (e.g. I had to pay extra for wine glasses even though wine was part of the dinner package) and their people not showing up to important events (once to a meeting, another to the rehearsal).  In retrospect, I am not sure if I would have worked with At Your Service Caters if I knew how unreliable they could be.  Then again, they ultimately gave me a beautiful event that on the day, seemed seamless.  Unfortunately, I had such limited faith on their abilities that I was so relieved on my wedding day that everything came together.  It was definitely unnecessary stress.In the long run, yes, rent out the Villa at Pacific Edge for your wedding.  It was very worth it.  But be weary of the catering company/ wedding coordinator the hotel recommends!  Bring your own vendors or ask a ton of questions and know exactly what you are getting before signing any contracts with At Your Service Caters.

My boyfriend and I stayed last night for valentines day. For the price he paid it was a really nice experience. we did not have an " ocean view" because its a little out of the price range but we could see the ocean from the balcony. Really nice view in the morning. I LOVED that there was a balcony with chairs outside. the room we had didn't look anything like the pictures. but it was decent. nothing over the top. but for  the price, a great deal. bathroom on the other hand can be worked on. shower curtain is out dated and the shower took forever to get hot water, tub looks a little old. kinda looks like a bathroom out of a motel 6. Anyways, we had dinner at the restaurant downstairs. the beach house. nice restaurant. A little pricey for the amount of food. My boyfriend paid 45 bucks for a lobster with almost no meat and a few clams and half a corn on the cob. I hate wasting money so I was a little disappointed. I got the filet mignon for 32 I think? it wasn't bad and it had an okay portion. I probably wouldn't go back. your really just paying for the view. Anyways back to the hotel, my boyfriend and I both agreed we would come back again. the service was great.

Do not stay here if you have a family or feel the need to talk after 9pm at night.  We stayed at the hotel (really more like a 2 star motel)for Thanksgiving and had 5 family members over to eat dinner and we were plagued by complaints all night.  The security guard paid a visit 3 times and told us that visitors were not allowed to eat in the room.  This place is outdated and the service leaves A LOT to be desired.  My kids were in the pool and the security person actually told them to keep the "Marco Polos" down.  This place is not only a rip off and they also police the place like a senior community.  This is the only hotel that charges for parking. They try to rip off any guest that has the unfortunate experience of having to stay there.  They should take a lesson from Laguna's other local hotels or go back to hospitality school to learn how to service their guests.  I have lived in Laguna for over 40 years and this place is so LAME that it gives Laguna a bad name.

The location of this hotel is ideal, and the rooms are clean and big with lots of pillows.  We fell asleep to the sound of the ocean waves every night.  We were a 2 minute walk from watching the waves crash onto the shore, and we're just a hop and skip away from the bars and restaurants of Laguna.  The hotel charges for parking, which I was not pleased about. Had I known about that, we may have stayed at a higher end hotel nearby that allows free parking.  (I had researched their website, and they said nothing regarding charged parking.  I should have just called.  My fault).  Even after being charged, one of the two nights of our stay we could not find parking and had to park on the street.  Luckily we found a spot on Cleo (nearby), but seeing as how I was displeased about having to pay for parking, it didn't sit too well when we couldn't find a space in the lot for which we were given a hotel parking pass.

This trip had been planned for three months. A family member even toured the property and found the staff very helpful and accommodating. I got a large ocean front suite with patio access to the beach. I spoke with the staff several times over that period to ensure there were no issues. (even two days before and the morning of check in and they never mentioned any problems) To my dismay when checking in, I was informed that we'd been moved to another room and that the entire lower level has been closed due to construction. They took me to the new room were it was smelly, the carpets were old, the fridge looked like it was from the 1940's, the hallway stank and the construction noise was deafening and scheduled to go on the entire week of my stay. We choose not to stay and found other accommodations though the manager did try to resolve our issues with discounted room rates. (We were so turned off by the noise and disappointed that the hotel didn't even have enough common courtesy to inform us of the construction or the change in rooms when they had several opportunities to do so). I know there were others having the same issues as we did. I was lucky that I had the option to make other arrangements but know the hotel was banking that they had most guest over a barrel.

We stayed at the Pacific Edge last Saturday night, and had a wonderful time.  The staff was excellent and the room was as nice a room you could possibly get in this price range.  An ocean front for $150 per night with a very, very comfortable king-size bed.  We were very, very pleased and will return as soon as possible.  Not a Four Seasons, a beach hotel.  But a SUPER VALUE in an amazing location!!

Wow were do I start? This hotel has gone down hill since our last stay. We have stayed here quiet a few times in the past but this time was dreadful.  We went to check in and they said our reservation wasn't until the following day, our email stated the correct day. They found us some rooms for the night when we walked in it smelled of urine. It was disgusting our party ended up at another hotel that night.  We went back the next day (our trip was already paid for) my 8 months pregnant sister had to carry her luggage up four flights of stairs. Unfortunately we were unaware, as we were moving into our rooms and we did not know the elevator would keep break down the whole trip. I will say the rooms were better than what they tried to give us the first night but the decor looks like the owners thirteen year old daughter decorated. It is neon yellow/green with aqua blue walls, orange, cream and brown accents and white furniture. We laughed about it the whole trip so at least it was funny! They give you "towel cards" to get towels on the beach and they were out by 9:30 a.m.  luckily we had our own towels. My sister had a kitchenette room, she has a two year old, she had to pay $20 to have the use of pans, utensils and plates. Also we found out that they now have valet parking at $20 a night, which should have been conveyed at the time of our messed up reservation. They maids are supposed to come between 9-5 everyday for all of our rooms they came between 4-5 the first day, mine knocked at 5 and asked if I needed her. I laughed and said no. The customer service was horrible and I am shocked others said it was so good. Anytime we called to ask for anything it was as if we were asking for the world, except with Cindy from the front desk she was amazing!! On our last day we met a couple by the pool there reservation had been messed up too only the hotel had them leaving a day early. The location of this hotel is great and the beach itself is fantastic. If you must stay here I would strongly suggest verifying your reservations, several times, and making sure they have it right.

I am here at the hotel/motel right now, feeling trapped for one last night that has already been paid for on Bloomspot. Definitely not worth any amount that I paid for their best room ocean front view I accidentally saw the disgusting mattress that we have been sleeping on and I am sick to my stomach. I had to fix the cheap bedding with the lumpy mattress pad and to my horror saw that this mattress had been pissed on and who knows what else. The room has been painted a bold, bright yellow green, which for some reason doesn't photograph accurately on their website and appears inoffensive. However these paint colors are the opposite of restful and do not give off the surf 60's cool that is supposed to be happening here.  No one has come to our room as requested to drop off a blanket, replenish towels, or anything.  Cheap furniture, weird and ugly ineffective blackout drapes, uncomfortable deck chairs, offensive paint on the walls - okay I can tolerate it for a night or two but after seeing the mattress I had to tell all of you to avoid this place. Yecch!
